column2: ['Stamford Academy is the best High School I ever went to, and I am glad to have attended there. The administration as well as the teachers are a true blessing to this world.']

column1: Paterson Charter School for Science & Technology
column2: ['Its quest to help students learn and succeed.  The many programs offered by the school that helps students to learn and grow.  The diversity of students and faculty.  The high level placed on discipline.  The relationship between students and teachers that allows students to feel like they matter.', "I've been attending Paterson Charter School for Science and Technology since the fourth grade. I believe that the teachers who are hired and actually stick around really care for us kids/teens who live in such an unhealthy environment. My favorite thing about my school is that all of us students can relate to one another. We all come from the same struggle, we all know what it feels like to not drive the nicest car or live in the biggest house. One thing that PCSST can change is their discipline, a lot of the time students are getting in trouble for things that they should not be getting in trouble for, like not having all black sneakers, or walking up the wrong side of the steps.", 'Paterson Charter School for Science and Technology makes you feel at home, it becomes your second home and you become part of something bigger than just a school. My school is not like every school, this diverse school building was built out of a factory which is not what you expect from a regular school. Yes the outside may look wide and may look like a place of detention on the inside is beautiful. Filled with colorful narrow crowded hallways and friendly students . Every morning in morning assembly sitting in the squished bleachers and being able to share a smile with a person across the gym sitting on the other side of the gym in the bleachers is a daily thing for me. With the small population in the school this means seeing the same faces in the hallways, you create bonds with the staff members who treat you better than your family,  they care about you and they want you to become a better version of yourself which motivates us, this makes us feel welcomed and loved.', 'I like the fact that Paterson Charter cares about the students. They are a little strict on the uniforms, but that is normal for a charter school.', 'I have been in PCSST for about 4 years now, since freshman year. I got to meet a lot of people who I became close with and who have and still are helping to succeed in life.  There are people here that do care about you, you just have to be able to listen and understand them. These teachers and helpers will listen to you, you just have to treat them right, treat them with respect.', 'I am a junior at Pcsst, I started my sophomore year there and I feel the teachers help improve us and gets up ready for college. They’re very organized, but the food, I feel should be better.', "I've been going to this school for 8 years now, and the elementary and middle school are extremely efficient and well coordinated. However the high school is much less organized with every teacher leaving 2-3 years after they started, it can be tough to form a bond. They also don't offer as many AP classes as other schools and arent able to have the most qualified teachers to teach these high level courses.", 'I honestly wished I went to a different high school. The staff members are rude and most of them have an constantly attitude. Being at the school for four years was hell and it felt like the administration, and almost all staff member did not want to be there, and did not care for the students.', 'Small atmosphere and love the curriculum planned by teachers. It is also safe and everyone is like a family.', "I like the school counselors. They are always there for you. Some teachers are really good at their jobs, while others.. aren't. Overall, the school is average, the only thing that really sticks out is the sport teams because our boys basketball team is really good.", 'Paterson Charter School for Science and Technology, or PCSST, is a fine school. I have been here for my entire middle and highschool life. I can say that it is an easy school, allowing do overs on assignments. Because of that it is not so good for college readiness, but it is very fun. The students can be very interesting, and the teachers are mostly pretty good too. The school likes to get involved in multiple activities to engage the students, and the food is actually pretty good! However, there are no facilities of which to speak of, and some of the rules can be a little too restrictive at times. I still like the school all the same.', 'I went to that school since 6 th grade and it was a pleasure to be in it because the staff was so kind I wasn’t left alone take classes and get over with.', 'Paterson Charter School for Science & Technology was overall a great school. They focused on clubs and activities that would have students more involved  and prepare us for our future endeavors. On the other hand, the school and its staff members lacked the necessary tools to prepare students like myself for college. For example, throughout high school the only writing format I learned was MLA, but in college we utilize the APA or Chicago format.', "Paterson Charter School for Science and Technology has the potential to be a great school, but focuses too much on discipline rather than the student's education. They also fire teachers left and right so the students get stuck with whoever they could find on short notice during the summer. The school is also always lacking money and needs to find a way to get a budget for the things that deserve a budget.", 'Pcsst thinks they\'re high end .I\'m sorry but even if my mom was paying for my highschool education, I know damn well I wouldn\'t be treated like how Paterson charter does. They love to say how they prepare your child for college and stuff like that but in reality they dont. Most of us are not ready for college at all. The past grads of Paterson charter who actually went and graduated college haves a passing percentage of 4%. Now that\'s is just sad for a "charter school". How do you expect us to be well rounded self directed citizens if you treat us like where still in pre school with nap time? This school is simply awful. I really regret coming here. I wish I would have went to Passaic county tech or international high when I had the chance. I probably would have been better off at east side high. I wouldn\'t recommend sending your child to this wanna be "private institute". There are way more better Paterson highschools with far more opportunities and advantages after high school.', 'The school is very technologically advanced and the teachers really care about their students. The school is in a newly renovated building. The only thing that concerns me is the food and the environment surrounding the school. It is very industrial.', 'My experience at PCSST has been amazing! All of the faculty members, truly care about the students, and always show compassion.', 'As a senior who has been at Paterson Charter School for Sci & Tech from sixth grade I can say that they have improved on some things and still need to fix things.', 'The uniforms were definitely preppy, and I like the advantages growing up in the school. there were sports that i was frequent in, and it was just a warming environment. I would definitely do high school again though, because it was pretty fun.', 'PCSST is a small organized school with a student body of +500 students. I am an alumnus of the school and attended the school since middle school but throughout time, the school continued to grow with many advancements but there are negative outlooks. A large number of teachers choose to leave the school due to the fact that the students are not disciplined and parents continue to blame the teachers for failing grades. It is highly unorthodox for any school to introduce an "intervention" system which grants the student to retake an exam or failed assignment which students fail to use the system and fail for the semester at PCSST. It is highly noted that students excel from the academics and go on to attend popular universities such as Howard University or UCLA. The school fails to prepare students for college level courses which is very depressing due to the fact that many colleges do not tolerate the poor performance from their students.']

column1: Brooklyn Community Arts & Media High School (BCAM)
column2: ['What I liked were the teachers and some of my classes. What should change is having more variety in their clubs. I also enjoyed meeting new people that later became close friends.', 'Going here made me realize that I hated school but I can still also have fun learning and meeting new people. The teachers had a great sense of humour which made being in the class a bit interesting.', 'It Filled with art activities and allows you to be your yourself through any type of art. They plan fun activities and Trips / overnight trips. For seniors our overnight trips and covered with food and good hotels. Some teachers plan very good assignments for the day and makes it fun', 'The school is a artistic school where you can do any of your choosen art from. The teacher know you by name and care for you and help you when needed. The social worker at the school is like a mother to everyone in the building.', "BCAM is a great school with awesome teacher that help you academically . It's an amazing school to attend. The teachers are great, the kids are great. It's a friendly high school and the perfect place to spend your four years", "Amazing school that really cares about their students. I'm a senior there and I know no other school cares about me graduating and getting into college like BCAM does and i really appreciate it.", 'The Safety Guards are very alert and useful.', 'Everyone in the school contribute to the extracurricular activity which makes it fun, and it let others see how interesting it is.', 'Its such a small school, so its but so much you can do. I was mostly to myself and focused on my work when i was there. I also participated in a lot extracurricular activities.', 'When they are frustrated with the students then tend to not now how to control them, which causes the teacher to lose their patience.', 'i wish that they did notify kids that there is a uniform policy and change the stuff they put in the highschool book', 'I joined the girls football team in the 10th grade and have been devoted to it ever since. Being on a team taught me how to be tough and who my true friends are.', 'From attending this school for almost 10 years i can say my experience here has ben great. It has been great for the reason of my school has small classes which means i can get all the time and attention that need. Also my teachers and my principle especially are very supportive in which they want to make sure I succeed and are willing to go a extra mile to make that happen.', "What makes this school unique is the talents the students have, the art designs on the walls are inspired by the students. For instance, it's pictures or painting of the students alter-ego. My best experience is showing my artistic skills on the models for Model Material. It was the best experience for me because people complemented me on my work on the models and the whole show turned out perfectly the way I wanted. I would do it over because I feel like I could show more or look out for more inspirations for my make-up to look more unique.", 'I enjoyed my high school years as well as my high school. Many of my favorite teachers have moved onto to other journeys in their lives and I appreciated the time I had with them. This high school and the teachers taught me so much and are a huge part of the reason I became the young woman I am today. The seeds were planted at BCAM.', 'My absolute favorites about Brooklyn Community of Arts and Media High School are the shows they put on for students and families, their sportsmanship, and the art.  Majority of the teachers are pretty friendly and funny. The work is challenging but becomes easier and what I mostly and only dislike is the lack of freedom.', "For modeling we're all required to be a team and work together under hard circumstances.", 'We need more academic options in school.', "Our school lacks school spirit although it has gotten better, our facilities aren't the best but they are do-able. Our teams have great performance but don't have a strong mind on competitiveness.", 'The teachers are nice and they are always open to students and their ideas. And they tailor the classroom to whats best for the students.']
column4: ['What I liked were the teachers and some of my classes. What should change is having more variety in their clubs. I also enjoyed meeting new people that later became close friends.', 'Going here made me realize that I hated school but I can still also have fun learning and meeting new people. The teachers had a great sense of humour which made being in the class a bit interesting.', 'It Filled with art activities and allows you to be your yourself through any type of art. They plan fun activities and Trips / overnight trips. For seniors our overnight trips and covered with food and good hotels. Some teachers plan very good assignments for the day and makes it fun', 'The school is a artistic school where you can do any of your choosen art from. The teacher know you by name and care for you and help you when needed. The social worker at the school is like a mother to everyone in the building.', "BCAM is a great school with awesome teacher that help you academically . It's an amazing school to attend. The teachers are great, the kids are great. It's a friendly high school and the perfect place to spend your four years", "Amazing school that really cares about their students. I'm a senior there and I know no other school cares about me graduating and getting into college like BCAM does and i really appreciate it.", 'The Safety Guards are very alert and useful.', 'Everyone in the school contribute to the extracurricular activity which makes it fun, and it let others see how interesting it is.', 'Its such a small school, so its but so much you can do. I was mostly to myself and focused on my work when i was there. I also participated in a lot extracurricular activities.', 'When they are frustrated with the students then tend to not now how to control them, which causes the teacher to lose their patience.', 'i wish that they did notify kids that there is a uniform policy and change the stuff they put in the highschool book', 'I joined the girls football team in the 10th grade and have been devoted to it ever since. Being on a team taught me how to be tough and who my true friends are.', 'From attending this school for almost 10 years i can say my experience here has ben great. It has been great for the reason of my school has small classes which means i can get all the time and attention that need. Also my teachers and my principle especially are very supportive in which they want to make sure I succeed and are willing to go a extra mile to make that happen.', "What makes this school unique is the talents the students have, the art designs on the walls are inspired by the students. For instance, it's pictures or painting of the students alter-ego. My best experience is showing my artistic skills on the models for Model Material. It was the best experience for me because people complemented me on my work on the models and the whole show turned out perfectly the way I wanted. I would do it over because I feel like I could show more or look out for more inspirations for my make-up to look more unique.", 'I enjoyed my high school years as well as my high school. Many of my favorite teachers have moved onto to other journeys in their lives and I appreciated the time I had with them. This high school and the teachers taught me so much and are a huge part of the reason I became the young woman I am today. The seeds were planted at BCAM.', 'My absolute favorites about Brooklyn Community of Arts and Media High School are the shows they put on for students and families, their sportsmanship, and the art.  Majority of the teachers are pretty friendly and funny. The work is challenging but becomes easier and what I mostly and only dislike is the lack of freedom.', "For modeling we're all required to be a team and work together under hard circumstances.", 'We need more academic options in school.', "Our school lacks school spirit although it has gotten better, our facilities aren't the best but they are do-able. Our teams have great performance but don't have a strong mind on competitiveness.", 'The teachers are nice and they are always open to students and their ideas. And they tailor the classroom to whats best for the students.']
column6: ["Academics are great, some people just don't take advantage of those that are given."]

column2: ["It's a good school academically. Some students are just problematic which made some of my experiences horrible. But other than that, it's a great school and it's great with college preparation and opportunities.", 'As an alum of Academy for Young Writers, I could say that it prepared me for college through extensive writing and presentations. For a small school, the community was very big. The only thing I did not like was the fact that the advisors for seniors would try to keep us in in-state schools rather than encouraging us to look into out-of-state schools.', 'Academy for Young Writers is a great school in terms of acceptance, unity, and over all staff to student relationships.', 'From the start, Freshmen year, Academy for Young Writers prepares you for life after high school. Whether it is academics or how to deal with adult life, the staff   finds a way to incorporate that into our time in schools.', "Our school is located in East New York, and like many, have experienced massive budget cuts but still manage to provide stellar education to its students and maintain it's bright and welcoming personality. Staff are well trained, skilled and highly educated. The campus is clean and safe. Our students are engaged. Everything a good school needs.Every student has the power to mold the school into what they want. Everyone contributes to the positive atmosphere.Administration is invested in student engagement and making sure the school can better service the them. Our Principal works very closely with Student Council. Our Dean caters to both Middle School and High School students. Advisors listen to students and adequately prepare us for post HS life. I have made personal relationships with my teachers, become an Honors student, grow into an accomplished writer and artist and made change outside of my school. I have my school to thank for that. Any child would be lucky to go here.", "I feel like overall this school it tries it's best to keep everyone happy maybe not always in it's best way but they try so thats what matter.", "What I liked about Academy For Young Writers is, Everyone is very friendly and open. You can be yourself in that school. What's bad is, there's not a lot of programs or sports that students want.", "Entering Academy for Young Writers had me conflicted internally, I had no clue how I was going to about entering a new space with new people. I wasn't comfortable coming out and upon learning more about myself as the years went on, I began to help change the school's culture about LGBT students and their needs. Upon graduating I had learned more of my own character, how I choose to interact with others and that the sky is limitless.", 'everything about this school is good, the teachers are nice, its in a safe environment, the school is wonderful', "AFYW is a unique learning experience. It's not your typical high school. The teachers take great pride in forming bonds with the students. AFYW also practices restorative justice which dramatically lowered the amount of suspensions. The school focuses on community and I had a great 4 years.", 'I liked the small school family atmosphere. The teachers were very helpful and did everything they could to make sure you were a ok in and out of the school.', 'I liked the way students are able to be themselves and are accepted from whatever background they come from. The school could use some work on having a space for students to go when they are in need of emotional stability.', "what I like about Academy for Young Writers is that the teachers are all caring and nice. The teachers help me whenever I'm stuck on the problem and they thoroughly explain it to me. The staff at the school are also nice and cares about each student within the school.", "Being at this school has helped  me grow tremendously as a student but also as a person. I've learned how to face difficult challenges and to believe in myself. Young Writers has become my family.", 'Again... If they would have a least gave a warning of what they were doing then my years at this school would have much more enjoyable.', "My experience in this school wasn't all that good but it wasn't that bad either even though with my class, they decided to do a lot of NEW things.", "What makes this school so unique is it's small size and the availability of teachers and programs that in an collaborative effort help students succeed. Some of my bets memories include supplemental instruction after school for approaching regents exams and credit recovery courses during the summer.", 'During my time at Academy for Young Writers, I felt supported by most of my teachers and they made it obvious by their efforts that they wanted me to succeed as a student.', 'Amazing security and health staff present at the school.', 'Loads of after school opportunities, enriching the student experience.']

column6: ['The school is great for where it is now. Starting about a decade ago, in both Academic and social pursuits the school has immensely improved. For that I have to give the school props where it is due, and look forward to see continued improvements.', "The teachers at the school are growing with the students and that is what I love. They are key players in student's lives and that continues to drive them to succeed. They are consistent in grading and whilst improvements are constantly made where knowledge is concern, the teachers tend to have strong grasps on the material.", 'Dont have much to say about this...a work in progress', 'The school is a grewat school in a brand new building. It will become even greater once the parent priograms are implemented.', 'Parents are given the School safety book. new parent coordinator will be preparing a Student handbook for parents and students', 'The teachers are amazing and they help the students as much as they can', 'There are many different clubs and activities they all are open to every one', 'We are able to use new mac laptops but we cannot take them home and are limited to the time we have to use them.', "They don't take it in their own hands to make sure no child is bullied.", 'There is not really any options unless your in cheer leading or the basketball team.', 'The is not many sports at this school. Just the usual basketball team, dance team, step team and cheerleading team. No track no soccer etc.', "They know when to put their foot down and how hard to have their foot stomp when it hits the ground and that's what's appreciative of them but they can also be understanding and cooperative if you are the same. They'll ask for both sides of the story and base their decision on that rather than just the conflicted interaction itself.", "I've made a lot of really good friends of mine at this school and the teachers and staff have become like my family away from my own. The building itself, has become my home away from the house. I always felt like when I came to school, though the days felt longer than they should have been or actually were, it was a place where I was able to be myself and interact with people who I still interact with today.", "Whenever we had gym class, I loved it because we'd go to the weight room and just work out for most of the time. Other times when we had gym, we'd be playing sports like basketball, floor hockey, badminton, soccer, etc. I am not a great player when it comes to sports but I am competitive so it does get that much more fun.", "I felt prepared for college most definitely but as for the real world, that didn't hit me until I started college because when I had to buy the textbooks/materials for my classes, I realized how much of my hard earned babysitting money was gone. College isn't easy but it's not that difficult either. For work, I don't really think the school really prepares you for that. It does prepare you however for what it's like when you get a payment and that sort of thing.", "From an academic standpoint this school will teach you a lot and it really does prepare you for college classes but speaking about diversity, it's not all that great. There's more African Americans and Hispanic than there is White or Asian or just about anything else.", 'The Food Is Not Nasty But They Need Lots Of More Opitions', "We haven't have any issues with health and safety but we need more supplies for the school nurse to provide because all there is, are ice packs that can do but so much.", "Students aren't allow to wear clothes that show too much body parts.  Otherwise Academy for Young Writers tries as much as they could to enforce that non-bullying policies.", 'Academy for Young Writers is very open and gives us students a chance to be free.  We receive plenty of help from teachers as well as stuff to make us feel comfortable.  Academically wise, classes are average size and the lessons are well put together. Outside of classes there are many opportunities to get into to help us.']

column2: ['I like how Brooklyn theatre arts faculty is very friendly and helpful, they listen to issues and have many activities to choose from. I don’t like the fact that as a senior we had no college advisory at first and regular teachers had to go to college workshops just to help us out.', 'brooklyn theatre arts is not as diverse in the arts department as i’d hoped it would of been and it’s really unorganized but besides that’s it’s okay i guess. this school taught me a lot if responsibility that’s for sure.', "My experience at Brooklyn Theatre Arts High School was a humbling one. There is so much that could be done to improve the school , it just takes the right people. That's one of the things that this school taught me, that I can't just want a change. I have to work for it and have my voice be heard.", 'Brooklyn Theatre arts Highschool was the best school I’ve ever attended ! The atmosphere is great and the teachers have a lot to offer .', "The faculty and staff at the school were very goal driven and dedicated to ensurimg every child's success. However, the teaching styles and inability to adapt to students own learning styles often times hindered academic growth and created a noticeable struggle between teacher and student. The environment of the school was fairly clean and well kept, but this was not a result of students' efforts, as they we're not respectable with maintaining the efforts of those above them to keep the school clean.", "The school is good for kids who would like to experience anything in the theatre art field. The school has updated teachers since I've been there but when I was there the school had great teachers. The graduation rate has grown since the year 2012 when the new principal David ward came to the school.", "Brooklyn Theatre arts is a good school . The staff are literally amazing, the teachers help you and are willing to stay late just to make sure your good. The Assistant Principal is the Coolest and the guidance counselors are there if you ever need any help. The only reason I won't give it 5 stars because they say it's a Theatre school but we barely do anything Theatric.", "I like how the teachers expect us to do things on our own which shows us how the real world is going to treat us . In college your professors aren't going to chase you down to do your work you just do it on your own.I also like how we have many college readiness classes and college now classes.", "I didn't have the worst experience in high school but just like everyone else there are somethings i wouldn't mind going back and changing my high school wouldn't be one of them. I have learned a lot of life lessons there, had very close relationships with my teachers and peers, no we didn't always get along as teenagers its expected and i have gotten into a few disagreements but nothing physical and the guidance counselors were always there to help us a settle an disagreement. When my grades dropped my teachers pulled me to the side asked if everything was okay and from there worked on getting it back to where it should be. I really love my school and i'm going to miss it when I graduate.", 'The teachers are very polite and respectful. they give you time to make up work and boost your grade before the marking period is over. Most of the teachers use real life equations to help us to understand certain scenarios and explain everything with clarity. they value all students opinions and try to make the learning environment one of effectiveness. When a student has been missing from class or is their grades is falling off they have a sit down and talk with you to see what it is they can do to help and make it easier. They also try their best to create a safe learning environment with group conversations to settle any conflict and take immediate disciplinary actions. Teachers engage with the student on a more personal level to make sure everyone gets what they need.', 'The school is very into the theatre world, hence the name, and is very small. It is in a building with other schools, and we all only come together for sports. A majority of the teachers are nice and your bound to get close to one teacher that you know you can talk to.', 'I love all my teachers in my school they would push me and every other student that is struggling with their work. The teachers in my school would break things down so that way their students will be able to understand the lesson. The teachers that teach Global,English,Science,Math and Music and so much more are so great and the one thing i also love about a lll the teachers in my school is that they would never give up on their students', "The health & safety policies at school are fare but no one knows what goes on with a student unless they look high & they'll be suspended", 'Everyone gets accepted for who they are , you can be purple or blue for all we care we love meeting new friendly people. Especially the ones interested in theatre .', 'The school is in good condition minus the water bugs that pop up dead . It always gets cleaned students sometimes take care of the area', "My favorite experience at this school was the cheerleading team & talent show of 2013 . We've all worked hard , also had ups & downs . With a little counseling we learned that we're a family & we love eachothers . It bought the best out of us.", 'Every single day teachers offer tutoring except Sundays . They stay late , until you get the work . They help you succeed .', "Everyone that plays sports goes 100000000 when it comes to getting the job done. Very dedicated & when it's games the entire school & outsiders come to show love & support for the WIN .", "I don't really eat school lunch but they always have different fruits & salads. They'll have healthy sandwiches as well . Chicken , beef patties , mozzarella sticks , fries & more . Soda machine is locked & they have a water machine ONLY. Everyone drinks the water. Also when it's hot they'll give out healthy ice's", 'In school we have Dance , cheerleading , stepping , ballet , theatre , football , soccer , track , volleyball , bowling , flag football , basketball for girls as well , tutoring , weight room , yoga & a meditating class. Almost everyone at this school stays dedicated to almost everything that is offered . If you ask for it , they will make it happen.']

column2: ['I had a great time in this school. Will recommend to some else', 'Just wish it was better.', "You rarely see any fights or bullying it's more play fighting than the real thing no one is in harms way at this school", "I became friends with great people I've changed into the mature I only dreamed of becoming and this school expanded my knowledge beyond the books about life itself", "There are great varieties of meals and there's a salad galore", "It's very strict and everyone is held accountable for their actions", 'Our school revolves around Sports', 'Most teachers go out there way to help students', 'The activities are cool could be more engaging', "The students involvement in the sports that we have are very important because if we as a school don't support the football or basketball games, the players on the team wouldn't feel like they have people there to support them.", "The extracurricular activities in our school are great. Not only could we participate in the activities we love to do, we also support our friends in the activity that they do. So overall the activities couldn't be better", 'I could say that Mr.Cradle is very involved with the students and what we do as one. Especially when it comes down to just making sure we understand what the right circumstances are and what we have to do in order to meet them and move on in our life.', 'It great because they prepare us for college ever since we go to Sophmore year and they make us write 5-10 page essay because they always say we gonna get those kind of assignments in college.', 'The teachers in this school are okay because they will keep you on track but if they get annoyed by you they dont really care about you. Also, they will go out there way to make you pass the class so you wont have to go to summer school. The teachers in the school are great to talk to about anything and in any problems your in.', 'The staff and security in the school always there to keep us safe. They are like satellites they hear everything and peep everything.', 'this is a sport management school and it should offer more sport related courses and have more sports endorsements', 'N/A the school is good to me.', 'In the after school programs the teachers assist u with everything that you are doing. But we have after school programs mostly for academic reasons. ', 'My school is great i have a lot of opportunities and the faculties help me a lot. The teacher care about our education and future. If i could do this again I will because i meet a lot of new people by the end of my school year my vocabulary augmented and it was a great experience. ', 'The AP classes and honor classes are great classes to be in. All the things we do in business class can relate to the things we do in geometry class or trig. The honor and AP classes have more work then the other classes. But the work are average out good.']
column4: ['I had a great time in this school. Will recommend to some else', 'Just wish it was better.', "You rarely see any fights or bullying it's more play fighting than the real thing no one is in harms way at this school", "I became friends with great people I've changed into the mature I only dreamed of becoming and this school expanded my knowledge beyond the books about life itself", "There are great varieties of meals and there's a salad galore", "It's very strict and everyone is held accountable for their actions", 'Our school revolves around Sports', 'Most teachers go out there way to help students', 'The activities are cool could be more engaging', "The students involvement in the sports that we have are very important because if we as a school don't support the football or basketball games, the players on the team wouldn't feel like they have people there to support them.", "The extracurricular activities in our school are great. Not only could we participate in the activities we love to do, we also support our friends in the activity that they do. So overall the activities couldn't be better", 'I could say that Mr.Cradle is very involved with the students and what we do as one. Especially when it comes down to just making sure we understand what the right circumstances are and what we have to do in order to meet them and move on in our life.', 'It great because they prepare us for college ever since we go to Sophmore year and they make us write 5-10 page essay because they always say we gonna get those kind of assignments in college.', 'The teachers in this school are okay because they will keep you on track but if they get annoyed by you they dont really care about you. Also, they will go out there way to make you pass the class so you wont have to go to summer school. The teachers in the school are great to talk to about anything and in any problems your in.', 'The staff and security in the school always there to keep us safe. The honor and AP classes have more work then the other classes. But the work are average out good.']
column6: ['The athletic teams are very good we have two gyms one on the fourth floor and one on the first floor.Every sport event almost everyone is there to support. The coaches give students opportunities to join a team and there many different teams to join.', "The food is good but need to bring your own lunch. Not everything on the menu you will like. It will take time to get use to but it won't make any difference.", "Students have to wear a white polo shirt and black pants. The students cant wear any other shirt if its not a dress shirt with a tie. If a student don't have a shirt they will get send to the office and get a shirt to wear.", "This school has come far throughout the years I have been there I overcome challenges and my school itself has overcome its challenges. When I came in it wasn't the best but it was a school full of friendly staff and teachers and they were always there to help. As my years go by my school becomes more better and better because students are realizing that they need a education in their life. Also from my freshmen year the class of 2014 has augmented and we are ready to graduate.", 'The teachers are good on teaching. They definitely try to help you when your struggles. Try to help with your grade if your failing. Give extra credit work. Ver good instructions and informative. ', ' Really not much. You went on your own.  Its so narrow there is much diversity. there would only be one or two asian students, five to one latino and majority african american. ', 'The school was really strict with the whole uniform. You had to have white shirt with a collar or button down, no black jean .. slack only but you could get away with black jeans. And no sneakers what so ever. Teachers will take point off or get deny privileges or detention.', "There really wasn't much options what so ever. Just follow what you have to do. You can talk to a guidance counselor but really she never had time. So its very poor with options", "The food was ehhh nothing much to expect. Like always chicken nuggets, burgers. Don't look much appealing. Nothing to be stun about. ", "School games aren't really much of a big deal. There is barely no spirit what so ever. If there was a game much students don't know about. rarely pay attention too. I only been two one game and there wasn't many supports. Most supporters where from the team we were vs. ", "School is very serious when it comes down to bullies or someone's health. They make sure students are comfortable and aren't bullied. ", "I dislike this school because it was to small. Every teacher went into your business. If you were dating a boy they would shake their head. However, they are helpful. There isn't much clubs to join. Usually its only two or three to choose from. ", "This is a predominantly male school, it's really hard for girls like myself at first. but you get used to it. A lot of gang activity as well.", "Hated it at first, but there's always something going on like trips. We also have a partnership with the Brooklyn cyclones which is cool. Lots of guest speakers.", 'This is a uniform school. Almost every student wears their uniform everyday. If not they face disciplinary action.', "Sense the school is 96% boys they tend to give the girls a easier way out. With the uniform policy the girls have one just like the boys(black and white), but they never get in trouble at all. Girls can walk around showing cleavage nothing is said. If us boys walk around without a white polo shirt on or black shoes or sneakers, we get detention. All the girls get high grades no matter what they do. I work so hard to get the grades I got, then the girls barely work, fail test, and still pass with high 80's and some 90's. So there is a challenge if your a boy. You have to work hard to get what you deserve, but who really loses at the end of the day us boys or the little girls who goes there?", "The school is not safe, there isn't any bomb threats or that of the sort, but kids are always getting bullied left and right. The teachers usually never say anything. Its most dangerous outside after school. A girl got put in the hospital by a group of guys who beat a lot of students up from our school. The school isn't always clean there's always food on the floor in the staircase, dirty floors, and the bathrooms are terrible", 'There are always good help at the school. With it being a small school teachers always have time to help students. the technology is always up to date, With all the new mac laptops and smart boards. The guidance counselor always helps students. The college advisor is always available for students needs.', "The extracurricular are very slim. There are barely no clubs or organizations. There is a club National Honor Society for students with 85 and higher averages. Yet, the number of students are low since majority graduated school and we haven't had any inductions yet. The level of commitment is bad since the students who are part dont show up and the meetings are given last minute. The yearbook club is poor since many students don't want to stay after school. There really isn't much besides joining sports.", "The academics offered include general classes and very one AP/honor class. Students can't take any fun classes such as dancing, wood shop..etc. The two main ones is music and art which are okay and they are mandatory to take in order to graduate.  Students are place to honors calculus if they passed all their math regents. The workload for the advanced class is intense because a vast of work has to be done and there is a small number of students there. Also, the work is complicated if your not strong at a certain topic such as anti-derivatives. It's two long periods and you can't get out of the class unless you have a very good reason too each period of calculus is 48mins long."]

column2: ['It was terrible everyone the teachers are mean are disrespectful the students are too they are racist they don’t help people at all and they try to suspend the kids for no reason', 'They made me feel good and there’s no bullying I felt like it was my home away from home filled with people I could call family. Amazing variety of so many diverse people I a Dominican from the Bronx met my best friend a Egyptian from queens here. Forever thankful for that.  However I would like to see MVHS offer more extracurricular activities and more AP classes and more internships and to have more staff. The small school is amazing because that way everyone knows everyone. I honestly don’t regret going here and I love the principal Mr.Rodrigues he is the best. I made amazing friends and had a great time. I hope they can continue to add more classes and add more teachers so that teachers aren’t teaching to many different classes. Love it, will miss going here everyday.', 'My four years at Marta Valle high school was very educating and interesting. My senior class is small but over the years we’ve grown together and we’ve managed to make a difference in our school.', 'Students are encouraged to join clubs and are left with the feeling of belonging by every person at Marta Valle High School', 'Please pay attention to this !!!!. Do not apply to Marta valle. The administration  stabs its students on the back and injustice is very big in this school. There are not type of clubs whatsoever and most of the work we get are packets. The class of 2018 tried their hardest to make change and the staff just knocked down anything they wanted to do. The school wouldn’t be so bad if it wasn’t for the administration. The first two years were perfect we had clubs and an interacting principal, we had Saturday academy. The school is not challenging at all. Not even honors class. Teachers leave every year because the administration sucks. Students cannot bond with teachers because they always leave because the administration pushes them so much. Only apply here if you want to breeze through high school with easy grades. Students have gotten suspended over petty situations. Overall it’s  a safe school that wouldn’t be so bad if the administration did what they were supposed to do.', 'I liked how my school would always take us to college trips so we can have our options open. They always guided us to the right direction and whenever we needed support they would always be there for us.', 'Going to Marta Valle brightened but also dimmed the excitement of my high school years. The first two years were really good, but when the administration changed the whole school changed for the worse.', 'What I liked most of Marta Valle HS were the teachers, they made the most of what was provided through the school and tried to help the students that wanted to be able to pass and graduate. What could be improved would have to do with school funding due to the lack of AP classes, sports as well as space due to sharing the building with 2 other schools.', 'I had a great time in this School from 9th to 12th grade. I love all the teachers. I hope to see a new Principal then the current one right now. A principal that care about students, teachers and others around the school.', 'I enjoyed the school shows. They incorporated almost every student and I believe that student involvement is key to a thriving school.', 'Throughout my four years here at Marta Valle, I thought I would eventually like it..at least. I was wrong though. To give the school the benefit of the doubt, they have made the college application process a whole lot easier as it removes the weight off of your shoulders. However, the school lacks safety, respect, and a caring administration.', "this school is so fun it interacts with all the students of all ages through multiple activities throughout the school year. i remember almost all the fun times we had with our teachers and friends that we will never forget, all the effort they put on us to be ready to take regents they care for each student individually and i would love to go back but... i don't to much like new york dont get me wrong the area the school is is is fantastic theres everything of a childs desires to eat or whant to eat pizza resturants, dinners, tacos, starbucks, subways, mc donalds Chinese anything you can probably think of was over there even a market let me not forget about the economy candy but in overall school was perfect when i was there students i was one of the most loved scholar i would recommend this school for anyone who has dreamt what high school was like on tv part of many you could find there its a caring community", "I love how diverse my school is. It's filled with so many different people and I appreciate that. We are a community. We come together to make out school a great place.", "There no bullying at the school at all. Everyone's pretty good to others. There might be a couple police officers with metal detectors checking up once in a blue.", "There are no extracurricular classes. There are a couple honor classes but they're all easy. We're not challenged.", "My experience at this school overall, would have to be okay. I honestly expected more , but sadly didn't. The school staff is nice to all students, they're professional. But when it comes to the education, its like they repeat everything and don't challenge the students enough. They help to figure out small tasks but don't go beyond that point. If I could do it all over again, I wouldn't choose to attend this school at all. I would've chosen a better and higher standardized school. A school where they would challenge me and provide me with the help I need whether its during school or after school hours.", "They teach what they are designed to teach. Some stay after school to help the students, others don't. They provide the students with sufficient work, but I personally don't think they challenge us enough.", 'The health and safety policies are okay. I had an experience with my school nurse and gym teacher recently when I got a cut from falling and a sprained ankle. The school nurse helped but not as much as my gym teachet, she really made sure I was okay and helped me through my sprained ankle.', 'The clubs are not that great.', 'Overrall I love my school, the teachers and some staff. They are always there for support. I remember when my friends and I were planning a bake sale to raise money for senior activities. We needed a teacher to watch us in the cullinary room. We asked our governmemt teacher and she was willing to help out. We were very thankful that she was willing to help us through the process and we got everything done while having fun baking which is why this is my favorited memory. My school is unique because its small, theres a small amount of students and the community is strong. All the students are comfortable with each other and almost everyone is friendly. My school is shared with two other schools which also makes us unique because the students in my school have respect for them and we share halls and rooms. Although I love my school, there is always a new principal which is frustrating because changes are constantly happening. But I would pick this school again because I love all the people ive met and teachers. The bond I have with my friends is something I wouldnt have gotten anywhere else.']

column2: ['My experience with The Bronx Academy of Health Careers was decent. To be honest it was the people (friends) that made this school tolerable. Most of the teachers are inadequate and incapable of teaching the classes they are supposedly "qualified" to teach and when you make a complaint about this, the school claims to makes accommodations to make our learning experience better, however nothing changes.', 'I like that as a trans I was mostly included in everything. For example, my school let’s me join the girl’s team for volleyball and they were always considering this fact. They were very supporting especially my guidance councilor  who helped me in everything so I could settle down in my new environment.', "This school needed a lot of improvements. I do not regret the memories and friends I made but, it is not the right school for a student who has goals in life after receiving there diploma. The school doesn't offer enough clubs, opportunities and help needed. Sadly, the school does not have enough money for anything. Students are surrounded in an environment of drugs and violence. The school has it's benefits but the negative outweighs it.", 'This school is not the best. There are many problems with discipline, teachers, and students. I like how very few teachers truly care and motivate you to achieve a higher goal.', 'Health careers did not only expand my knowledge on multiple topics/subjects, they also gave me plentiful opportunities that is helping me as I begin to enter the college world. The staff is supportive and always there when needed& The courses are all well taught and fun.', 'Bronx Academy of Health Careers is filled with many opportunities. Students are able to develop and learn in an welcoming environment. I had multiple opportunities of going on sponsered college trips with my school. Students can take college level courses at the start of their highschool career with the partnership of Lehman College.  Honor Society is a community where students show their leadership skills to help improve the school environment and outside community.', 'I like the diversity among our school and our connections with other schools on campus. Not all teachers are effective teachers and can use some improvements.', 'I started off at the Bronx Academy of Health Careers as a freshman and my time here has been quite excellent. I have gained great friendships and have also taken AP courses in my years here. What I would change in Health Careers is for the staff to engage more with students on how to become successful in life and to push them for better in a positive way.', "I love this school , at first I didn't like the school. But in the end I end up loving it thats because the  teachers are nice and the students are like families, not once  there was bullying everyone is friendly. I love it personally.", 'Bronx Academy of Health Careers High school, best four years of my life.High school is a time for teens to learn valuable skills for life from peers and professionals. School days fill time with fun, informational activities and prepare teens for the world of work. There are many reasons a high school education is important, but most of all it is a means to achieve long-term goals and feel a sense of pride in accomplishment', 'I learned a lot at this school such as working with other from different religion or country.  open up to others, learn to work in groups, made me challenge my self.', "This school is great for all. But especially the one's that wants to learn if you want to learn then this school is for you because this school provides you with the best teachers you could ever imagine to have.", "I enjoyed every moment of my 4 years at this high school.  The teachers are amazing and helpful.  I'm in my final year and I doing 4 AP's and hoping to finish with an advance diploma.  I highly recommend this high school to everyone.", 'I attended this school from 2011-2015 my overall experience was alright, most of the teacher were great.', 'What I love about Bronx Academy of Health Careers is that the teachers and great students are always willing to help the school no matter how most of the students misbehave. The people who know their stuff persevere in their studies and pass. What I would love to see change is the students. I suggest the school should create a test for students before they enter the school. Also, safety first. The school really needs intense safety measures.', 'It is an okay high school I had bad and good experience.', 'they do what they have to sometimes', "there aren't really any extracurricular activities", "students tend not to learn because teachers choose to argue with students that are just disruptive and don't want to listen", 'The teachers at Bronx Academy of Heath Career are great, they offer after school and help other students.']

The school doesn't offer enough clubs, opportunities and help needed. Sadly, the school does not have enough money for anything. Students are surrounded in an environment of drugs and violence. The school has it's benefits but the negative outweighs it.", 'This school is not the best. There are many problems with discipline, teachers, and students. I like how very few teachers truly care and motivate you to achieve a higher goal.', 'Health careers did not only expand my knowledge on multiple topics/subjects, they also gave me plentiful opportunities that is helping me as I begin to enter the college world. The staff is supportive and always there when needed& The courses are all well taught and fun.', 'Bronx Academy of Health Careers is filled with many opportunities. Students are able to develop and learn in an welcoming environment. I had multiple opportunities of going on sponsered college trips with my school. Students can take college level courses at the start of their highschool career with the partnership of Lehman College.  Honor Society is a community where students show their leadership skills to help improve the school environment and outside community.', 'I like the diversity among our school and our connections with other schools on campus. Not all teachers are effective teachers and can use some improvements.', 'I started off at the Bronx Academy of Health Careers as a freshman and my time here has been quite excellent. I have gained great friendships and have also taken AP courses in my years here. What I would change in Health Careers is for the staff to engage more with students on how to become successful in life and to push them for better in a positive way.', "I love this school , at first I didn't like the school. But in the end I end up loving it thats because the  teachers are nice and the students are like families, not once  there was bullying everyone is friendly. I love it personally.", 'Bronx Academy of Health Careers High school, best four years of my life.High school is a time for teens to learn valuable skills for life from peers and professionals. School days fill time with fun, informational activities and prepare teens for the world of work. There are many reasons a high school education is important, but most of all it is a means to achieve long-term goals and feel a sense of pride in accomplishment', 'I learned a lot at this school such as working with other from different religion or country.  open up to others, learn to work in groups, made me challenge my self.', "This school is great for all. But especially the one's that wants to learn if you want to learn then this school is for you because this school provides you with the best teachers you could ever imagine to have.", "I enjoyed every moment of my 4 years at this high school.  The teachers are amazing and helpful.  I'm in my final year and I doing 4 AP's and hoping to finish with an advance diploma.  I highly recommend this high school to everyone.", 'I attended this school from 2011-2015 my overall experience was alright, most of the teacher were great.', 'What I love about Bronx Academy of Health Careers is that the teachers and great students are always willing to help the school no matter how most of the students misbehave. The people who know their stuff persevere in their studies and pass. What I would love to see change is the students. I suggest the school should create a test for students before they enter the school. Also, safety first. The school really needs intense safety measures.', 'It is an okay high school I had bad and good experience.', 'they do what they have to sometimes', "there aren't really any extracurricular activities", "students tend not to learn because teachers choose to argue with students that are just disruptive and don't want to listen", 'The teachers at Bronx Academy of Heath Career are great, they offer after school and help other students.']
column6: ['The school is a very strict school but it is leading us the students to succsess.', "This school now offers AP classes and classes are ranked from most academically challenging to a simple day care for teens. Some teachers care a lot and put excessive time and work into better their students while others just sit back casually and wait for the bell to ring. You can't really choose what class you end up in since they'll chose were to place you but they make sure you are doing what you need to graduate from highschool. Not many extra curricular activities are offered and you can't break away from your set schedule.  You may have to wait until afterschool to join a group you're interested in. When I attended a couple years ago the clubs included one book club who mostly worked selling things to fund their trips and a few dance clubs.", "I'm sure peer pressure exists at the school but that totally depends on who you hang out with. I was lucky enough to get friends who would never pressure me to do anything. There exists a lack of diversity amongst the school and kids usually pair off with people of their own ethnicity.  The school doesn't do much to help. With the lack of acceptance between the groups. When students of different cultures are on a one on one basis their is a mutual respect and friendliness but when they break off into groups it's as if they don't talk much.", 'The school itself is irritating, most of the staff are so set on their high horses they refuse to listen to students. Students opinions are not valued the way they should be. However, you can see that a lot of the teachers do care about their students. The only reason why I would pick this school again are for the amazing friends that I have made.', "There isn't a huge variety of fun extracurricular. Most of them are education based. I wish they had more fun, hands on extracurriculars.", "It's gross, I've seen a rat run across a class room and a mouse stuck in a ceiling light. The girls bathroom is disgusting and it always smells. The lunchroom is always a mess.", "The food is healthy but I do not like the appearance of the food. I do not eat my school lunch on a regular basis so I bring my own lunch. My school's cafeteria is clean and the chefs make sure they provide us with fruits, water and salads.", 'My school athletics are great. We have about 2-3 gym including an average swimming pool. In most of the gym classes, the gym teacher enforces that everyone participate in physical education or he/she may fail the class. Students can participate in any of the athletics including softball, basketball, volleyball and track and field. My school has won numerous championships.']

column2: ['I like the arts programs and the diversity of the school. I always feel comfortable being myself in this school. I feel safe and the teachers are also very helpful.', 'It’s very easy to fit in at Thomas Jefferson Art Academy. Classes make the material easy to understand.', 'I attended Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy my senior year of high school. My overall experience was really good, the only thing I would change is the curriculum.', 'gave me some great memories and most of the faculty cares about the students, there are a few teachers that should not have a position at all', 'The school, overall, is good. The only thing that would e nice if it were to change is some of the staff members. There are many different classes and different clubs to participate in.', "I'd have to say being in Jefferson for my 4 year for high school was the best years of my life. The school is full of amazing talented teens who are reaching for their goals with out limits. Its in a area where everyone go along their day. Nothing ever happens in that school such as fights or issues like that. The teacher and the staff are very caring and willing to help the students with anything that they need, even the principle. It's the best place to focus on your study, get high graded and work in your creative filed as well. If I can be a teenage again i would always chose Jefferson than any other school In Elizabeth, NJ.", 'It was a warm environment, I had some of the best teachers throughout the years. They really care for there students and make sure the students are actually understand the curriculum by engaging with them.', 'I would like to see teachers that want the best of the students and can see beyond their behavior. I would also like to see administration discipline the students fairly and with reason. I would like to see the different art sections taken serious by its staff and students.', 'What i like about Thomas jefferson Arts Academy is their way of helping other achieve their goal. What i would love to see for a change is better food.', 'What I like about Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy is the teachers, they are excellent when explaining  the lesson. They would take time to help each of us understand. Another thing that I like is the there are so many activities to participate also so many clubs to join.', 'This school definately is the best. It’s an art school and it’s barely incorparated into our curriculum.', "I had no idea who quickly the days were flying by.  Now that I'm a senior, I look back and I'm amazed of all the things that I've learned.  I enjoy going to school and each day I'm getting closer and excited to graduate.", "The school was a simple average high school, but it lacked resources for students and even teachers, the parents are usually too busy working two jobs to be more involved with school and therefore aren't able to talk to their kids about school, the school also does pretty well clubs wise.", 'The diversity and talent in students. Along with, the motivation from and concern from teachers for their students. The rules most of the time are fair.', 'When I first started I wasn’t really nervous because when I went to the freshman orientation we had a scavenger hunt and it brought you to different classrooms on different floors and it made me comfortable. When it was my first day of school I already knew where my classes might be due to the floor I’m on if I was on the ground floor the room number starts with a zero. First floor would be one and second, 2 etc. I didn’t get lost and I didn’t feel odd or out of place in any way because I knew where I was going.', 'Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy  is an Excellent High school which has a variety of electives to choose from depending on what you like. If you are interesting in filming, editing, theater, dance, acting, drama, fashion, Art, drawing, music, etc. Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy will be a great school aside from the great academic field. You can be in plays, musicals, in anything you can imagine.', 'I enjoy going there and knowing that all the teachers are willing to help you along the line of you getting into college .', 'Thomas Jefferson could do a lot to better itself. One thing that they could do to improve is College readiness that work is almost basic. Teachers and administration could spend just a little bit more attention to the students and their well-being instead of stuff that is not so important like how late they are but maybe find out why they were late.', 'My experience at Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy is good. Although i wish that some aspects can change for the better, for example, i feel that the guidance counselors should be more involved in the students. They do try to have some sort of interaction and relationship i feel that they lack the time to actually sit down and have a conversation without wanting to rush it. I cant explain to you how many times ive gone to guidance and tried to talk to my counselor and majority of the time she was busy or wasnt in the office. But when she is finally their she does try to talk to me and want to help me through my issues or concers. But overall Jefferson has been a good experiance but just needs to adjust the availability that students can have with their guidance counselor that are there to guide us.', "Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy offers me opportunities, but it also has a lot of issues within itself. The unnecessary detentions, and suspensions for small to no rational reasons is why i would not rate it 5 stars. The electives that the school offers are entertaining, however they aren't fair with all of them, because some classes are more updated than others although the school is still very old fashioned. It is a good school and I respect their rules, but it also isn't fair to every student. Most of the times, the guidance councils are busy, or not there, which is a struggle to the seniors and/or when a student has a problem. Some students are lucky enough to have their teachers help them out."]

column6: ['I love how open minded the environment is also its a wonderful chance of meeting different people with similar backgrounds. Along with the many outstanding staff and faculty who work hard everyday!', 'I think that Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy is a good school overall. It has its cons but so does every other school. Id say its perfect for anybody who has an interest in the arts, for it has a nice variety of classes ranging from photograph and TV production to choir and guitar classes.', 'The way they make you get involve in the Arts is creative. They have concerts, musicals, plays, Talent Shows. This creates an atmosphere that will grow on an individual and become liking to TJAA', 'At Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy I was offered a great diversity of electives, all eligible for me and can go towards your potential career. Me for example, I came here for music, there are classes where you actually play instruments, learn the theory behind music, and even produce music. The diversity in that one category in the many, is personally amazing for a high school.', "Since I have been enrolled in Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy, I've had a few ups and downs during my freshmen year, but I learned that year that I needed to be very serious about school if I ever wanted to be successful in life. So I changed my ways, I started receiving better grades because I was working harder than I usually did, and my teacher that I admire so much are always there for me, they've been there every step of the way and I love and appreciate them so much for being there for me when I had no one to run to or talk to.", "Thomas Jefferson arts academy is a place you can easily call home and where I'm sure every student will spend most of their time because of its amazing arts programs and different clubs and activities. Not only will you have fun but you will also learn if you put your mind to it. This school has a very low tolerance for any children who only want to cause trouble.", 'Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy also TJAA has so many different departments of art. They theater, photography, graphic design , sculpture , art, drama, fashion, band, guitar, and dance can be your elective. The opportunity this school can give is amazing.', 'what i like about Thomas Jefferson is that the teachers would like to see their students grow and get far with there life no matter what . one thing i would change is the food because its not that good.', 'The School Helps students get college ready and the teachers care about the students. More diverse class choices would be a plus.', 'The education is good, the food is okay, the kids arent really friendly, they discipline for the silliest reasons, hours of school way too long,', "So far I've had an awesome experience at Jefferson, with the diversity in arts, culture, and enthusiasm everybody greets you with I've met new people, and have experienced new adventures. Thanks to the help of all my teachers I am very confident in my abbilities to succeed in the collegiate level. I would say my experience at Jefferson has been a success.", 'Hi my name is Dorine Darisme. I am 14 years old . I am a student at Thomas Jefferson Arts academy. I am a freshman. Some experience that I have encountered so far are that our school has so many talented students and I like that they\'re many opportunities so that the students never feel left out and the teachers are so AMAZING! I get pushed and motivated by them everyday and I love that about my school. There are many glubs to choose from, for example avid. I love going to avid every single day because I want to be something I. Life and I will be. Another example is dance, my dance teacher also pushes me everyday. I\'ll tell my my dance teacher " I can\'t do it" and he will say " dont you ever say that again you can do anything you want to as long as you put your mind to it, don\'t give up" then I\'ll get up and do the best I can. My  teachers motivated me to strive and go above and beyond.      Thank you!', 'Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy is a school of excellence as well as grace. The staff provides a positive learning and working atmosphere for students with out trying.', "As a senior at Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy, I've spent a lot of time in the school. What I like about TJAA , is the safe environment! I enjoy the medal detectors as we enter school and the security guards on each floor. What I also enjoy about TJAA is the divesity. A few of the things that I'd change  would the school hours. I feel as if the students were able to leave school at 2:19 or enter school at about 8 am, we'd find that they have received more sleep , have completed more homework and have become more involved in their school environment. Another thing that I'd change would be the options provided by school lunch. Although I understand that it's the law for students when receiving their school lunch to reach a certain calorie count , if more options were made available to the students to fit the diverse population we have a TJAA , more students would feel satifaifed when returning to class.", "My experience so far at Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy has been great so far. My strand was supposed to be chorus because that's what I auditioned for in the summer but instead I got dance. At first I was upset, but then I started getting interested in dance and now I'm going to be in a dance concert soon! I love how nice the teachers are, and the teachers are always willing to give community service hours to help us. I also love the club activities. We have the Key Club, which is a club for community service hours, N.C.Z which is a club for K-pop lovers like me! There’s clubs and activities for everyone that’s interested in certain things.", 'I want be famous and be a pefermer singer and a  dancer and a model   I need be be the next Selena Quintanilla or.  Jenifer Lopez. I always singing and dancing and  acting too', "I graduated Thomas Jefferson high school in 2015. I've learned so much. I was acceptance of all the policies such as strict a monks uniforms, shoe policy,  rules that was put an actions throughout my four years in the school I've learned so much that inspired me to be the person that I am now. I learned leadership, how to grow as a person, to take responsibility I learned that education is important. had a number of rising Star.In my second year the School was very diverse I was able to learn so much about the Arts. One thing that I would change is certain teachers because yes I was able to learn and starting classes but at the same times there were teachers in the class teaching the subject in a way where the class would not understand not specifically understand what she was saying but in the way that the subject was presented made it difficult for us as students to be captivated by the class,other than that it was a really really great School learned so much from the school.", "What makes this school unique is that it has cockroaches! It's nasty! Also the food is not that good. Sometimes you get cold food and that's not ok. Having Snapple, ice cream, and a store in the cafeteria that sells funnel cakes and French fries all the time as well as nachos, have severely increased the obesity rate.", "Overall the teachers are not consistent in texting. They do not tech in a way that will help us understand complex questions when they come up in an exam. So I feel like they are not prepping us enough for the SAT's", 'Tons of clubs & organizations for the students. Great participation from students.']
