column2: ["It was an AMAZING experience! I've learned plenty new things about myself and I've made unforgettable memories.", "My experience there is something to never forget. I walked into that school, low with confidence and now I'm going to be leaving with my head help high. Despite the faults and issues it may have, I'm glad I went here. It helped me find the voice I never thought I had.", "I like that I got the opportunity to graduate early from this school. Also that the guidance department is very effective and on top of things. I dislike that the school is small and that we didn't get to go on a lot of trips.", 'My experience at School For Classics was very terrible. At first, School For Classics is a very boring school as there were barely any type of activities for students to choose. The school is very small as we have a small environment so we did not really do anything. The students at the school are very immature as many fights would always break out and kids are very disrespectful to the teachers. The School was always dirty as it is not cleaned properly and the food was definitely nasty as it would taste like pure crap. The changes that could of have been made to this school was that this school could of have a better environment builded more where I can feel more safe and the school could of have been reconstructed with better colors and better spirit and should create more activities and have more friendly people in the school.', 'I have a great experience in school for Classics from last 3 year. It teach me how to face challenges.', 'The school for classics, i feel like it has a lot of favoritism towards some students. They didnt help me with my college applications had to fill out my FASFA my self its a horrible unorganized school', 'In my 4 years here at School For Classics Ive went through experiences that has shaped me and opened my eyes for the better.', "Being a student at The School for Classics has been a very exalting experience. Coming here as a freshman I became exposed to many different things and many different people. The School for Classics is a very small school located in the community of East New York and because the school is so small,  we're all like a family here. Everyone knows each other, and it s easy to feel comfortable.", "I think this is the best for student who come from outside of the United States. When I came this country I don't know nothing. But my teacher help me a lot. Also administration office help me a lot. I never felt bully. Also school gives me so many opportunities to show myself. The student and teacher are always respect my culture and tradition. We and our teacher believe that respect for all. We are like a biggest family. And school is like our second home. Where we spend a so many hours a day. I never felt boring when I'm in school.", "I did enjoy going to this school. It had its ups and downs but it was a very triumphant experience. I like the fact that the school is so close-knit, I think that's what makes it so special. It feels like family there because everyone tries very hard to establish a community in the school. They work on whatever the students say is being done wrong, and they encourage everything that is being done right. I would choose this school again because it feels like home to me. I couldn't imagine myself being somewhere else.", "I believe that the teachers try their best in uplift the youth in the school. They work hard to push ALL students to academic success, even the ones that have difficulty pushing themselves. The teachers don't just work as hard as they do for a paycheck, you can tell that they genuinely want to see their students grow. I can't say every last one of the teachers there are like that. There's probably like one bad apple out of the mix. However, the rest are great mentors.", 'Being at SFC its great. Students come together to interact with one each other. Even though is a small school we learn a lot from each other and support each other. I would choose this school again if i had the chance because SFC is a home away from home. Its where us teenagers experience and learn our ways. High school is where we find the path we want to take in life. Everytime we have a town hall meeting in the school and i just look around at eveyone in the auditorium... I can see we are all a family in our own unique way', 'Teachers in SFC ( School for classics ) are not bad at all. Great interactions with students. Always willing to help out struggling students. Always there when there is an issue with anything. Theres a great bond with SFC teachers and students. SFC is located in a bad low struggling area of brooklyn but when i go to school, i feel like im safe there and i know everyday im there to learn and the teachers are there helping me achieve my goals', 'At my school there are teachers that you can go and talk to about personal stuff or anything that is affecting you at school. They are also a nurse at the school just in case something happens. They are police guards that help protect the students.', 'They are opportunity for ever one. You get to choose what  you want to do base on  your skills. And they are after school classes that helps you with your work', 'Teachers at my school are well  educated,they encourage and motivate students to do better. They are very co-operative with students in class and out of class. They listen to the students point of view about stuff an correct them if they are wrong. Teachers at  school make students become better at each subject teach , they have a high quality of interacting with students. The teachers like to work with the students as a class so everyone can be on the same level. They teachers grade you on class participation, improvement , homework and assignment/project', 'There are a lot of things that this school needs to improve on, such as the cafeteria, but I did like most of my teachers and made a few friends so overall my experience was okay.', 'Most of the teachers here are very knowledgeable and know how to express that knowledge into information that we can understand.', 'People pretty much did their own thing.', 'My last two years were pretty boring']
column4: ["It was an AMAZING experience! I've learned plenty new things about myself and I've made unforgettable memories.", "My experience there is something to never forget. I walked into that school, low with confidence and now I'm going to be leaving with my head help high. Despite the faults and issues it may have, I'm glad I went here. It helped me find the voice I never thought I had.", "I like that I got the opportunity to graduate early from this school. Also that the guidance department is very effective and on top of things. I dislike that the school is small and that we didn't get to go on a lot of trips.", 'My experience at School For Classics was very terrible. At first, School For Classics is a very boring school as there were barely any type of activities for students to choose. The school is very small as we have a small environment so we did not really do anything. The students at the school are very immature as many fights would always break out and kids are very disrespectful to the teachers. The School was always dirty as it is not cleaned properly and the food was definitely nasty as it would taste like pure crap. The changes that could of have been made to this school was that this school could of have a better environment builded more where I can feel more safe and the school could of have been reconstructed with better colors and better spirit and should create more activities and have more friendly people in the school.', 'I have a great experience in school for Classics from last 3 year. It teach me how to face challenges.', 'The school for classics, i feel like it has a lot of favoritism towards some students. They didnt help me with my college applications had to fill out my FASFA my self its a horrible unorganized school', 'In my 4 years here at School For Classics Ive went through experiences that has shaped me and opened my eyes for the better.', "Being a student at The School for Classics has been a very exalting experience. Coming here as a freshman I became exposed to many different things and many different people. The School for Classics is a very small school located in the community of East New York and because the school is so small,  we're all like a family here. Everyone knows each other, and it s easy to feel comfortable.", "I think this is the best for student who come from outside of the United States. When I came this country I don't know nothing. column1: Harlem Children's Zone Promise Academy II Charter School
column2: ['I am a freshman at Promise Academy 2. I have been attending here since I was in the 3rd grade. My overall experience is amazing. There are so many opportunities the school provides it is amazing. Last year in 8th grade I was given the chance to take  Biology and Algebra. About 18 students and I took the regents for both courses and all passed. I am now a freshman taking Geometry and Earth science. This school gives us a multitude of opportunities to get ahead in our education. The programs are also amazing . From track , to volleyball, to basketball, the school has many fields of sports. Extracurricular activities do also include Music. I myself has been playing the flute at promise academy since 4th grade and I enjoy it. Overall, Promise Academy prepares all of its students and has a variety of opportunities.', 'I enjoyed my self while also learning different things that will help me in the future. If I had to change something it would be the library selection amount.', 'I feel as though I am not just learning inside the classroom at my school. I am learning outside the classroom too, from my fellow classmates who want to engage about the things we have learned. My school is my home away from home.', 'The school started off good when i came in for high school now it did a 360 and its not really doing well.', "Many students complain about poor school lunch or our lack of privileges compared to other High Schools.  I can still honestly say that Promise Academy II is an amazing school.This school provides students with the resources needed to not only graduate High School but also find success at college. As a minority, it is evident that our problems only grow as we exit High School, but Promise Academy II prepares us for the real world. Programs are set into place and each students goes through a journey, finding their role both in and outside of school. However, Promise Academy II does have some poor attributes that can be fixed, its biggest being the fact that Promise Academy II tends to baby their students. They hold our hands all the way up until college, making it difficult for students to adjust to an atmosphere that doesn't  do the same.With a school filled with imperfections, lies a with a perfection in building students mentality as they find their own form of self worth.", "At Promise Academy 1 is okay. I am a Sophmore going to a Junior. In school, there's a lot of stuff that needs to change. Starting with diversity. I get that they are trying to get African Americans to strive for greatness but that's not going to help, when I am in college and introduce to other people outside my race. Also safety may be low because we're in the middle of the projects but nothing drastic gas happen yet. Food is somewhat okay and could be better. Teachers are fine but they tend to stress a lot on athletics than studies. We don't even have a high school library. The teachers do look out for us, especially during out senior year but for this school to be greater they should add more people of a different races.", 'What I liked about Promise Academy II was the students recievd a lot of academic support. The teachers were there to help students with course work if they were having difficulty. What I would like to see change in that school is it needs to become more diverse. Diverse meaning their needs to be more students in the school that are of different race and ethnicity  other than African American.', 'My favorite thing about my school is that they give us a lot of opportunities. They expose us to many different environments, take us to look at colleges and give us help with anything we need. Whether we need help with getting job or fee waivers for taking standardized tests, Promise Academy II is a great help and has continued to show that they care about their students.', "I would like to see a lot change. I feel that if a student is ready to graduate early then they should be allowed to, everything shouldn't be based of the donors or money. Lastly students shouldn't take classes if they aren't needed. They should be able to leave school early and enjoy their HS experience", "I have been going to Harlem Children Zone  Promise Academy 2 charter school since I have 5 years old and now I am 15 years old in my sophomore year. This school is a blessing, both teachers and students have helped me through every problem either academically or socially. This school as taught me that there's going to be someone there for you, trust me someone is alway going to be there to help you, you will never be or feel alone. I would recommend children in New York city to come to this school. This school will always be there for you even when your not I school.", 'Every teacher knows your name. You can never fail in this school because someone will help you get back on track . The class sizes are small. I wish the school was a bit more diverse though. The academics do not present a major challenge. The sports teams are the basic teams nothing exotic.', 'Academics are okay could be better', 'Nothing i would not change', 'More communication should be used to limit the amount of confusion between staff and students']

["If you do what you are suppose to you get put into great classes that you'll get allot out of . \r In the beginning its a hassle to get into your classes of there is a mixup but once you settle In it's great .\r The workload isn't allot of your determined to get great grades.", 'There are many after school activities each maintain allot of audience from both the student body and the parents of the players. The coaches train you with the best of their ability, and each season is fun .', "The teachers are great, they push you to know what you need to know and to be able to compete not only with the kids in your area, but with kids everywhere. They bring fun ways to interact with lessons wether it is groups, Google classroom, plus many more ways. Teachers are passionate about your work so if they see a majority of people weak on a subject they will re teach it. They may be teachers but by the way the care and interact it's like a very educated older friend that wants you to succeed is with you."]

['My experience at life sciences has been good even though it’s had its ups and downs with me it’s still the best experience a high schooler could ask  for .', 'I HATED MY EXPERIENCE HERE! I was not challenged. There was no competition at this school and teachers barely teacher, most to all the teachers gave worksheets (wastes a lot of paper in a school year which makes me even sad) and not teach, I never learned from the teachers and I had to try to learn myself from khan academy or other resources which was very difficult.  The students fool around a lot, it is very easy to get a good grade in the school, I can say that I still worked for my grade but there are many students who ALWAYS  turn in work last minute and would probably get the same grade as me, which isn’t fair for me or the others because of this, standardized test scores like regents, SAT, APs scores are so low, the SAT AVG  many students had below 1000, and the majority had between 700-900 total SAT , 60s on regents, and a very low passing rate on APs. We barely get homework which is to finish CW, Band teacher was amazing though', 'I loved how involved the teachers were with their students whether it had to do with academics or things that were more personal.', 'I really like the bond the students have with the teachers. It’s a really small school with a small amount of students so people get that one on one with teachers when needed.', 'It has a big facility. A diversity of students and some welcoming teachers. Teachers get along with students. Not many sports the gym and auditorium are together. Some main science subject are gone such as chemistry. Not much about college readiness.few fights break out. There is a good amount of security through out the building. Some students are falling behind. Students may take online classes. Not many clubs in this school', 'What makes this school unique for me is the diversity with in it. The teachers of the school are one of the things that stood out to me the most. The teachers actually care about the students. Teachers are understanding on accepting late work and pushing back due dates and taking time out of their day to help students with numerous problems. The teachers try their best to get to know the students in their classes. Another thing that stood out to me from this school was the internship opportunities. Participating in an internship comes with many benefits. Having records of internships looks good on your resume, and stands out to colleges. In conclusion LSSS is a small school, and has very helpful teachers.There are no fights going on in the school, which makes it easier for the students to focus on their work, not on drama. Great principal! She’s very helpful and very good at taking feedback from the students to improve things in the school.', 'What makes this school unique for me was the experience it gave me. I really had fun at this school playing soccer with the team. Although we didn’t win as much, we enjoyed it and supported one another. It felt like everyone was connected. I don’t think there will be something like this at another high school because for me i made a lot of friends and we would often go play outside school.', 'The school provides many opportunities to further your future career with clubs, competitions, and trips. This school is very liberal and open, which I like very much. There is no discrimination between students. Students are open to everyone and everything and it allow students to get a diffferent prospective of what your future is going to look like. In classrooms there are intellectual debates and focus creates an active learning environment. Coming to LSSS was the right decision because you will have a lot of decisions what you will want to do in the future. For example, when I came to this school I was not comfortable talking to people, and now that I am graduating early I am focus and communicating with other students and teachers.', 'The teachers of the school are one of the things that stood out to me the most. The teachers actually care about the students. And I am not just talking about accepting late work, I am talking about pushing back due dates and taking time out of their day to help students with numerous problems. Furthermore, the teachers try their best to get to know the students in their classes. To learn about who the student is, what they like to do, and how they like to learn. Another thing that stood out to me from this school was the internship opportunities. Participating in an internship comes with many benefits. These benefits include but are not limited to: Experience in what your doing at the internship, having records of internships looks good on your resume, and stands out to colleges. In conclusion LSSS is a phenomenal school and I don’t regret coming here.', 'Ls3 is a school where you will find a variety of cultures. The school consists of friendly faces that are pretty welcoming for high school students. You will make friends with very interesting students from all walks of life. The school is not extremely small, but small enough where you feel like everyone is an annoying sibling you love to death. Teachers! Administration! Counselors! make Ls3 very unique. You will not find a more caring staff that is devoted to educating and bettering the future of their students. Most teachers are caring, passionate, and approach teaching with many different styles. Classrooms always feel like an open space. Our staff even comes on Saturdays for tutoring to give extra help. Lastly, what makes LSSS so unique are the academic opportunities that are offered. We have pre-college classes with Hunter College, partnerships with Mt. Sinai, courses at the AMNH, musical summer programs such as NYSSA, All City Choir Chorus, and annual trips to Hamilton!', 'Really great experience! Small school, and very helpful teachers . As well as no fights going on in that school, which makes it easier for the students to focus on their work not on drama. Great principle! She’s very helpful and very good at taking feedback from the students to improve somethings in the school.', 'what i liked bout this school is how the teachers, counselors, and administrators help the students push themselves to their limits', 'What I like about life sciences school is that the teachers are really cool and help you to get to college. It’s a small school but almost everyone gets along and I like it. What I would change about life sciences secondary school is that I think we should do more activities, have more clubs, and have more languages classes.', 'I love the forensics and art classes and teachers. Also my guidance counselor because she makes sure I am on track and she helps me to strive better and be great. She lets me know that I can be anything I want to be and I am a hard worker. I would like to see more cleaner hallways and bathrooms and better food.', 'Life sciences was a rollercoaster experience for me . It was a rollercoaster because I had my good and bad days since freshmen year. Freshmen year the school was crazy and a lot of students were doing bad but as I progressed on moving the 10 , 11 and 12 the grade the school and students got way much better. We got a different principle that enforced the rules and made sure everyone was in class and ready to succeed. Over all it was pretty good because I learned a lot of lessons and things from life science.', 'This school was not very good my freshman year, but it is so much better now that I am a senior. We got a new principal my sophomore year and she listens to students. She lets us go on trips now and we have more clubs. The old principal didn’t let us do anything. There used to be fight in the school everyday and now there are almost none because kids know they will be in trouble. My senior counselor is the best. She has done a lot to help me get into college. Every senior who graduates from Life Sciences gets a full scholarship to Monroe College. This is so good for me. I am really lucky for Ms. Swanson, Ms. Zaharakis, and the teachers here who push me to do my best. No school is perfect, but I am really happy at Life Sciences.', "by far the worst high school i've ever attended, i can begin by stating the counselors assigned to you throughout the year were not helpful at all, they just tell you to do good and get you out of their sight as quickly as possible. Sometimes they get annoyed when you ask too much, sometimes they don't want to see any students at the moment. i can relate to other students as well, there is this one counselor called Diana Cantres, by far the worst counselor ever, never helped me achieve better, she never offered advice, help or opportunities to help better my studies.  i graduated back in 2016.  it has gotten worse over the years ad i am glad i left that school when i did.", "My experience in Life Sciences Secondary School has been very diverse. I entered in my sophomore year and at first it felt welcoming and safe but as time passed it wasn't like that. The building I general is kept clean but the bathrooms are and issue. Some teachers did motivate me to keep trying as hard as I could during these past 2 years. However some teachers are very non caring and just hand out work based on videos. Personally I've had times when I haven't felt safe in school because of fights that have  occurred. However most of the times I do safe. The school has a friendly staff and friendly security who worry about your safety. Academic wise some teachers do challenge you and some teachers don't. Overall I have achieved many great things in the school due to my teachers and especially my guidance counselor who motivates me and other students to try our best and give more than what is expected from us.", "Our principal did not throw away all of the books. I have them in all my classes. There are a lot of good teachers in Life Science but there are bad ones too. They are mean to kids and kick them out of class. The principal won't let them. The bad teachers don't like the new principal. The principal listens to me. I go to her office a lot to tell her when I have problems. She also talks to me during my lunch and gives me granolla bars if I am hungry.", 'Administration threw out all books, while not providing computers, saying they are obsolete!This school FAILS on all levels!It does not educate! No homework!6th to 8th grade state math test was passed by only 5% of students!8th grade English, only 9% passed!Only 2 computers per class, many not connected to Internet!This school is a disgusting excuse for and educational institution!It should be totally restaffed with competent staff, or CLOSED!Link to news article:http://nypost.com/2017/04/29/manhattan-school-trashes-all-its-textbooks/']

Overall I have achieved many great things in the school due to my teachers and especially my guidance counselor who motivates me and other students to try our best and give more than what is expected from us.", "Our principal did not throw away all of the books. I have them in all my classes. There are a lot of good teachers in Life Science but there are bad ones too. They are mean to kids and kick them out of class. The principal won't let them. The bad teachers don't like the new principal. The principal listens to me. I go to her office a lot to tell her when I have problems. She also talks to me during my lunch and gives me granolla bars if I am hungry.", 'Administration threw out all books, while not providing computers, saying they are obsolete!This school FAILS on all levels!It does not educate! No homework!6th to 8th grade state math test was passed by only 5% of students!8th grade English, only 9% passed!Only 2 computers per class, many not connected to Internet!This school is a disgusting excuse for and educational institution!It should be totally restaffed with competent staff, or CLOSED!Link to news article:http://nypost.com/2017/04/29/manhattan-school-trashes-all-its-textbooks/']
column6: ['My experience at life sciences has been good even though it’s had its ups and downs with me it’s still the best experience a high schooler could ask  for .', 'I HATED MY EXPERIENCE HERE! I was not challenged. There was no competition at this school and teachers barely teacher, most to all the teachers gave worksheets (wastes a lot of paper in a school year which makes me even sad) and not teach, I never learned from the teachers and I had to try to learn myself from khan academy or other resources which was very difficult.  The students fool around a lot, it is very easy to get a good grade in the school, I can say that I still worked for my grade but there are many students who ALWAYS  turn in work last minute and would probably get the same grade as me, which isn’t fair for me or the others because of this, standardized test scores like regents, SAT, APs scores are so low, the SAT AVG  many students had below 1000, and the majority had between 700-900 total SAT , 60s on regents, and a very low passing rate on APs. We barely get homework which is to finish CW, Band teacher was amazing though', 'I loved how involved the teachers were with their students whether it had to do with academics or things that were more personal.', 'I really like the bond the students have with the teachers. It’s a really small school with a small amount of students so people get that one on one with teachers when needed.', 'It has a big facility. A diversity of students and some welcoming teachers. Teachers get along with students. Not many sports the gym and auditorium are together. Some main science subject are gone such as chemistry. Not much about college readiness.few fights break out. There is a good amount of security through out the building. Some students are falling behind. Students may take online classes. Not many clubs in this school', 'What makes this school unique for me is the diversity with in it. The teachers of the school are one of the things that stood out to me the most. The teachers actually care about the students. Teachers are understanding on accepting late work and pushing back due dates and taking time out of their day to help students with numerous problems. The teachers try their best to get to know the students in their classes. Another thing that stood out to me from this school was the internship opportunities. Participating in an internship comes with many benefits. Having records of internships looks good on your resume, and stands out to colleges. In conclusion LSSS is a small school, and has very helpful teachers.There are no fights going on in the school, which makes it easier for the students to focus on their work, not on drama. Great principal! She’s very helpful and very good at taking feedback from the students to improve things in the school.', 'What makes this school unique for me was the experience it gave me. I really had fun at this school playing soccer with the team. Although we didn’t win as much, we enjoyed it and supported one another. It felt like everyone was connected. I don’t think there will be something like this at another high school because for me i made a lot of friends and we would often go play outside school.', 'The school provides many opportunities to further your future career with clubs, competitions, and trips. This school is very liberal and open, which I like very much. There is no discrimination between students. Students are open to everyone and everything and it allow students to get a diffferent prospective of what your future is going to look like. In classrooms there are intellectual debates and focus creates an active learning environment. Coming to LSSS was the right decision because you will have a lot of decisions what you will want to do in the future. For example, when I came to this school I was not comfortable talking to people, and now that I am graduating early I am focus and communicating with other students and teachers.', 'The teachers of the school are one of the things that stood out to me the most. The teachers actually care about the students. And I am not just talking about accepting late work, I am talking about pushing back due dates and taking time out of their day to help students with numerous problems. Furthermore, the teachers try their best to get to know the students in their classes. To learn about who the student is, what they like to do, and how they like to learn. Another thing that stood out to me from this school was the internship opportunities. Participating in an internship comes with many benefits. These benefits include but are not limited to: Experience in what your doing at the internship, having records of internships looks good on your resume, and stands out to colleges. In conclusion LSSS is a phenomenal school and I don’t regret coming here.', 'Ls3 is a school where you will find a variety of cultures. The school consists of friendly faces that are pretty welcoming for high school students. You will make friends with very interesting students from all walks of life. The school is not extremely small, but small enough where you feel like everyone is an annoying sibling you love to death. Teachers! Administration! Counselors! make Ls3 very unique. You will not find a more caring staff that is devoted to educating and bettering the future of their students. Most teachers are caring, passionate, and approach teaching with many different styles. Classrooms always feel like an open space. Our staff even comes on Saturdays for tutoring to give extra help. Lastly, what makes LSSS so unique are the academic opportunities that are offered. We have pre-college classes with Hunter College, partnerships with Mt. Sinai, courses at the AMNH, musical summer programs such as NYSSA, All City Choir Chorus, and annual trips to Hamilton!', 'Really great experience! Small school, and very helpful teachers . As well as no fights going on in that school, which makes it easier for the students to focus on their work not on drama. Great principle! She’s very helpful and very good at taking feedback from the students to improve somethings in the school.', 'what i liked bout this school is how the teachers, counselors, and administrators help the students push themselves to their limits', 'What I like about life sciences school is that the teachers are really cool and help you to get to college. It’s a small school but almost everyone gets along and I like it. What I would change about life sciences secondary school is that I think we should do more activities, have more clubs, and have more languages classes.', 'I love the forensics and art classes and teachers. Also my guidance counselor because she makes sure I am on track and she helps me to strive better and be great. She lets me know that I can be anything I want to be and I am a hard worker. I would like to see more cleaner hallways and bathrooms and better food.', 'Life sciences was a rollercoaster experience for me . It was a rollercoaster because I had my good and bad days since freshmen year. Freshmen year the school was crazy and a lot of students were doing bad but as I progressed on moving the 10 , 11 and 12 the grade the school and students got way much better. We got a different principle that enforced the rules and made sure everyone was in class and ready to succeed. Over all it was pretty good because I learned a lot of lessons and things from life science.', 'This school was not very good my freshman year, but it is so much better now that I am a senior. We got a new principal my sophomore year and she listens to students. She lets us go on trips now and we have more clubs. The old principal didn’t let us do anything. There used to be fight in the school everyday and now there are almost none because kids know they will be in trouble. My senior counselor is the best. She has done a lot to help me get into college. Every senior who graduates from Life Sciences gets a full scholarship to Monroe College. This is so good for me. I am really lucky for Ms. Swanson, Ms. Zaharakis, and the teachers here who push me to do my best. No school is perfect, but I am really happy at Life Sciences.', "by far the worst high school i've ever attended, i can begin by stating the counselors assigned to you throughout the year were not helpful at all, they just tell you to do good and get you out of their sight as quickly as possible. Sometimes they get annoyed when you ask too much, sometimes they don't want to see any students at the moment. i can relate to other students as well, there is this one counselor called Diana Cantres, by far the worst counselor ever, never helped me achieve better, she never offered advice, help or opportunities to help better my studies.  i graduated back in 2016.  it has gotten worse over the years ad i am glad i left that school when i did.", "My experience in Life Sciences Secondary School has been very diverse. I entered in my sophomore year and at first it felt welcoming and safe but as time passed it wasn't like that. The building I general is kept clean but the bathrooms are and issue. Some teachers did motivate me to keep trying as hard as I could during these past 2 years. However some teachers are very non caring and just hand out work based on videos. Personally I've had times when I haven't felt safe in school because of fights that have  occurred. However most of the times I do safe. The school has a friendly staff and friendly security who worry about your safety. Academic wise some teachers do challenge you and some teachers don't. Overall I have achieved many great things in the school due to my teachers and especially my guidance counselor who motivates me and other students to try our best and give more than what is expected from us.", "Our principal did not throw away all of the books. I have them in all my classes. There are a lot of good teachers in Life Science but there are bad ones too. They are mean to kids and kick them out of class. The principal won't let them. The bad teachers don't like the new principal. The principal listens to me. I go to her office a lot to tell her when I have problems. She also talks to me during my lunch and gives me granolla bars if I am hungry.", 'Administration threw out all books, while not providing computers, saying they are obsolete!This school FAILS on all levels!It does not educate! No homework!6th to 8th grade state math test was passed by only 5% of students!8th grade English, only 9% passed!Only 2 computers per class, many not connected to Internet!This school is a disgusting excuse for and educational institution!It should be totally restaffed with competent staff, or CLOSED!Link to news article:http://nypost.com/2017/04/29/manhattan-school-trashes-all-its-textbooks/']
column8: ['What I enjoyed  about life sciences secondary is the school exposes students to a rich and diverse group of peers which whom they can relate to. The school has amazing staff members who are decicated to help their students. However, there are occasionally incidents that happen during the school year but the students create wonderful relationships with other people within the school so they have at least one individual to talk to during any incidents.', 'Life sciences is a great school! The teachers try there best to work with you and your scheduals as well as do everything they can to help you pass regents and SATs.', 'The teachers are very great and very attentive. Some of the students come to school just to disrupt others. But if you are there to learn and just have a great high school experience then this is the school for you!!!', 'One of my favorite things about this school are the teachers. I got close to a few and they made high school bearable. Also, the location allowed me to meets many different types of people, from races to socioeconomic status.', 'Most of the teachers are great people but the material is going to be boring either way', 'Afterschool programs are improving. So far the academic afterschool programs are very helpful.', 'Overall the teachers are good! There will always be some teachers who are lazier than others but for the most part all the teachers do their job efficiently.', 'The school spirit is definitely there.', "It's not terrible but the new principle sucked", 'The school can use some work. The school is not organized at all ,out of the three years i have been there the frustration of getting the correct classes i need or a simple request to change may schedule change so i can have ap classes during my senior year was completely ignored.when i tried to leave my sophomore year they refused to let me.I cant stress enough my regret coming here, atleast it my last year.', 'People have tried intimidating but they have been ignored.  Do not have time for that.', 'School cafeteria/lunch....it is bad.  No variety for allergies....grrrrr', 'Would not recommend this school to any one.......at times it is a joke.', 'This school has a gym/auditorium - combination.\r No pool, lockers or fields to actually practice at their own school.  \r Few athletic clubs......baseball, soccer, basketball?\r Track - never had in the years I have been there; it is advertised in the HS book but it is non-existant', 'There are some good teachers in the HS....but unfortunately the new principal is alienating them too.  Quite a few are looking to leave in the near future.', 'Certain clubs were cut short in the middle of the year because of funding.\r New principal is alienating students from joining......thank god I am a Senior', 'Teachers know what they are doing thats all that matters', 'The guidance counselors do help you a lot, however you must take the initiative', "This school has such great teachers that could actually be your friend, how ever the lack of respect some students have is ridiculous. I  however don't deal with them and its actually great because past all of that you will have a good time.", 'Our new principal has taken over our school and ever since then, things have been going downhill safety wise.']

column2: ['Flushing High School in my opinion is a very good school. Ive seen a tremedous amount of growth from my freshman year to now my senior. Dont listen to everyone else when they say Flushing is bad becuase it is not at all. Yes it may have been failing before, but its rising higher everyday.', "the teachers are very helpful and know what they are doing. Getting me ready for college. the programs that they provide helps me with learning more about the college and what's expected from me when I am in college. the college counselors are very helpful they will actually make u do and finish the applications needed.", 'Flushing High School is getting better every year. Each year students get to experience new things and the teachers are amazing. The most important part is, they provide AP classes for the Honor students who actually deserve it. Science, Business, Law are the majors that you can get in Flushing High school. If you do well You well get your points. I always had 90+ in every class, some of them are stressful but I managed to cope with it.', "Flushing High School is like every other school. Everything you put into the school is what you're going to get out of it. The sports teams are either totally there or not at all. It is a very fun school if you befriend the right people.", 'I been attending Flushing High School since 9th grade. One thing I love about Flushing High School is that it is one of the biggest multicultural schools in New York City. Throughout my four years attending that school, this high school been through a lot. Getting new principals year after the next, and being considered under one of the highest renewal schools in the city. But after the past two years we finally made it out of the renewal school in NYC', 'I’m currently a senior at this school and I cannot wait to leave honestly . This school isn’t absolutely terrible but the teachers are the main issue. First off, the students are taking classes that they don’t need which keeps them in the building for a longer period of time. Students could be using this time to actually study, get home earlier, get more sleep and maybe they would actually make it to first period on time. Some of the teachers genuinely do but the amount that don’t outweigh them drastically . Seniors will have it hard at this school . Imagine having to stay the whole day and take 9 classes when you only need 2 more credits to graduate . If students attended school for the classes they actually needed then these same students would be Able to get a job and be more independent, the same thing that this school tries to preach. This school has some serious issues. I wish the incoming students the best of luck', "My experience at Flushing High School was a wild ride! It was filled with its ups and downs. The teachers, oof!, don't even get me started on them. While some promoted educational learning and made learning in class fun; others just made it too obvious that they did NOT care! The faculty and staff were extremely helpful especially when it came to the important stuff like college applications. The classmates and friends I made were what truly made the experience better. Over the 4 years that I have spent here I have grown as a person thanks to myself, my friends, and my teachers!", 'Flushing High School has gone through a change that apparently benefiting students numerically speaking but not academically in the way the administrator wants classroom lessons to be taught.', 'Regardless of what people think bullying, fighting, and other worse scenarios happens within all high schools in New York. Flushing is not as bad as people put it to be.  Although some teacher does not really know how to teach, overall most of the time Flushing High School has a great learning environment. Ultimately Flushing High School is a decent school. If you know what you goal are when coming to High school then flushing will not be a problem. But due to the schools overall performance as a renewal school the high performers suffer.', 'Flushing high school had good courses of AP and had a variety of sports ! Yet , Flushing high school has long periods of days , since it’s a remedial school . Even seniors have to stay long periods .', "It was an average experience I felt as if there could have been more to my years there . Lack of technology and new resources to enhance my experience . I enjoyed playing sports with the school .Some of the teachers are cool others lack English and the full capability for students. The resources are there but in my senior year its like they didn't help to there full ability and got fed up and frustrated to even help students and a lot of favoritism involved.", 'So far my experience as a Flushing High Student was average . The staff and teachers are great. They are supportive and care for there students . Some students in this school don’t care to do work and see school as a sociable place . It is a sociable place but you must get your work done in order to fully get educated and be aware of opportunities. This school is a remedial school which isn’t so pleasant , for those who do there work and have to pay of the consequences who don’t . Including seniors who have to stay a full schedule even if they have most of there credits . I wish to graduate sooner , only need 5 more credits . Yet I still have to attend a full day of 9 period long . It’s mentally exhausting since you want to prepare your self for college with useful information not electives.', 'What I personally like about Flushing Highschool is all the different sport you can play all the teachers you could talk to to get advice on a certain situation it’s overall friendly and very diverse place to be however there are some thing I would like to see change on is the bathrooms they look like they never have changed the bathroom facilities also there are no mirrors in the bathroom I would also like to see change is that teacher would get an opportunity to teach what they want and not follow a curriculum on the most boring stories ever told and instead choose books that would grab a students attention and make it so a student would want to read more often instead of being in class bored and not even following along when a person is reading the stories with this being the only problems I see flushing is overall a great place to attend', 'A lot of diversity in this school. It’s definitely a place where everyone can learn from each other .', 'Many people say that Flushing High School is not really a good school, and it might be true, but Flushing is very diverse and there are many clubs and activities and we still need more but we have more clubs and activities-along with sports  than any other school. Flushing High School is also a safe place to stay in, there’s no bullying or racism. We have many good teachers who try to make students do their best.', 'I entered FHS as a freshman with the clear goal to make it through the year and transfer to a “better” school but now if I could do it all over again I wouldn’t. Not ably have I made life long friends at this school but I learned more about myself and the real world. This school may not be the best academically but it gives you opportunities and if you’re smart enough to take those opportunities you’ll have teachers who will help and support you. Now this school isn’t perfect, far from it, we have out dated computers and there are students who get into fights and cause chaos. Still, like in any school it’s your choice who you choose to hang out with and if you decide to focus on school or goofing off.', 'Flushing high school is like any other high school. They have the same goal like any other high school to educate teenagers and to lead them on the right path. Teachers are very helpful and friendly. This school stands out the most for all the advance placement classes provided getting you ready for college.', 'I respect flushing. I know the state and other people may not see what I see in flushing but it is ok. I’ll tell you why I respect it. We do have the resources we need for college( as well as college classes), for regents, homework help, social workers, their are teachers that you can talk to about anything. Their are teachers whom are dedicated just like students. Although flushing is a renewal school just make the best out of it. Teachers and staff know me because I’m well involved in school activities such as Peer Mediation and PGC ( Peer Group Connection) we are trying to make it a better environment, but it’s not always staff, teachers, deans, assistant principal, etc fault if a student isn’t as dedicated. Like I said before just make the best out of it, it’ll pay off. Teachers do see your effort and their is compensation besides a grade like prizes, rewards, certificates of excellence.', 'My experience in flushing high school was amazing since I make new connections like that can support in my future like my teachers,staff and friends. I can learn new thing like to be leadership also share good moments to be in clud or help people in community service.', "The reason I gave Flushing 4 stars is mainly because I've learned different learning tactics but I also learned outside information as well. Flushing has taught me tremendously of how to be prepared for the real world, especially with college classes, but I didn't give the full 5 stars mainly because i dont feel mentally prepared in math classes. My math scores are low because of poor math teachers. There's no other complaints, but if I was given a proper math teacher from freshman year, I would have gave 5 stars."]

column6: ["It's really not the bad school that everyone thing is. When I first got to the school I was scared because I thought I would've gotten stabbed or something bad. I eventually learned that just as long as i focused on my school work I'd be fine. Now that I'm a senior I hold a 92 overall average and I rank number 17 out of 372 senior in Flushing High School. If you go to flushing or any school you really just have to focus on yourself and not other people and you'll be just fine.", 'While the school does not have a good reputation, there are a surprising amount of good things that the school has going for it. Sports teams are very popular here, and there are other clubs such as drama club or even virtual enterprise. Though there are some aspects of the school that bring its reputation down like rowdy students or underfunded facilities, the heart of the school is open to those who really want to enjoy their time here.', 'I started flushing in the 2016-2017 year, and i have really enjoyed my experience overall. Some say its a bad school but its not as bad as you think, if you make sure you get your work done and not hang with the wrong crowd then this school could be a great choice for you. The only thing i dislike is the 9 periods, which is rough for some kids who are planning to work afterschool, like me. I take classes that I dont even need! But besides this, the school is great.', "Flushing is a great school for the most part.There are so many teachers that provide tutoring and stay after school to help students however the students don't really take advantage of it.", 'Coming from a third world country in 2016, it is the first school that I went to in US and the school embraced me with her arms wide open. The school not only taught me academic subjects but also enlightened me with morality and code of life. Both the teachers and the students gave me a warm welcome and introduced me to the American culture. My peers broadened my horizons everyday not only through their diverse cultures and backgrounds but also in the way they encountered and dealt with problems. The teachers are dedicated to their subject and  passionate for helping their students as well. I am grateful for the environment that I found in Flushing High school, which allowed me to pursue the unexplored and the uncharted within the context of the familiar.', "Flushing high school is good only if you do what you have to do and respect the teacher's,  do your work, and  pass all ecams and classes. To feel more close join a sport or club it won't hurt.", "I've had many friends who attended this school or transferred due to feeling alone in a student body. They would complain about the lack of care from teachers/counselors and the violence/aggression from students that just isn't dealt with with everyone's needs kept in mind.", 'Being in this school I learned a lot about business from the virtual enterprise class they have. It taught me about marketing different products and even accounting handling the amounts of products we were selling and keeping inventory. We was taught how to operate a human resource department when hiring new employees and handling all the paperwork getting new employees put in.', 'flushing high school is very good school, the teacher has cared about those students, more academics.', "This school is full of great teachers that care about your education and care about the school. As long as you care about your education and put in your share of effort, you'll have a great high school experience.", 'Flushing High School was just like any other high school. Athletics were average, and not all the teachers were great. Of course, there were some teachers that truly loved their job, but there were also many people that should not be teachers.', 'The teachers were amazing.they were really helpful and motivating.i stayed four years there and were the best days of my life. I was a foreign student so they actually fixed my english such as speaking wise and writing wise.', "The teachers aren't as motivational. They don't push you to do better and rules aren't enforced as much.", 'The deas and police are armed and always monitor classes and hallways.', 'Most of the students are awful. There are fights everywhere and constant fighting between student and teachers. Some teachers and the school deans take a lot of action. But it does not feel be to safe both inside and outside school. I wonder if the parents of those students know how they are making the school environment unappealing.', 'The AP teachers are great.They are helpful and provide a lot of material and practice for the students.But it is not the same case for regular classes; regular classes are worse and the students are disrespecting and the teachers do not take much action to control the students.', "the nurse's office was minimal. they didn't do much when you went to them.", 'I would choose this school again because of the friends I made, and the excellent teachers I had for English and history.', 'As a whole, the teachers are good. Some teachers care more than others.', 'People tend to be extremely accepting in this school, and no one is really judged for their sexuality, race, or whatever. Students are also involved with volunteer work, and Arista, etc.']
column8: ["There are a lot of after school activities but a lot of them are overlooked because the staff doesn't put as much effort in to keeping them going as they should.", 'If I overlooked all the bad there were actually slot of good aspects in the school experience', 'School lunch is really disturbing but the fruits are well appreciated', 'They try to really enforce there rules and they have been improving', 'This one of the highlights of this school it has pretty good sports teams', 'Some of the teachers are really hard to work with but majority are actual caring and very helpful.', 'This school really exposed me to alot of things I learned How to work in an environment where things where not always positive', 'Their are many extracrriculars although their could be more.', 'Many of the staff in Flushing high school are helpful and willing to make sure you succeed but many also do not care and will do any and everything in their power to hurt you', 'The food looks unappetizing, lacks flavor, and tastes weird.', 'disgusting food, it also doesnt look eatable', 'The football team is one of the most noticed teams other than that the teams fade away into the sun', 'Teachers at this school can be very helpful while other can be very nasty and rude.', "I'd say the resources are pretty average for a local high school. They may not be as fancy and as advanced as newer school which have better funding, but it's reasonable. There are enough college prep resources, plenty of tutoring opportunities if you simply reach out for help, and technology is average.", 'i have made many great friends and have had many great teachers and sports team experiences.', 'the teachers really care about their students and help them pass', 'Students who break the rules get punished so they wont do it again.', 'We have many after and before school academic tutoring options.', 'The food is decent and everyone can eat it. They provide many fruits and vegetables.', 'Students will get in a lot of trouble if caught with any illegal or bad substances.']

column2: ['I loved the teacher(s) involvement in our success. It felt great knowing that they were there to support me. One thing that I would change would have to be how they prepare their students for college. Giving their students tougher course expectations.', "Fannie Lou Hamer Freedom High School is what I would call The Bronx's hidden treasure.  It is a community school, housed with individuals that truly care about their students, their families and community.  From the janitor to security, the teachers, staff and the Principal...  I have never encountered a greater bunch.  You walk into the school and immediately feel the warmth coming from all directions.  Greeted always with a smile and warm embrace.  Everyone knows every child, and they make it a point to get to know their parents and meet our concerns.  They focus greatly on finding out their students interests and match them and their interests with programs and internship to prepare them for life after high school.  Programs and internships in education and journalism, business, politics and more.  My son has learned and grown so much in the years he has attended Fannie Lou Hamer.", "I enjoy the atmosphere and how small the school is. Everyone knows everyone and we can speak to the teachers on a first name basis and it doesn't create a sort of barrier. It's welcoming, however the curriculum is a problem. It feels like i'm being repeatedly taught the same things over and over.", 'I loved how the teachers are so welcoming and helpful. They care about your future. I like all the great opportunity that they give you in the school. Its like Fannie Lou Hamer Freedom High school is like a big family.', "Very open and diverse school, caring teachers. Great academics. School Activities are extremely helpful and open possible opportunity doors towards the future. The school safety is pretty good can't complain. College readiness classes are very on point.", 'This school is the best fit for a parent who wants to see their son/daughter succeed. The safety is a 100%. The learning is 100%. Students events are youth lead. Parents voices are heard in the school', 'The sports team in this school is amazing. We won the ‘PSAL’ B Division Championship of 2016-2017. The teachers are all amazing. The safety in the school is well controlled. The school itself is a safe environment. Student government makes sure every event in the school is great.', 'This school is amazing because it offers variety of opportunities for students. They make sure you’re apart of real world learning activities. The school itself is one big community - we have a great student government body. Excellent sports team! The staffs are all respectful and the students feel safe at all times.', 'This school differs from others being as it may be a portfolio school and the teachers are really good. The environment is clean and we feel safe each and every day in attendance.', 'I enjoyed my experience at Fannie Lou even though that the school is not the same as an average High School. The experience is different from any other school just by attending this High School. The education is different from many school, the way things are being ran in the schools, rules and regulations as well.', 'I loved the support. Most of the staff was there to push you and give a listening ear whenever you needed it.  The one thing I would want to see changed is teachers (very few) who were more concerned with receiving an actual room to teach in than making sure their students understood what they were trying to teach.', 'It was a great school from the start. The teachers were all very understanding. It was the Trump era and so they sympathized with the kids of color and respected us', 'They always check if there is something suspicious in order to protect the school and students', 'Besides sports , u rarely see students  participate after school activities.', 'As far as I know, parents in my high school are nice to teachers', 'The teachers are respectful and they always help get past certain stuff', 'The people in the school are different from my other school so i doubt I would do that school over again.', 'The teachers in my school are the best and they really will help anybody out as long as you willing to put the work in.', "Most teacher are genuinely nice and care about student's success in the future and are mostly always inside their classrooms whenever the student needs tutoring or assistance on something they're having trouble with. Their consistency is somewhat good and bad but are overall are outgoing teachers and also advisers as well.", "Aside from Basketball, Baseball, Wrestling, Anime, Student Government, there are clubs for every one to participate in.  The Children's Aid Society helps to set students up with wonderful internships.  There are specialized classes on Saturdays to help parents with ESL and ELL concerns, a Health and Human Sexuality class designed to help parent discuss sex education with their teenaged children.  This particular class was bi-lingual and had about 25 parents every Saturday from October until May.  We even had a graduation ceremony at Hunter College."]

column6: ['I have trained with some of the teachers at the school.  they are professional, confident, and highly effective in their practice.  Student engagement is paramount to their teaching.', "They are anti bullying school.  the Students have Peace Rallies every year where various organizations and politicians come out and participate in a march against violence.  It is one of the most powerful events that the school does annually.\r Bullying is unacceptable and actually does not happen.  It is one of the few schools in the Bronx that DOES NOT have a metal detector.  they do no believe in criminalizing the students.  The Children's Aid Society does a wonderful job of bringing programs to help students with eye glasses, tutoring, mental and physical health.", 'This is a digital portfolio school where students are taught to master the subjects they learn.  they prepare essays and defend their learning at the end of each semester.  they are taught to critically think about social justice issues concerning their communities.', "I haven't seen any extracurricular activities after school besides sports.", 'My experience so far has been okay.', 'The teachers are great some more than others.', 'The school takes health and safety very important. They do their very best to make sure all of the students are healthy and safe inside the building.', 'I always see a lot of kids taking part of extracurriculars.', 'My overall experiences about this school is that its better than the school I came from and I appreciate the effort they do to make sure i understand the lessons I thank this school for pushing me a lot to do better.', 'The teachers try their very best to have all the student to engage in learn and to sit there and have time for them after school, including at lunch and gym as well. These teacher put 1000% in helping students.', "The clubs were there but if it's not sports lost students wouldn't join", "My overall experience at this school was hell , I got bullied , picked on for being black in a largely Hispanic school, the kids are having sexual relations in bathrooms and staircases , kids are gambling at lunch , fights were never one on one most likely you will be jumped of fighting in this school and the school calls your parents if you don't come but most parents don't care anyway", 'The teachers are here and there', 'Students come away from the Fannie Lou Hamer Freedom school knowing that they belong to the greater community.  They are capable of articulating the issues and determining possible solutions.  They can research and present information knowing that their voices will be heard and their conclusions will be given acknowledgement.  My  son is ready for college.  He researched the school he wanted to go to .  He figured out the pros and cons and presented the best case for wanting to attend the college of his choice.  He followed up with a visit, an interview and has received for his efforts a conditional letter of acceptance.  He has to graduate from HS first.  Without the nurturing and the preparation at FLHFHS, he would not have made the slightest effort to find the school that would best fit his needs.  This school has taught him how to advocate for himself and to stand for what is right.', 'What makes this school unique that it has a own section called success path where 11th and 12th graders goes to see what scholarship are offered, what career/study path the students wanna take, help 12th graders to apply what college they want to attend and help them fill out there financial aid. My favorite experiences where they where enrichment programs where 9th and 10th graders goes to there favorite sites like office work or working with children in schools. Also during the 11th and 12th grade there were internships where students choose their internship where they could travel and gain experiences to put on their resume. I wish I could do this all over again because this school has helped me achieve my goals, and the teachers would plan trips base on the project we work on.', 'Fannie Lou Hamer Freedom High school is a great high school that focuses on college preparation and is business oriented. As a student in this school, I can say it is one of the best schools. We have a lot of clubs and after school activities. The staff is amazing and the teachers make sure you are all caught up with your school work. The work is challenging but we learn a lot after we complete it. There a couple of sports offered to us and there is no experience needed.', 'They offer a variety of different sports and are always open to starting new sports', 'The teachers I have had in Fannie Lou are all dedicated to preparing us for college and our future in the world', 'This school shaped me into a better person academically and morally', 'I am a picky eater so I bring lunch daily however there are some options that are appealing']

column2: ['Throughout my experience in this school i have been exposed to many new things. Every year we are given an opportunity to hear from alums and this has helped me shaped the person i have chosen to become. Overall, this school has greatly prepared me for college and i feel beyond ready to experience my future life.', "The Frederick Douglass Academy inundates students from low-income families with college prep by supplying  teachers from high-ranking colleges to ensure that every student is given a higher education. The academics involve a rigorous amount of coursework to ensure that students graduate from  school with high grades, celebrating their grit at the end of the year. When you’re in FDA, you're greeted by clubs ranging from robotics to fencing, basketball, football, samba, softball, volleyball, taekwondo, wrestling, and lacrosse teams. Another feature from FDA are AP courses offered to the students from Computer Science to Euro, Statistics, Microeconomics, Physics, and Spanish; teachers make themselves available to their students after their AP exams by offering them laptops, one-on-one meetings to help a student prepare for the college process, and tutorials after classes. I can't recommend this school enough to anyone who seeks a fulfilling high school experience.", 'Good school to go to for college readiness. Good environment. Teachers are well connected with the students. Athletic programs aren’t so bad.', 'Frederick Douglass Academy has variety selections of classes. School safety is very on point with what they do and protecting the students. Also when it comes to extra curricular activities and clubs Frederick Douglass Academy has that to offer.', 'FDA is so diverse with students that come from various different backgrounds. They have so many different sports and the teachers care about teaching there.', 'The school is awesome in Advance Placement courses. However, the courses are only limited to about 7-8 courses. he school has amazing high school teachers, but the school lacks appreciation for them. FDA needs to improve on how they treat the Honor Roll students and not admire or pat those who do wrong because the honor students do not get paid lots of attention for their academics.', 'My school is a school full of diversity and opportunities! We are one of very few schools in Manhattan who offer Ap courses in several different subjects to high school students. My school pushes the drive and ambition they see in the students who attend there. We take very much pride in sports just as we put our education first. Frederick Douglass Academy is a place where they produce not only black excellence, but excellence in all race and  gender!', 'I have been able to see many different cultures and people at this school. I have by waking the halls and going on college trips.Along with that when in class I can see the diversity.', 'my overall experience at FDA has been mainly good. I have met many brilliant teachers and have has the chance to connect with tons of intelligent scholars around me. Sometimes our resources are limited but we make do with what we have.', 'I would like to see more disciplines students at the school. I fely like that was my main problem. I liked a lot of my teachers there and several helped me find what I wanted to do with my life along with helping me prepare for all potential difficulties of college. After 4 years I felt like all teachers really did care about what was wrong with me and how my grades were.', 'Teachers don’t deeply care about students academic interests. Grading system is unfair. Mediocre lunch.Bad graduation rate and college acceptance rate.A lot of clubs and activities and sports.School requires a lot of security to be kept safe. The school basically accepts anybody. Average facilities and low parent involvement.', 'I like that the teachers are willing to work with students and that there are a lot opportunities through the school', 'Frederick Douglass isn’t the best School, but when it comes down to academics and outside programs it excels. From having a range of AP classes, many outside educational programs, and some teachers who stick by your side and help you find your true voice it is a truly good school. However, sometimes the staff of the school, including some teachers are unprofessional and lack authority making the school run wild and less productive.', 'My experience was very positive, I was introduced to many different sports, supporting teachers and it was a school that prepared for the next level of education.', 'FDA is a diamond in the rough. There are sooo many opportunities there that go untouched. Graduated in 2018, had really great teachers all 4 years. They just need to have a more difficult screening process to ensure that only right kids can attend.', 'Frederick Douglass has provided me  a great experience in the last few years. I have gotten teachers who really gave me a great education and actually made the class fun to be in.  I made a lot of memorizes with the friends that I have gain in this school and will probably still be in contact with after high school.  Even though I never been apart of the sports/clubs in the school I can truly say that they are provide a good experience for the students and also provides huge opportunities for them.', 'If your looking for the most disciplined school to learn your looking at the wrong school. FDA is a public college predatory school that has great staff, teachers and athletics and some great connections. Every school has a couple knuckle heads (maybe a lot) but if you have a certain goal and stick with the right people you will thrive tremendously and find yourself in a great position.', "I acknowledge that my experience may no longer be of use due to recent administration change.I have mixed feelings about my time FDA. I did not feel safe, some instructors and faculty were rude, and students, while exceptionally bright, were also the rudest and often violent. However, the school works towards having as many students in advanced courses and offers a variety of extracurricular activities beyond athletics, such as robotics. There are teachers there who genuinely care about the success of their students and are truly amazing even if they are strict. I credit my continued success to one them. Despite often wishing I went elsewhere, there were some aspects I'm glad to have experienced.", "It's a school made for committed and social people but tends to overburden the students. It has a very good AP classes and food. The atmosphere is split and is very simplistic into groups of people.", 'The thing I like about Frederick Douglass Academy is that it has a lot of extra-curricular activities for people to participate in. I also like how there is a lot of Advanced Placement classes to choose from. The thing that I would like to see change is the amount of notifications/announcements that are made to students regarding very important crucial information.']
