Even though I never been apart of the sports/clubs in the school I can truly say that they are provide a good experience for the students and also provides huge opportunities for them.', 'If your looking for the most disciplined school to learn your looking at the wrong school. FDA is a public college predatory school that has great staff, teachers and athletics and some great connections. Every school has a couple knuckle heads (maybe a lot) but if you have a certain goal and stick with the right people you will thrive tremendously and find yourself in a great position.', "I acknowledge that my experience may no longer be of use due to recent administration change.I have mixed feelings about my time FDA. I did not feel safe, some instructors and faculty were rude, and students, while exceptionally bright, were also the rudest and often violent. However, the school works towards having as many students in advanced courses and offers a variety of extracurricular activities beyond athletics, such as robotics. There are teachers there who genuinely care about the success of their students and are truly amazing even if they are strict. I credit my continued success to one them. Despite often wishing I went elsewhere, there were some aspects I'm glad to have experienced.", "It's a school made for committed and social people but tends to overburden the students. It has a very good AP classes and food. The atmosphere is split and is very simplistic into groups of people.", 'The thing I like about Frederick Douglass Academy is that it has a lot of extra-curricular activities for people to participate in. I also like how there is a lot of Advanced Placement classes to choose from. The thing that I would like to see change is the amount of notifications/announcements that are made to students regarding very important crucial information.']
column6: ['Great school. Good staff as well as education. They provide many extracurricular activities such as sports and clubs. Good at college preparation.', "My experience at Frederick Douglass Academy I can truly say was interesting but Litt in a way where I made many friends that I can get along with. I was known as the athletic, energetic, and to others weird or funny. I got along with teachers and i can say the teachers who encourage you to do better and gives you challenges and opportunities they care the most about you. One of the hardest things I can say about FDA is don't follow the crowed, be a leader or have your own crowed that wants to do something with there life. As long as I been here I can say that I learn a lot on life and learned situations  to where who your real friends are and who are going to be there when you struggle.", "In my time at FDA I enjoyed the many opportunities given to me like the robotics team their and the various amounts of sport clubs. If I had to change one thing it would be the method on how they prepare their seniors for college because when I first started applying I didn't fell very much supported.", 'My experience in Frederick Douglass Academy is okay it could’ve been better. It would’ve been better if we had more recent resources that would help us do well in our academics. Overall, the teachers there are great they are there for me when I need help with anything. But because of the students they get the school looks bad which needs to change.', 'I liked my high school because I met a lot of great people there. My teachers got me prepared for college. The teacher I think got me the most prepared for college had to have been Mrs. Jones. Her class almost identically mirrored my college course. To sum it up, my high school was decent.', 'Overall a very good school, with friendly and caring teachers and staff. Although in the past, it used to be much better. There are still lots of opportunities and a good amount of resources and connections, however, students simply don’t take advantage of them, which negatively impacts the school. The students are, in general, very close-knit; once a lion always a lion!', "IT WAS AN OK SCHOOL BUT I WISH THEY HAD BETTER AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND CLUBS AND I WISH THAT THEY BETTER PREPARED YOU FOR COLLEGE LIKE THEIR SUPPOSED TO BUT OVERALL IT COULD BE BETTER I WENT THERE FOR 4 YEARS AND i KIND OF REGRET IT BUT NOT MUCH AND SENIOR YEAR HAS BEEN A STRUGGLE I HOPE THAT IT'S WORTH IT", 'The change I would like to see is teachers actually preparing the high school students for college. Though it is a "college preparatory" school, the students are not prepared once in college.', 'The people in FDA make up the environment. The school should hire and recruit dedicated students and teachers. It needs a lot more organization with the help of funds. Students do not need to go worried about printing paper or needing extra desks. When the school is in order the students are in order. FDA just needs a stronger structure. All the teachers need to be in the same page. I only had a few teachers who challenged my academic and work ethics. I should be challenged every day in order to be prepared for college and the outside world.', "I only felt as though there were only about two teachers in the entire school who cared about how I did in school. There was even an English teacher who gave a zero as a test grade to every one in the class if someone's phone went off. Also this school treat students as if we are prisoners. There are police and securities stationed almost everywhere, when it's time to switch classrooms the securities and police will blow whistles at us, as if we were creating some kind of riot. This school is literally the definition of school to prison pipeline system.", 'I find Frederick Douglass Academy is a good school because it helped me educational wise because I used to be a slacker and now since they’ve actually showed me the right path on what my future could be like. I can definitely say that I’m proud to have gone to this school.', 'This is a bad school and you would not want to go there . It is falling down hill and the kids skip and teachers allow it because it is no authority in the school', 'I had a very unique experience and I had lots of fun! Great students and teachers and very competitive sports. Diversity in Acdemics and ethnicity.The Teachers really helped me get college ready. Learned many things and how to solve real life problems.', 'FDA has a good variety of ap classes you can take but the teaching skills of the teachers are poor and so is the culture of the school', 'This school has great opportunities but the school doesn’t enforce and make sure that all students reach and get to have access to these opportunities. Many kids slack off because they don’t feel anyone pushing them to do good or they just don’t care enough to do good. It’s a sad environment. It is very easy for a smart person to be persuaded to do bad. It’s so sad. I thought this school would prepare me for college but if it wasn’t for knowing seniors, I wouldn’t know what I need to do to be ready and I would have a hard time getting ready for college. The environment in the school isn’t getting worse and I don’t feel that safe in school.', "What I'd like to change about FDA is the behavior of underclassmen and the bathroom policies because they do not make sense.", "This school is quite big and its easy to get lost in the crowd. There aren't that many opportunities to bond with people.", 'I liked it was mostly black yet teachers are racist and kids aren’t being challenged or held accountable.', 'I started attending Frederick Douglass Academy the summer before my freshman year. It was an interesting 4 years. I feel like I learned a lot. The only changes I would like to see are seeing less students in the halls or "cutting class".', "There is nothing about FDA I actually like besides a few teachers. The environment makes me very uncomfortable because everywhere you go, there are students running the hallways cursing at each other and at students. The principle does not take charge and has not made any positive differences to the school ever since she became the new principle of FDA. Finally, the school's priorities are absolutely terrible. Minor dress code violations, such as wearing a sweater, can result in a student missing important notes in class or even and exam. I would love it if the school focused more on getting students to be ready for the real world, rather than watch us go into the real world blind."]

column2: ['I enjoyed getting to know the teachers who taught me lots of things, however I do wish their merit and demerit system was less strict.', 'In my 3 out of 4 years attending Achievement First Brooklyn High I have never felt so prepared for my future than now. Achievement First is a great school that pushes its students to do their best at all times. They have a very strong academic process that continues to push us scholars forward in the best way possible especially with college. Students are set up for success and with the very amazing support of an amazing support system from the school team. If I had to in my later years I would most definitely recommend this school to fellow peers. The diversity in the school along with the culture is remarkable there is a variety of students and clubs that makes anyone feel comfortable in all ways. The school is a great community and the students show a great amount of school spirit especially when it’s sports involved. Each sports and clubs is heavily supported and shown the upmost respect and love and support.', 'Achievement  First Brooklyn High does have a lot of teachers that care about the individual needs of the students. The teachers do offer office hours for the students to need it. One of the problems that the school has is that it does not properly prepare the students for college. Though Achievement First Brooklyn High tries to create a college classroom setting, but the school does not treat the student like adults. It still felt like there was still a lot of hand holding from the teachers. At times it felt like we were still in middle school while they were still trying to prepare us for college. It also felt like the school does not take into account of how the students feel about certain rules and sometimes we felt ignored.', 'Horrible school !!!!! Don’t send your child here !!!!!!!!!!!!!! They are very poor with resolving issues in the school and giving equal consequences', 'I wish they would worry more about the curriculum than the behavior issues that college professors don’t worry about.', 'Achievement First is a school that makes sure that you leave high school prepared for college however, there is multiple things that Achievement First has to change in order to be consider the "perfect school" . This contains putting students happiness as a priority, this will encourage kids to come to school and actually want to be in the school building.', "At Achievement First Brooklyn HS there isn't must diversity in regards to race because most if not all students are African American. However, there's people from other religions and all different backgrounds. Overall, the school teaches you what you need to be successful in college, however there is a bit too much hand holding.", "What I like about this school is that they've have such an extreme curriculum that challenges students in many ways . As for social life they are very diverse and open to having multiple clubs that are even run by students themselves."]

['Some of my teachers, exceeded my expectations and supported me throughout the school year. We have a reasonable amount of student resources such as Chromebooks and textbooks. But we seriously lack safety. Many of the students in my grade level are distracting and lack self-control. Simply said, they do not take school seriously. School is a playground to them. I would recommend investing in "mental health" awareness. This is a behavioral issue. To stop the aggression, drugs, fights, bullying, and unnecessary drama. My classmates, need someone to talk to. A behavioral therapist to be specific. Someone experienced, who will get them out of their bad habits, and promote healthy behaviors. This is the most efficient method, so that they actually UNDERSTAND what they did wrong and can change their fixed mindsets. Everyone can make a change, if you give them a push in the right direction. ~Sincerely, Central High School Senior', 'At Central High School, I was a part of the Magnet program. The Magnet program provided more rigerous courses compared to a regular high school. There were many AP and ECE classes that were avaible to me and I did take. To be able to have those oppertunties to get college credit was amazing. There was also a lot of help from staff members to help us plan for our futures and support us. The atmosphere was so positive and light. There was always something fun going on with the staff, principle or the events we have. There are many clubs and activites to part take in too. I did mostly community service and clean ups, but there are clubs that you talk about video games or religion. There is something there for everyone and everyone (including the students) are very friendly. My high school experience could not have been better with another school. Hilltoppers for life!', 'I liked the diversity of Central High, I just felt like people were stuck in their own friend groups and it could sometimes be really hard to find friends or new friends.', 'Some teachers really cared about their students, which was nice. There was no sense of bonding between the students. There were a lot of fights too.', 'I loved the community there was at Central High. I recently graduated and I can honestly say that it was hard to leave the school where I felt supported by guidance counselors, my principle, teachers, and classmates. I felt so safe in school and as if I had individuals I can go to if something was going on at home. It was easy to be heard as well. My class worked together to create new annual activities such as field day, march madness, etc. It was amazing how supportive, understanding, and helpful our principle and class advisors were and the importance that was given to our opinions and suggestions. One change I would like to see is the college career readiness classes having more focus on scholarship applications. I feel like the focus was else where. Therefore this means that I would like to see teachers listening to our opinions just as our principle and class advisors would.', 'Teachers care, they’re great. They try to be available to the student as much as they can. When I went they didn’t have much classes available other than the standard classes, but now they offer so much more.', 'Central was a eye opening experience that held me to high expectations which changed how I look at school. My work ethic stepped up and I feel more valued If I maintain high grades amongst peers. The classroom became more of a competition  so I had to work hard to come out on top.The teachers encourage students to take leaps and challenge comfort zones. Creating a student of high resilience. This lead to better time management and knowing how to balance life where priorities must be set in place outside of the classroom. In AP Environmental Science, the class made me see the Earth and industrialization as a serious game changer over the years. This grew a care for me of how waste affects the ground  water supply that we rely on. Sustainable living is the future, and the way the world works, I takes small change for a cleaner environment.', 'My experience of central was scared. Being a freshmen was exciting and scary to me because I’m movingly to a bigger level and don’t have to experience I did in the middle school, so it was something to get used to. Throughout the years of high school and being a senior I realize it’s more stressful and more responsibilities I have to take care of. High school make me think about the little girl I was before and how I didn’t have to worry much about things because I’m not in that higher level, but now that I understand and put so much work into my grades and work I know not to play around and procrastinate because that’s going to be my GPA. Central have been very helpful to me and my academics I made sure I had positive/good attitude, work very hard for my accomplishments, and work to achieve my goals because I know that’s  going to work my way up to graduate soon and get into the college I want to.', 'my butt smell right now because sat on a dog and the kids all smell like omg wth they are all thugs in this school i will sit on a dog like omg omg omg omg omg omg I SAT ON A DOG', 'I started Central as a Sophomore. I always attended private school so coming to Central I was scared and a little intimidated. The teachers are great and I wouldn’t change a thing.', "Something I like about Central high school is the diversity of the school. You will find people from all over the world and different culture. Something I would change about the school would be the clubs and activities the school has to offer. We have a lot of spots but we don't have a lot of clubs", 'As a former magnet student of Central High School, I can honestly say that the four years I have spent at Central were nothing less than amazing. The magnet program in Central is supportive, rigors and providing for the students. We have teachers that truly care about the students and even go as far as working overtime to make sure their students are more than ready for exams. The resources and support students will receive in the magnet program of Central are out of this world and the reason for such great support is all thanks to the dedicated academic staff that work tirelessly with the students to ensure their success.', 'What I like about Central High School is the comfort it brings in the classroom. I just came to this school, I was overwhelmed by its academic oasis and I knew it was the perfect place to continue my studies and get ready for college life.', 'I have been attending Central Highschool, enrolled in the magnet program for 4 years. Overall this institution truly cares about the well being of the students. Of course, no one school is perfect but Central is very close. I see great potential in the future of the school and the individuals that attend.  I am honored to say that i was able to attend this school and soon ill be able to say I have graduated from such a prestigious institution.', 'What I like about Central High School is that many of the teachers show a lot of effort and care into preparing us for college or just our future in general. The atmosphere in the school is overall a feeling of comfort, due to the great diversity of students it has.', "Before I came to Central High School, I've heard from people saying that Central High School is a horrible school with horrible administration. But once I came to the school in 9th grade, all the rumors that people have told me were false. Central isn't a bad school at all. Yes, there are ups and downs but every school has that. The teachers and staff at Central care about the students and their success. Now I'm a Senior there and everything is still fine there. I wouldn't say Central is a perfect high school because there's no such thing as a perfect high school. But I could say Central High School does want people to reach their goals in life and see them succeed.", "Central high school has a great magnet program but the regular school is poor. We don't get the same resources as magnet children. Teachers treat us with no respect and sometimes the don't even teach us. one day my teacher walked in and decided not to teach us. I took one magnet class my senior year and it was the best thing that ever happen to me the teacher was very involved in my education.", 'I honestly hatted being a student here, I felt like the building was always dirty, the girls bathroom always had a strong nasty smell and that there were too few teachers that actually cared about the well being and success of students. The security guards would get caught up in the teenage drama and at times instigate fights.', 'Central High School is a good school, the teachers are friendly and the classes are nice. Students are somewhat friendly. Administration sets discipline rules and carries them out', 'I started at Central my Freshman year and I love it. The environment is so nice and sweet. The teachers are always there for extra help.']

column6: ['The magnet program is well organized and there is a wide variety of subjects to choose from. Teachers are fun and easy to work with. A good amount of clubs and you can even make your own.', "My experience was overall average during my time at Central. A high point for me was the teachers, most of them anyway. They really took their time to make sure students got the material and gave extra help. Administration and security were always around the school to make us feel safe and secure, on top of that metal detectors helped calm nerves. There was a decent amount of variety in college-preparation classes, allowing us to be ready. However resources and supplies were where it was lacking. Text book and desk shortages, along with below-average meals in a lacking cafeteria. The whole campus itself just wasn't that nice to look at or be around, was never really that clean or decorative. Also never really had any pep rallies or anything school spirit like. It just seemed like a place you go to back and forth, not somewhere to get involved in.", 'I was a magnet student, and from my point of view they did their job as a school fairly well. The AP teachers are truly amazing, especially the science ones.', 'The people there are nice. Teachers know how to help kids through tough times while remaining stable teachers within class.', 'Central is an okay school, it’s not the best, but I’ve definitely seen worse. The education sucks, but the magnet program is one of the best in the area, so if you’re coming to central, go to central magnet.', 'Central High School was a very good urban public school. Central Magnet really tried its best to prepare us for college. We had great teachers that cared about our education as long as we were willing to put in the work also.', 'Central High School was actually my first school that I attended in America as because I came here to United States few years ago. It took me a little while to adjust with the climate of school as I was new to this educational system but I found the people and the staff of this school to be really welcoming and friendly. The best part about CHS have to be the diligent teachers, who put their foremost to educated us, the student. The diversity of school is something to be appreciated too, one can find student from any part of the world. The school have a great variety of clubs and sports activities. Each student is treasured here and given opportunity to prove themselves in any and all fields hat they are best at. The environment is all safe and sound. Our principal and all administration members are really amiable which I find really amusing and interesting. Ideal school one can encounter in this city. Forever grateful to this school for breeding the passion of studying in me.', 'Eh need more inspiration only because there is a lack of anyone really caring about education. we need people who want us to learn then want Us to just get a grade so they look good as a teacher', "High School has definitely been a stressful and interesting experience for me. I had some ups and downs but overall I'm just happy it's about to be over. I liked the time I was able to spend with my friends, the events that took place like Junior Ring Dance as well as the help I received from my guidance counselor. I would change the schedule of classes as well as the cleanliness of the school.", "I personally had a great time at Central. I got to participate in the magnet program and had the opportunity to take many honors, AP, and other college courses. There are a lot of clubs after school. I'm current debate captain, co-editor-in-chief of the school newspaper, and a member of the National Honors Society.  The student environment varies because there are so many different types of people there. I've made great friendships with a variety of different people from different cultures. and similar interests. I don't think I've ever had problems with the teachers here myself. Sure, some I liked more than others, but that is a normal part of an high school. A lot of the teachers were great anyways. The building could be prettier, but they are still working on construction so there is an effort being made.  Central is by no means perfect, but high school in many ways is what you make of it. I had fun and got a good education.", "I would like to see the neighborhood central and magnet central come together. I feel as though we are very divided and there are a lot of stereotypes put out there by both parties mostly because there's a disconnect between the two. If we came together more, there would be a lot less division and tension.", "I believe my school is a pretty great school. At the end of the day it's what you make of your high school experience. There are many teachers that truly look after their students and care about their well being and academics achievements. Besides, even the former President, Barack Obama visited our school.", "I just transferred to this school, and overall I've had a pretty good experinece. The school allows all students to be prepared for college. I would recommend and student to come to this school.", 'What I like the most about Central is the guidance counselors and sports programs. Kids are highly involved into the sports, throughout all seasons. The guidance counselors here are nice, caring, and they work hard to help you to progress in life.', 'I don’t like that there are not many Ap classes to take, the teachers are really bad. The only thing that I like is the diversity. The food is totally free and they give breakfast. There are not many  after clubs activities.', 'Ok ok ok ok ok ok confusing hopefully better now school changed hopefully build on still there’s ...................', 'It was more of a drama filled environment rather than a learning environment; however, there were a few teachers that would go out of their way to help students learn and be safe.', 'I like how Central High School has a lot of events that allows students to participate and connect with others as well as having fun while learning new things.', 'I like that it is a very diverse school that is preparing me for college. I am offered many opportunities to take AP classes and get college credit. There are security guards and every day you have to walk through a metal detector to enter the building making it a safe environment.', 'My highschool experience was fairly okay. In the defense of Central, I attended in the midst of renovation and I was facing some personal issues that could have impacted my experience. I am enrolled in the Magnet Program where we do have a more rigorous agenda however, I still feel like I took full advantage of the opportunities infront of me. I had a good experience with the guidance counselor and never felt abandoned. But certain administrative issues and particular encounters and lack of knowledge of somethings caused me to feel such a way about the school.']
column8: ['The magnet program is well organized and there is a wide variety of subjects to choose from. Teachers are fun and easy to work with. A good amount of clubs and you can even make your own.', "My experience was overall average during my time at Central. A high point for me was the teachers, most of them anyway. They really took their time to make sure students got the material and gave extra help. column2: ['It may not be in the best area but one thing I can say. Wyandanch Staff is dedicated to ensuring the success of every single student.', 'Loved the diversity, would love to see more of a focus on getting better food for the kids. Something also to have more emphasis on college preparation and getting students mentally ready for what they are about to go through in their first semester. Not even the whole first year, mainly the first semester', 'Every group from the popular kids and nerds are all split up in the halls', 'I like what the teachers are doing and they give me alot of knowledge', 'Its not the best but its ok', 'They are very helpful and can help you for future colleges and to put on your resume', 'This school is very unique because we have a lot of talent athletic wise and academic wise, but we just dont put our minds to it, and thats all we ave to work on. but the overall experince was very useful and helpful for future schooling i may do', 'The knowledge of the teachers overall is very adequate, but their teaching styles could be helped.', 'Extracurricular activities are very limited as a result of the lack in funding. Whatever activities are available, are obviously financially limited. Arts and Academic programs are severely limited.', 'Although I may have had amazing teachers, the lack of funding at this school severely limited my experiences. Even some of the most popular extracurricular activities like sports lack the funding to give the athletes the best experiences they could hope for. This lack of funding also negatively impacted the Arts. Music and Dramatic Arts are almost nonexistent in this school and even if concerts or plays are scheduled, the lack of quality can be noted. As someone is very passionate towards the Arts, this greatly wounds me since success in school should not be only judged by academic standings.', 'I have never seen teachers care so much for the well being of their students until I went to high school. Although funding at this school limits the possibilities to explore different teaching methods, I can confidently say that these teachers are some of  the best that I have ever seen. They make the best of what they are given and not only make learning fun, but also engaging and easy to understand.', "It's Horrible. They seriously need more food choices. Some people at the school are very picky. Most days they only offer two different things to choose from and they hardly ever have sandwiches. Some days, they only have one choice and no sandwiches. What about people who don't eat the food they are serving that day? Then, they have some days when the food in dispicable and inedible. Sometimes, I wonder if they actually taste the food before they give it to us. The Kitchen staff is nice though", "The academics at Wyandach are average. The teachers are great, but it takes an extreme amount of work to get most of the students here to actually listen and pay attention in class. They are honestly not very good at making schedules because it takes a great amount of time to reach from one of my classes to the other and then I'm the one that gets blamed.", 'I personally am ok with the extracurricular opportunities that are available at Wyandanch, but a few may beg to defer. Wyandanch has a chess club, a soccer team, a basketball team, extra help after school, SAT prep, a drama club, a football team, etc. i would like to have a badmington team but because of school buddget, my wish cannot be achieved. being apart of a team expecially at Wyndanch is an expecially great experience. You will absolutely love it.', 'Most of the teachers at Wyandanch are really caring. The Principal is very down to Earth but very strict when he is upset. The Principal is always around and checks class performance every now and again. We all feel very comfortable around the current Principal. he is very easy to talk to about any issues family or school related, that a student or teacher may have. If you have a problem, he will deal with it personally. He is very strick against bullying- he doesnt tolerste it at all!', 'On the sports teams at Wyandanch, everybody gets along. We are always cheering for our school at home games. Some students even travel to away games. The basketball team is  the most famous of the sports teams in the High school but the football team is highly rated.', 'The safety and health policies are very good, Wyandanch help us be safe and health by protecting us and making sure we get checked out.', 'The school administration is good, and the school wide policies help us.', 'The teachers encourage us to tutor eachother and tutor us. They do there best.', 'Social scene is cool and calm, no one really bothers anybody.']

column1: Waldeigh Secondary School For The Performing & Visual Arts
column2: ['Wadleigh Secondary School is a great performing arts school, where there is a healthy balance between the arts and academics. *', 'My experience at this school is very good. The vocal program can improve in many ways by getting more challenging and preparing every student for college auditions. We have concerts and musicals throughout the year. We sing a variety of music but I think we should work more on classical music and arias. The vocal chorus should improve to be 4 years of classical music and music theory. The music theory classes are good. I would like the school to teach the kids from freshman year music theory and piano. Other than that the school is pretty good!', 'It’s a good performing arts school. However it lacks College Readiness. This means that students aren’t provided with SAT Prep or breakdown with college cost. Also students aren’t informed about a lot of scholarships until last minute.', 'My experience at wadleigh was one of the best experiences in my life. After 4 years of studying there, I can truly say that I have gained a great education for caring teacher and relationships that will last for a lifetime! Also may opportunities that I never thought i’d have came from that school. That is what I like most about my school. Although I had a great time there, I would love to see more activities and clubs in the school.', 'Wadleigh is a small High School who has fought through many critics and has maintained very prideful no matter the situation. I have learned many things through out my years in this school.', 'I am the class of 2017 and it was a pleasure to be aprt of this school. I was apart of the dance department where i learned a different variety of dance peices however it had its up and downs but the school always was made a way for the students and I to makea l ways for us to have great programs.', 'Their willingness to assist whenever they can is phenomenal. Making sure you are living up to your full potential is their mission.', "I've been at my school for a while. Ive truly seen the changes occur over the years. They now have more AP classes like English, History, Spanish and Pre-Calc. They also offer chemistry in my school. I feel that I get many opportunities in my school and I appreciate that the staff tries their hardest to make it all happen. This is a no judgement zone as well. So many of the students are talented,and we even have shows coming up for you to see! With a new principal, there are some minor changes but not in a bad way. If you truly want to experience what Wadleigh is like, I recommend for you to see the Arts. We are partners with Carnegie Hall, the Apollo, Cooper Union, F.I.T, C.F.E.S and so much more! Truly a great experience here. ", "While attending Wadleigh for my four years of high school, I felt like I was home. I didn't feel as if I was an outsider when It came down to interacting with the students and even the staff as well. With the kind of back ground that I have, the staff had nothing but open arms for me, when I needed something they were always willing to go that extra step for me both in a academic sense and personal one as well.  Many people tend to feel that's its okay to judge this school base off of what others have to say and never really taking the time to come and check the school out.  Even though wadleigh seems to be such a small school, there connects run really deep.", 'There are still a lot of things to do after school. The performing arts and visual arts is one of them. You can join the clubs that involve the arts or actually take the class for credits. Then theres the sports teams. The sports team are one of the best in the area and it brings everyone together. The most popular stuff to do is vocal music. Since vocal music is the most well known because Carnegie Hall sponsors them, it makes it one of the things that lets us go outside of school into the real world of music, which is very cool.', 'I had a great time. I got to participate in many events involving music, dance, theater and, sports. The school is unique because of the weird mix of activities. Its a performing arts school mostly known for its vocal music and sports; which is an odd mix. I would do it all over again and get more involved in sports rather then just certain events.', 'The teachers at this school really adore their students. They try their hardest to really understand the students and adjust the lessons so that everyone can be active and learn as much as possible. They are very knowledgable and communicate with the students and staff in a respectable yet friendly manner. All grades are posted online, sent through email and also through progress reports.', 'The teachers at Wadleigh Secondary school care for their students and do everything they canvto make sure our grades remain high', 'My school is very good. They encourage you to do better and have extra help outside of class.', 'They go above & beyond for their students . They are very hardworking.', "There Isn't many extracurricular activities at this school", "They didn't have much freedom when it came to curriculum and teaching style", 'The environment was to die for! Everyone accepted you the way you are.', 'The teaching staff was ok, there were some staff that touched my heart <3 but most of the staff had a very snarky attitude which brought me down :( :( :( but im okay now im in college :) :) :) .', "Sometimes the security doesn't pay attention or doesn't notice things."]

column6: ["The extracurricular activities are fun but the teachers don't have enough to do them.", 'The parents come and show support whenever they can.', 'The teachers are always there when you meed them and are always pushing us to succeed.', "there's different clubs and after school programs to help you with any homework or regents you need.", 'parents and also teachers are really well commited not only with there kids but with others they will help with anything possible they can.', 'This school is not only a big family that makes you feel like your home but we all help each other build the school more and more each time we progress with each other we all work hard we are talented students in different aspects.', 'The overall quality of teachers is great because the amount of knowledge they have to share is immense. They express an interest in students that is greater than most teachers. As for communication skills, teachers in Wadleigh secondary school try their best to communicate with their students regarding anything that may be beneficial in helping them such as regents prep classes, recommendation letters, SAT prep etc.', "The Policies aren't very strict but they aren't to be taken lightly and most students try their best to abide by them.", "We don't really have any other team aside from the basketball, track and volley ball team and i'm not part of any of those athletic teams but i do visit the weight room which is perfect if you want to work on your muscles.", "There are a lot of different types of extracurriculars, they're very well rounded and they appeal to a lot of many different types of students within the school.", 'Wadleigh Secondary School we have the most phenomenal teachers. Our educators can not compare to others in school that are deemed "beyond excellent". Our educators sacrifice  their after school time and their weekends to offer tutoring to those who seek it.They make sure that we are delivered the same or better education than those students enrolled in private school, and they don\'t stop there. I have had educators offer to pay my college application fees when I don\'t have the expenses to do so myself. They care for the students as if they were their own and honestly leave a legacy that students carry with them beyond high school.', "The guidance counselors are always helpful in this school, they are on your back when you need to get something done and they are there to talk to you if you need any advice or help. My school is a uniform school sometimes they're very strict on not wearing black and white abd sometines they aren't as strict so you'll see some kids out of uniform. I haven't really seen bullying occur much in this school which is a good thing.", "When it comes to basketball this school is really good at getting involved. Alot of students like joining the team every year and alot of students watch the games. One thing I know for sure is the students who play basketball are really dedicated in what they do and through basketball they are starting to do better in school just to stay on the team. We recently had the basketball coach pass away so lots of them are trying to win as much games as possible and pass all their classes and regents and graduate just for him, he was a very great man and didn't give up on them when others did. The school is also really good at coming together and making something happen and every school activity going on such as spirit week or pep rally the major of the school participates and makes it memorable.", "One thing I do love about this school is the arts program. We are a school in harlem unlike different performing arts schools, some people try to shut us down but we just won't go down without a fight and because we won't go down we get to keep our arts departments. Compared to other performing arts school we are better or just as good. My favorite experience in this school is all the shows I have done. Before I came here I was super shy and now I'm not and it's because of each and every show I have done they are great. My least favorite thing is some of the students, I wish most students took their education serious but other than that if I had to choose to come to this school again If I had to do it all over I will. It helped me gain confidence and lots of other things.", "The school doesn't really have food options. The majority of the lunch everyday is pizza and I hate it and if it's not pizza it's grilled cheese or chicken or pb&j or something unknown. I'm very picky so I don't eat school lunch I really don't like it. One thing they do have is a salad I mean I don't eat it but it's healthy. One thing I like is that they sell things like chips, cupcakes but I don't have money to buy that everyday plus too much of it isn't good. So overall to me the lunch food is bad but some people may think otherwise.", 'We have alot of extra activities that you can join. There is basketball ball for boys and girls and the coaches are really nice. There is volleyball and track and different things just for the kids to have fun. Spirit squad is a most. We always have fun.', "The teachers are very good at what they do and the subjects they teach. They out in their all to make students learn and succeed. They will not be satisfied if they feel like the kids weren't taught enough so they will make time after school to complete their lessons.", "The school safety are best at what they do. They are always there on time when something happens between students. They're always there to stop a fight when it happens.", "There was this one teacher named Ms.Frunza who would lock the students in her classroom until she finished with her lessons. She didn't care about if the kids were in a rush to get out of class. She was one of the best teachers because she mad very one of her students pass their algebra regents.", "When ever there's a school basketball the student goes out to support. We usually make posters with the basketball team name on it and we wave them in the air so the team knows there's people out there supporting them, also their family members and outsiders come to support."]
column8: ["The extracurricular activities are fun but the teachers don't have enough to do them.", 'The parents come and show support whenever they can.', 'The teachers are always there when you meed them and are always pushing us to succeed.', "there's different clubs and after school programs to help you with any homework or regents you need.", 'parents and also teachers are really well commited not only with there kids but with others they will help with anything possible they can.', 'This school is not only a big family that makes you feel like your home but we all help each other build the school more and more each time we progress with each other we all work hard we are talented students in different aspects.', 'The overall quality of teachers is great because the amount of knowledge they have to share is immense. They express an interest in students that is greater than most teachers. As for communication skills, teachers in Wadleigh secondary school try their best to communicate with their students regarding anything that may be beneficial in helping them such as regents prep classes, recommendation letters, SAT prep etc.', "The Policies aren't very strict but they aren't to be taken lightly and most students try their best to abide by them.", "We don't really have any other team aside from the basketball, track and volley ball team and i'm not part of any of those athletic teams but i do visit the weight room which is perfect if you want to work on your muscles.", "There are a lot of different types of extracurriculars, they're very well rounded and they appeal to a lot of many different types of students within the school.", 'Wadleigh Secondary School we have the most phenomenal teachers. Our educators can not compare to others in school that are deemed "beyond excellent". Our educators sacrifice  their after school time and their weekends to offer tutoring to those who seek it.They make sure that we are delivered the same or better education than those students enrolled in private school, and they don\'t stop there. I have had educators offer to pay my college application fees when I don\'t have the expenses to do so myself. They care for the students as if they were their own and honestly leave a legacy that students carry with them beyond high school.', "The guidance counselors are always helpful in this school, they are on your back when you need to get something done and they are there to talk to you if you need any advice or help. My school is a uniform school sometimes they're very strict on not wearing black and white abd sometines they aren't as strict so you'll see some kids out of uniform. I haven't really seen bullying occur much in this school which is a good thing.", "When it comes to basketball this school is really good at getting involved. Alot of students like joining the team every year and alot of students watch the games. One thing I know for sure is the students who play basketball are really dedicated in what they do and through basketball they are starting to do better in school just to stay on the team. Compared to other performing arts school we are better or just as good. My favorite experience in this school is all the shows I have done. Before I came here I was super shy and now I'm not and it's because of each and every show I have done they are great. My least favorite thing is some of the students, I wish most students took their education serious but other than that if I had to choose to come to this school again If I had to do it all over I will. It helped me gain confidence and lots of other things.", "The school doesn't really have food options. The majority of the lunch everyday is pizza and I hate it and if it's not pizza it's grilled cheese or chicken or pb&j or something unknown. I'm very picky so I don't eat school lunch I really don't like it. One thing they do have is a salad I mean I don't eat it but it's healthy. One thing I like is that they sell things like chips, cupcakes but I don't have money to buy that everyday plus too much of it isn't good. So overall to me the lunch food is bad but some people may think otherwise.", 'We have alot of extra activities that you can join. There is basketball ball for boys and girls and the coaches are really nice. There is volleyball and track and different things just for the kids to have fun. Spirit squad is a most. We always have fun.', "The teachers are very good at what they do and the subjects they teach. They out in their all to make students learn and succeed. They will not be satisfied if they feel like the kids weren't taught enough so they will make time after school to complete their lessons.", "The school safety are best at what they do. They are always there on time when something happens between students. They're always there to stop a fight when it happens.", "There was this one teacher named Ms.Frunza who would lock the students in her classroom until she finished with her lessons. She didn't care about if the kids were in a rush to get out of class. She was one of the best teachers because she mad very one of her students pass their algebra regents.", "When ever there's a school basketball the student goes out to support. We usually make posters with the basketball team name on it and we wave them in the air so the team knows there's people out there supporting them, also their family members and outsiders come to support."]

column1: High School for Youth & Community Development
column2: ['i like the fact that in ycd everybody is equal. You get same attention from everybody even if you are a student of color. one thing i would like to change about ycd is they should have lockers in the hallways.', 'I know everyone has their own opinions. However, I’ve been a student for 3 years and I can tell I had a great time.', 'My overall experience at YCD is good the school is driven to see their students succeed. During your time there administrators oftenly offer trips to various colleges and universities to allow for experience to be gained talking to colleges and getting you ready. The school grows year after year and more programs are being included.', 'I want to use the courtyard more often especially since it is springtime. There should be more available and outside lunches too with benches and the likes', "I transferred to YCD junior year. This was one of the most important decisions I've ever made. I received top notch education from the finest teachers in New York City which led me to have a 3.3 GPA and a 1030 on my SATs. Also, I earned a scholarship to Western Connecticut State University. I was also a stand out athlete on the football team. We lost in the championship by 1 point. The students at YCD are so welcoming to incoming freshmen and we all love each other like a family. That's what separates YCD from other schools. We are a family.", 'When I first got into the school I was lost because of the size but everyone was so nice to me that I always found my way. The administration is really friendly, the teachers motivate their students and each and everyone got each others back. I just love YCD.', "This school is the best school you can attend in brooklyn. Go on trips for free and have honor roll ceremony at the end of every marking period. The administration really cares about their students. they do not play with their culture and have respect for it. Security is very tight in school and also we have healthy food and clean water. There's a college coach to help both juniors and seniors with their applications, scholarships and also financial aid process. School nurse is provided. If you need any financial help, you can go to the office or tell your teachers.", 'In the years I have spent here I would have to say its been an overall great experience. The staff tends to every student and their individual needs. New programs and opportunity are always on the rise. Some things I would like to see change is the lack of diversity. Brining students from all walks of the ponds better prepare the students for whats to come. Also  giving the students more areas where constructive work can be done, but overall a great experience I will not forget.', 'My experience in this school has been interesting in terms of the diverse personalities I encounter daily, the motivational staff, and the family like atmosphere of the school. What I like about this school is that the staff and administration are always pushing you to do your best because they want you to maximize your full potential. The one thing I would change about this school is the amount of science classes offered because some colleges require certain scores in high school science classes so that you can be selected for a science program in college. If that class is not available, then I will not have a fair chance of getting into the program I wanted.', 'I entered YCD as a junior. I was a transfer student from Pakistan. But my guidance counselors and principal made it possible for me to graduate on a right time. They worked hard so do I to make it possible.The thing I liked the most about my school is the staff and the way they help every student. Including the principal, the whole staff helps a student on personal basis too as well as on academic basis.The change I would like to see in the school would be mixing of more students like students from every race and every part of the world. This would help new comers to get familiar to the environment easily and on a way faster way.', 'I had an ok experience its better then I thought it would be. However that school needs to pay more attention to the kids and worry about their education more. Other than the lack of attention the school is a good school ', "The activities the school offers isn't the best and they aren't really interesting but they it keeps some students occupied", "I didn't enjoy my experience at this school at all.I worked really hard my senior year so I can graduate ready for a new better experience in College", 'The teachers try to help students who want help and want to better their grades,ignorance usually destroys everything else.', 'My experience with Y.C.D has been pretty enjoyable over the past 3 years,teachers become more and more effective with the way they teach each year.The greatest thing about this school is that change is always occurring, e.g. teacher are now beginning to teach online with the use of google classroom', 'Coming from Brooklyn,Ny Daytona beach is a different atmosphere for me; the view, air, buildings,etc. Bethune-Cookman has an excellent Nursing program. For the year 2015, BCU was ranked the Third best HBCU; not only that their nursing program has received a lot of recognition', "In my opinion the school is not that bad,my experience is pretty good i learn a lot from the time i was a freshman and now.This school helped me overcome my fear like not to be afraid what the people say and participate in some activities that helped me learn the importance of a community.I wouldn't do it again because sometimes the teachers don't teach they suppose to and i don't like that and also there too much young men in the school.", 'We have a lot of extra curriculum activities in our school:\r leadership\r culture club\r book club\r All of this clubs help us make our community better,it shows us the important of a community.', "In the current school that i am attending  the food is very horrible,it's bad quality and it don't taste good at all.For example when they serve you pizza it tastes like it's been there for a weak its really horrible.Also they change the food menu from time to time but it's still bad.", 'In my current school that i am attending the school rules is very strict as soon as you break a rule you suffer the consequences.As soon as something like that happens they call your parents or whoever is responsible for you to come pick you up. For example is a students gets in a physical altercation they take you in the office and the principal comes and talk to you,then they take you to the parents coordinator to call your parent after that they take you to the deans office and the dean talks to your parents and gives you and outside suspension for a couples of days.This is what happens when you beak a rule in our school.The school administration is pretty good.']

For example is a students gets in a physical altercation they take you in the office and the principal comes and talk to you,then they take you to the parents coordinator to call your parent after that they take you to the deans office and the dean talks to your parents and gives you and outside suspension for a couples of days.This is what happens when you beak a rule in our school.The school administration is pretty good.']
column6: ['In the current school that i am attending we have a lot of athletic oppurtunites is pretty good because students in my school have plenty of time to do athletic stuff because they have all different kinds of activities after school to do athletic stuff.For example the football team any student in the school can join in,once they join they will  go to practice everyday of the weak and work with the team together and when they have a game they all work together so they can win,its basically a team effort they are like brothers they support each other.', 'The teachers in my school are good at teaching but they can do better.', 'Safety is not an issue', 'The scool is very diverse', 'Everything is good but just need to get lockers', 'I personally do not eat the school lunch.', 'All activities are very welcoming and they help students come out of their shell', 'The sports at my school are know all over Brooklyn we are top five in the city. It is very competitive and much fun.', 'My schools administration is very helpful and safe they make kids feel protected even if they seem to be defiant. They tolerate No violence what so ever any attempt can get you a five day suspension.', 'There is no bullying in my school', 'The acceptance of students is great', 'Our school curriculum is taught by great teachers', 'The basketball club at my school is great', 'Our school football team won the Championship', 'School is great. Sometimes one can be bother because of her background  and sometimes peer pressure can be very difficult to ignore. otherwise we accept each other and learn each other back ground and learned  to love and appreciate where one came from and stop with the stereotypical jokes  that can be  very offensive at times.', "I Do not eat the food at my school i don't really know much about it but the other kids usually like it. Its serve in time and there's always some snack if you might get hungry while  you in school beside launch.", "We have some really good teachers. Most of them are like friends to us. However I feel like the things that they teach isn't the same quality as the advanced high school.", 'My school is okay. Everyone is nice but its boring', 'We have resources, but I feel like everything needs updating.', 'There was plenty of information about college and i felt pretty prepared for college.']

column2: ['What I like about International Community High School is that this school prepare you for the real world by providing a variety of resources such as Computer websites that equip you to design your own game, website, music. Teachers teach you each subject in a way that makes you understand and remember what you learn easily by connecting each example with the real world, (examples are practical). I would like it to have more sports or extracurrecular activities so students can have more choices and options to choose from.', "I love international community high school because it is basically a type of school that would help you succeed in life. Not only is it beneficial for ur future not also you receive a lot help from the teachers especially if English isn't ur first lauguage.", 'What I like about International Community High School or ICHS. Is the support which the staff members give to each student inters of : language, education, advice.', 'International Community High School is a community like no other. You will find lovely teachers who would do whatever it takes to help you. Students love the school so much that they need to be kicked out sometimes because the school is in its closing hours which is usually 6 when the student needs more help it could be 7 depends on the teachers. I graduated from here and I am currently working here that is how much I love the school.', 'My experience in this school is I was able to be proficient in new language just in 3 years. So, I will recommend this school for someone that  come from different country.', 'Is a nice school. The teacher are the best teacher ever had. They help us a lot. I had a change to meet many student from around the world. Something that I want them to improve is that, we need more sport in this school', "Something that I like about this school is that the teachers don't treat you with different, teach the students very well, the safety school is very united. There are a lots of cultures from different countries and I love it.", 'The safety at this school is great. They are always active and checking for the safety of every single indivual in the school. And they are always checking the security camera to be more aware of what is going on.', 'This school is an excelent school especially for international students. Teachers are always encouraging the students to speak english and participate in after school activities. The after school activities are great and fun because students have the chances to learn more about their teacher. Practice more english and also get the chance to meet more friends.', 'I think the teacher and the possitive impact that they have in the students is what makes this school unique. As an immigrant students without knowing how to write and speak English the teacher motivate me to be myself and speak English without judging my accent.', 'The professors at "ICHS" are friendly and very helpful with their students. They always spend time with the students and even have after school class for those who want help to better understand the classes.', 'Just the best! Words cant describe.', 'ICHS professors helped me to learn a whole new language. They helped to get along with people from other countries. Their teaching style is unique, they want all student to know the subject being told. And are available to help you after school. They help you to built a professional communication, so when you go out there in the world you know how to act, and respond to situations.', 'The overall experience was fantastic because I get to learn and enhance the knowledge I need to more forward in the real world .', 'The teachers are very helpful with those immigrant student who have experiencing difficulty in english.', 'There a few extracurriculars programs at this school and most of the student take avantaged of those programs', 'Teachers love helping stundents to their life', 'After school Programs make the school unique because we are able to stay and learn and get the help of others', 'The food are good but sometimes', "It's not good but because the government or the state doesn't give enough resources to us so we can play and have sports"]

column1: Pablo Neruda Academy for Architecture & World Studies
column2: ['Something I really enjoy about the school was that teachers really care about the students future. They would make sure that students are going to college. Something I’ll like to see change is the violence. Have everyone be more united.', 'i would like better food but that an overall campus issue but the school is very good and you can start to earn college credits as soon as your a 10th grader', "I joined the school as a junior. Honestly it was great experience in that School. I had max help from all my teachers speacially my principal.  My principal and the assiantan principal they helped me understand what's college, how to pay, where to go and everything. We kids think they not helpful. It's wrong, it's all about us to have responsibility and go ask them. We ask they will never fail to help us and I'm talking with great experience. My US history teacher was the best, he didn't just help me with the subject, he helped me solve all my issues. My school helped me with a summer job too, they helped me apply to college, financial aid and Everything. It's tough to Graduate within just 2 years of school but i did with the help of my school staff. Kids in school were really Chill and helpful. There weren't much violence. Over all I really like my high school and I really miss them now.", 'Overall, it was a great school for what it was. I attended through a separate program at P12x and graduated at the top of my class in 2014. The education and college readiness was average but the teachers were unforgettable.', 'What I specifically like about pablo neruda academy is the fact the teachers treat you like your there own , they look at you like family they care for you like family , you can push them away but they will go the extra mile to care for you , help you and take care of you .', 'The health and safety in are school its okay. They prevent students to bring in dangerous weapons but many kids find there way to bringing it in school.', "In PNA there's different types of clubs, and if you don't seem to like any you can always make a club on your own with permission. The clubs in PNA are very active like youth court and basketball.", 'The teachers at my school are caring, helpful, knowledgeable and very understanding.', 'It\'s a good school but should add more "real life experience" classes like drivers Ed, personal finance & etc.', "I made a lot of great friends during my high school career here. I also encountered many dedicated teachers that I do not think I would've met anywhere else. I feel the same way about my very close friends that I stay in contact with to this day.", 'The school had very limited options, the amount per student was very limited, and the quality was bad. The time to eat was about average, but it was a lengthy line to access the food.', 'The admins were somewhat engaged with students.', 'Students were supportive of the school teams, but not supportive of the school community as a whole!', "Many of the teachers that taught me while I was a student at Pablo Neruda Academy were available for me to speak with after class and even after school. This helped me develop a strong relationship with several teachers that lasted through out my entire High School career. These teachers and others, I noticed, were always more engaged with their students than the job required. I can testify to this as they helped me through several hardships that I experienced while attending PNA. The advice received kept my younger self awake and alert. Without the dedication from these teachers my high school experience would've been a much darker and difficult one. Sadly, the same cannot be said for the administration.", 'I am giving the programs an "okay" rating ONLY because of the extreme dedication of some teachers, coaches and other staff members to student improvement. Many of the teachers that I encountered were willing to invest more time into the programs, all in the name of the students. Improving student teacher relationships and the quality of education available to the students that were willing to invest themselves. The quality was never very high to begin with!', 'I felt that soon after graduation I lacked a compass. In the sense that even though I knew what career I wanted to pursue, I did not know what steps to take. Even though my High School had a system in place for preparing students for the "college life" it wasn\'t thorough or effective. I say this because few students took the recommended steps and chose not to apply themselves. Even after going through the steps, I felt as if nothing good came from it! \r I believe that many more things can be done to prepare students and parents alike for college planning!', 'Most of the teachers in my school are friendly and they help you with anything you need or struggle with. Also they encourage the students to be the best and they prepare you for your life in college and outside of school.', 'Theres a lot of clubs and activity in my school that is helpful for each of the students in pablo neruda. I think that it is well organize and it encourage people to be active and participate in a lot of things', 'The academics are pretty good. Our teachers challenge us.', 'I think my school is okay, but it could be better. Our teachers are amazing, they go above and beyond for us. The school itself, with its activities and programs need work.']
column4: ['Something I really enjoy about the school was that teachers really care about the students future. They would make sure that students are going to college. Something I’ll like to see change is the violence. Have everyone be more united.', 'i would like better food but that an overall campus issue but the school is very good and you can start to earn college credits as soon as your a 10th grader', "I joined the school as a junior. Honestly it was great experience in that School. I had max help from all my teachers speacially my principal.  My principal and the assiantan principal they helped me understand what's college, how to pay, where to go and everything. We kids think they not helpful. It's wrong, it's all about us to have responsibility and go ask them. We ask they will never fail to help us and I'm talking with great experience. My US history teacher was the best, he didn't just help me with the subject, he helped me solve all my issues. My school helped me with a summer job too, they helped me apply to college, financial aid and Everything. It's tough to Graduate within just 2 years of school but i did with the help of my school staff. Kids in school were really Chill and helpful. There weren't much violence. Over all I really like my high school and I really miss them now.", 'Overall, it was a great school for what it was.
