column6: ['When I attended, they was practically no choices of extracurricular besides sports and one or two clubs.', "Teachers are very knowledgeable and will help students to know the topic to succeed. Some may not have that view or may only see a paycheck. Overall the teachers seems well acquainted with students after they weren't teaching them anymore.", 'Sometimes students will bully other students for certain aspects such as clothing or personality. Overall it may not affect many students but many do get along with each other.', "Campus wide sports events aren't really advertised and since the campus isn't located in the safest neighborhood, it can be a contributing factor to why many do not attend.", 'Many students tend not to move away, which isn\'t a bad thing, but it is the norm. Many settle to attend colleges which didn\'t take long to apply. As a current college student, I have been able to find success as I moved away and been able to make a move in my career as well as become a leader in my community. The issue with that is PNA wasn\'t the motivator to make me do that. If students don\'t have motivation to success outside of school, then I feel PNA needs to find a method to make sure that their vision can be more then just making sure they "graduate".', "My time at PNA can be considered good, but wish there was more to offer. Since there were many students who seemed unmotivated and only cared for the bare minimum, it can be a setback for even the most academically successful. There wasn't a big variety of clubs to choose from. I feel overtime the school will improve as long as it continues to hold a steady balance for students in preparation for post secondary education and life.", 'Not much variety, some students may not bother eating as it always seems bland. Some will just always try to get pizza as it seems like the most appealing option.', 'Staff care about students, but students may not be well acquainted in trying to succeed in subjects. Some teachers will only focus on students who want to learn, which can be both good and bad.', 'The school offers a low amount of resources students can take advantage of. The best result would be for students to take initiative to create their own clubs or find ways outside of school to get these resources.', 'No variety, but some classes do become interesting such as Architecture, Entrepreneurship and Urban Studies.', "If people wear wrong clothes to school they will be sent home or to the counselor to get clothes from her to wear . most students won't wear it but teachers tell them to.put it on", 'The teach knows that they are doing , I think they just move to fast and need to wait to see if all students get it.before moving on.', 'Some.people will join the clubs . and some will just leave home cause they been in school all day', 'There are guards in every corner . and students will have to get Checked up before coming inside the school. They take this very serious', 'What makes the school unique is the people . the people in the school with help one other. Teacher will courage students to go to class', 'Everyone joins in the club that is in the school. From music clud , yoga , dance , video games, movie club , art club , and so one .', 'The counselors are always busy but they do try their best to meet with students to talk about their grades.', 'The teams are okay . I suggested they get a little more help .', 'There are a lot of extracurricular opportunities at this school. They have many clubs that meet students interests.', 'The guidance counselor reaches out to the seniors equally. College prep classes are available for us to take for early college credit. The school building is very secure.']
column8: ['The school spirit in the school is very open, many students are involved in our schools spirit week. Our school gives weight room classes that students are able to take. I would say that the school sports teams are very interactive, committed, and athletic.', "My overall experience at my school is very different. I've enjoyed my time at this school and I wouldn't change anything from the school. What makes the school unique is the  AP classes, our clubs like Youth Court and our school spirit. If I could do it again I would because I learned so much here.", "Students are very involved in the school, whether its after school activities or involved with helping teachers. I would say their isn't any peer pressure in the school. The acceptance of students is very open, we have an LGBT in our school and many students support it.", "The majority of the teachers don't give work to students that they know can't handle it. They never leave students unattended, and are always willing to answer any of their questions.", 'My school offers help to whoever needs it. The teachers work around the students schedule to help them the best way they can. My school has prep classes for those who need regents help. The scheduling process is very considerate, my guidance counselor takes care of the seniors schedules and makes sure we have the classes we actually need.', 'They have pretty good clubs and sports. They have a variety of different clubs such as movie club, video game club, soccer club, etc.\r', 'This school has "okay" food. The food is not the worst but not the best either, sometimes i do not like what they serve so i just get pizza. Most of the time i eat it because i am hungry.', 'This school has good academics. They have a variety of classesthat you can take, they also have three A.P classes all of which i am curently taking right now.', 'The teachers here for the most part are good teachers who care about their students. When ever i need extra help i can always ask one of my teachers and they will stay after school or during lunch.', 'This school is a part of a campus called Adlai E. Stevenson campus. We have school sport teams with other schools who are at this campus, we have a variety of varsity teams, they are great and make you work harder. I was a part of the soccer team for my junior year.', 'Administration is great, they make you feel like you belong there. They help you when they can and they give you great advice.', 'This school is small, sometimes you have a good expirence. Other times you may have a bad expirence at this school. It is not the teachers but the students.', 'Most students are accepting. Some are very intolerant and do not experience the diversity of sexual orientations. Depending on the cohort they can be moderate to low student involvement. There are few clubs that are offered and focus one specific fields.', 'There are many clubs are this school. Yoga club, music club, student government, youth court, and book club. ', 'The food is unhealthy and distasteful. There are few snacks, and the snacks that are available are chips and cookies.', 'There are only a handful of teachers that truly care about the students. ', "The school is in consistent with it's punishment and enforcing policy. ", 'The weight room is tiny. The gym is in bad condition. The football field acts as a soccer field, softball and baseball field, as well as football and track. ', "The school has many clubs and sports to join. The school is unique because it is small so we are all like a big family. I would choose this school again because the teachers we're welcoming and very helpful. They helped you outside of the classroom. ", "They used to give you a decent amount of food. Most of the food is good, but there's somethings I just wouldb't eat. They offer alternatives, they also have vending machines all over, and machines to get water, seltzer water, and flavored water. Since the school budget cuts sometimes you want seconds and thirds, but the only way you can get that is if somebody doesn't want their lunch."]

column2: ["I came to the US three years ago, and it was the high school that my actual counselour recommended me, so me and my brother joined it in 2017. I personally think it is a good high school, but most of the people from other places think it isn't just because the bad reputation from so many years ago. For me I feel safe at school, we have a lot of friendly securities that protect us, then we have cameras that cover the whole school and we have drills just in case something happen one day like fire or an active shooter in the school. The only thing I would change could be the food that we recieve in our lunch because it is not that healthy and we have a lot of athletes that need those healthy products, then the AC in some of our classes it is not that good and last I would change the materials that the teachers give in the school because sometimes we don't learn that much. The diversity in the school is nice, I have learned a lot from my friend countries and their cultures.", "John E. Dwyer is a good school and it prepared me for college especially with the AVID program. When I came to the country I didn't know the language well but I received the best support from my ESL teacher Mrs. Miles, but the school schedule and rules are not very good because we don't know when we have home room and when we don't so it is confusing.", 'Dwyers is a god school, but there are aspects which can be changed to improve. In Dwyer, most of the professors give too many chances to their students which created an unrealistic perspective to its students about real life. The food there is too limited, there is almost no variety and the food does not taste that well either.', "John E. Dwyer is a great school that teach me (everyone) everything that i (they) need to know and prepared them for college. There's nothing needed to change to that school.", "John E. Dwyer Technology Academy school had taught me a lot of lessons. It's basically about what you want to do and how are you going to strive for your greatness. If you're looking forward to reach your goal you need to stay on task. It taught me to focus on my work and lot of less friends so you can focus. Administrators are there for you when you need assistance, they are wonderful and always make sure you hear what you need to heard.", 'Excellent Highschool y just got home from work and the other hand in the morning to see if you want to go out with a new study one is of the same time as you can see from the in the morning and a then we you are looking to get back to the morning other than people in this area where the morning to see you in the morning to see you in the morning and a a RTG instead of just Giants just the morning to see if you can want to go out with the morning to see a it you if you want to go see the you can make you want feel free like to you can make your you can get a good day. Thats how it is. STONE AND I WILL. Its very better than most.', 'I would say that it’s a good school. The classes and courses are rigorous but I think that it should be changed a bit. They have begun to impliment more diverse classes but I still believe that there is room for improvement.', 'My experience is alright through the years not the best ive had a better school experience in another district', 'is good and comfy but everything depends on your relationship with the teachers to do no work ad no homework.', "My experience in this high school was good because thanks to this academic program called AVID I learned about colleges and university. I learned about how to apply to colleges and keep my grades up. Otherwise, the environment in the school is not to good because I think the students are not too respectful with teacher and they don't listen to the teachers.", "In my school there are a lot of things that I would like to change. For example, some teachers don't teach anything to the students or don't even try to make students want to study. Also, some teachers give a better treat to students born in the US, than to those who are not. Food is the most horrible thing of the schools. The meat, turkey or ham or bologne, taste like plastic. The cheese is complete plastic. The fruit and vegetables are used from one day to the other, so many times they are already rotten. It is not ususal taht they give fresh food. Also, in the cafeteria there is a lot of plastic thrown away, so the magnitud of the contamination is inmense. Instead of tryng to teach students the importance of take care of he planet, they teach students to contaminate the most possible. Students here are racist, anthipatic and very rude. They treat the others, the teachers and the cleaning-people as if they worked just for them. In overal, the school is very bad.", 'My experience in John E Dwyer Technology Academy has been really good. They have a really good programs to offer to different students. Personally I can say that the AVID program is really well developed and has helped me to prepare for college. As being a senior Jedta has given me many opportunities to be a excellent student.', 'I began my education with John E Dwyer during my Junior year.  I have only had positive experiences and feel very encouraged to have come from a public school who set the bar high for its students to succeed.', 'What I like about this school is that there’re a lot of help and most of the teachers want to see you succeed in life and continue with our education', 'John E Dwyer technology academy is a excelente high school. The teachers are very good, I love this high school because I living especially moments with all my friend and my teachers.', 'It has been a very good experience, all the teachers are always willing to help you and the counselors too.', 'From the beginning of my Freshman year until now there has been a lot of change. Everyone has become more involved, more outgoing and more helpful.', 'It is an excellent school that i am proud to be a student.  I learn how to be ready for college by taking AP classes.  Those classes  will help me  to stay focus on my academic. At my school every one fill welcome and if i cannot understand a subject, my teacher will help me . if anyone is looking for a school to attend , please come at John E. Dwyer Technical Academy', 'The best thing about this school is its counseling services (YES program). They were the reason I got through school without dropping out.', 'The food has got to go, the people there do not know how to cook, and the staff do not know how to clean either. However, it is a very welcoming place with great staff except for some minor not so good staff.']

column6: ["The teachers were all professional and cared about their students process and goals. They made sure we had chances to succeed and graduate. The only problems I had was that school building wasn't that clean and the the stuff we learned wasn't so useful for us, we learned things that we were never going to learn again.", 'John E. Dwyer is a very diverse school! It is a great school, with a wide range of education.  The main focus of the school is technology. The changes that I would like to be made in the school is the uniform policy, the inability to wear hoodies or anything you want. It is pretty unfair.', "Overall JEDTA is a great school. Everyone is friendly and helpful. I always feel safe in the school and outside school grounds. Teaches are very helpful, always trying their best to help students pass and help them with any problems. The school is very diverse, which I like and you get to learn so much from different students. What I do want is for the school to serve better food and for the cooks to try better with the food and have a more positive attitude. But it's a great school, made so many happy memories.", 'Have been a student for 4 years and my experience was all right. Being an AP student enrolled in AVID,  I took challenging courses with great teachers that always help. The food is meh and we have great dedicated sports teams.', 'This is a wonderful school with a helpful staff. This school has a lot of diversity involved and everyone is fair.', "What I liked most about John E. Dwyer Technology Academy is the teamwork between both Student and Teacher. They really care to see you come into their class on time and they really care to make sure that not just that you're passing their class but other classes as well. I play Baseball and being a student-athlete isn't easy, and they make sure that I am on top of my work and I do everything for EVERY class.", 'I love the people, the staff, everything about his school has been eventful and eye opening because of the people there. Everything I went through, positive and negative is because of this school and I grew so much from just these experiences', "I started out at John E. Dwyer during my sophomore year, At first I was very confused about the indoor environment, since I came from Florida where the schools were in open spaces. The first thing that caught my eye when I started out at this school was the computers, they gave out to the students, this allowed me to be in more contact with my teachers and help me with homework that I didn't understand. In addition John E. Dwyers diversity also was a bonus and a new way to interact with all type of races and cultures, helping me to learn and experience new things.", 'The staff is very kind and will try their best to assist you in anyway. Although the facility itself could use some updating', "What I really liked about Dwyer was the staff. They all worked as a whole and did the impossible to teach us the students to become better people and prepare us in the future, in the real world. Although some may argue that Dwyer is the worst school, it isn't and in fact it may be the realest school in Elizabeth because we demonstrated everyone that not only Upper can be smart but so can Dwyer and many other schools. Dwyer teaches students not robots and the four years that I have spent with loving and caring people are my family and its an experience that I will never forget.", 'The teachers are great, Classes were fun. Sometimes things did get out of hand with other students but overall it was a great experience to be a part of.', "I like John E Dwyer because it has a program to hispanic's students. The bilingues classes help us because we can understand our classes and at the same time we are learning English. Also I like the techniques teachers have to teach.", 'My experience at John E. Dwyer Technology Academy has been quite eventful. The school is very nice when it comes to offering honors and Advanced Placement courses(I take 3). I love the many opportunities to earn college credits. The teachers really care about their students, there are no teachers that do not care or do not want to see their students succeed which is rare. One thing I would like to see change is he electives. There are a few choices but not many and there should be more financial investment into the elective department.', 'The school is best if you stay in the most programs and clubs.I personally think this school has so much potential to be the best but is let down by many different factors. Such as high influx of students so bad apples are most likely to fall through, but overall is good.', 'I go to the school and I recommend going to the AVID program because it helps you a lot especially for college', 'what I like about that school is that they have very nice people who cares about your education and you has a person. John E. Dwyer does everything to make your child succeed  at not cost needed . they also guide you  when it comes to classwork and advise.', 'We moved in to United States  in august 2015, I got admission in john e Dwyer as a junior. This is the first high school I been to and I found it so good,  all the teachers are very helpful and motivational.', 'At John e Dwyer technology academic I feel welcome equal also safe.they make the school in our best interest also we learn a lot during my time at Dwyer.I have meet a lot of goods that prepare me for the real world that is out there waiting for me.the teachers are great The environment is safe they give Lot of opportunities .they bring the best in  you and make you see further.', "I had a great experience in Dwyer, overall I've made new friends and I've learn many lessons as well. Although it's been crazy the four years I've attended John E Dwyer I don't see myself in any other high school. What I like about my high school is the events and other extra curricular activities. There's been many opportunities for all students to participate in any school activities. The best part is, they not only make you feel welcome. However everyone becomes family too and no one is ever left behind. What could change is the school lunch, there's many students paying for lunch that's not even that good. Other than that I'm proud of my high school. ", "I like that there are many opportunities for the students to get involved with the school. We have so many clubs have a ton of fundraisers. However, I feel like my school doesn't do enough to reward those students who deserve it. They also do not take enough of the ideas from the students and put those ideas into action. For example, Thomas Jefferson Arts Academy takes their students on a field trip outside the country. They are planning a trip to London and Greece. My school would never schedule a trip like that. Not even to those who deserve it.  I want the equal amount of trips and clubs for all Elizabeth High Schools. I don't want to regret coming to Dwyer but I feel like I am starting to. "]
column8: ["The teachers were all professional and cared about their students process and goals. They made sure we had chances to succeed and graduate. The only problems I had was that school building wasn't that clean and the the stuff we learned wasn't so useful for us, we learned things that we were never going to learn again.", 'John E. Dwyer is a very diverse school! It is a great school, with a wide range of education.  The main focus of the school is technology. The changes that I would like to be made in the school is the uniform policy, the inability to wear hoodies or anything you want. It is pretty unfair.', "Overall JEDTA is a great school. Everyone is friendly and helpful. I always feel safe in the school and outside school grounds. Teaches are very helpful, always trying their best to help students pass and help them with any problems. The school is very diverse, which I like and you get to learn so much from different students. What I do want is for the school to serve better food and for the cooks to try better with the food and have a more positive attitude. But it's a great school, made so many happy memories.", 'Have been a student for 4 years and my experience was all right. Being an AP student enrolled in AVID,  I took challenging courses with great teachers that always help. The food is meh and we have great dedicated sports teams.', 'This is a wonderful school with a helpful staff. This school has a lot of diversity involved and everyone is fair.', "What I liked most about John E. Dwyer Technology Academy is the teamwork between both Student and Teacher. They really care to see you come into their class on time and they really care to make sure that not just that you're passing their class but other classes as well. I play Baseball and being a student-athlete isn't easy, and they make sure that I am on top of my work and I do everything for EVERY class.", 'I love the people, the staff, everything about his school has been eventful and eye opening because of the people there. Everything I went through, positive and negative is because of this school and I grew so much from just these experiences', "I started out at John E. Dwyer during my sophomore year, At first I was very confused about the indoor environment, since I came from Florida where the schools were in open spaces. The first thing that caught my eye when I started out at this school was the computers, they gave out to the students, this allowed me to be in more contact with my teachers and help me with homework that I didn't understand. In addition John E. Dwyers diversity also was a bonus and a new way to interact with all type of races and cultures, helping me to learn and experience new things.", 'The staff is very kind and will try their best to assist you in anyway. Although the facility itself could use some updating', "What I really liked about Dwyer was the staff. They all worked as a whole and did the impossible to teach us the students to become better people and prepare us in the future, in the real world. Although some may argue that Dwyer is the worst school, it isn't and in fact it may be the realest school in Elizabeth because we demonstrated everyone that not only Upper can be smart but so can Dwyer and many other schools. Dwyer teaches students not robots and the four years that I have spent with loving and caring people are my family and its an experience that I will never forget.", 'The teachers are great, Classes were fun. Sometimes things did get out of hand with other students but overall it was a great experience to be a part of.', "I like John E Dwyer because it has a program to hispanic's students. The bilingues classes help us because we can understand our classes and at the same time we are learning English. Also I like the techniques teachers have to teach.", 'My experience at John E. Dwyer Technology Academy has been quite eventful. The school is very nice when it comes to offering honors and Advanced Placement courses(I take 3). I love the many opportunities to earn college credits. The teachers really care about their students, there are no teachers that do not care or do not want to see their students succeed which is rare. One thing I would like to see change is he electives. There are a few choices but not many and there should be more financial investment into the elective department.', 'The school is best if you stay in the most programs and clubs.I personally think this school has so much potential to be the best but is let down by many different factors. Such as high influx of students so bad apples are most likely to fall through, but overall is good.', 'I go to the school and I recommend going to the AVID program because it helps you a lot especially for college', 'what I like about that school is that they have very nice people who cares about your education and you has a person. John E. Dwyer does everything to make your child succeed  at not cost needed . they also guide you  when it comes to classwork and advise.', 'We moved in to United States  in august 2015, I got admission in john e Dwyer as a junior. Not even to those who deserve it.  I want the equal amount of trips and clubs for all Elizabeth High Schools. I don't want to regret coming to Dwyer but I feel like I am starting to. "]

column1: Holcombe L. Rucker School of Community Research
column2: ['As a student who graduated from this school. I had a great experience! The teachers are very helpful and supportive not only are academics taught but they also help shape you as an individual for what is expected of you out there in the future.', "What I like more  from my school is how the teachers help us and understand us.They always explain us the work In a way that we undesrtand and make us fell good In the class.The thing that I don't like from my school is the food. I will like that they give better food.", "My experience in Holcombe L. Rucker school of community research comes in many different stories. Being involved in this school and extra curriculum activities immediately made me feel like a part of the Rucker family. More the teachers come in better stories. Every teacher always have positive vibes which brightens my day. They're always there for me no matter what and helped me improve my intelligence and taught me ways and motivated to get higher grades. Something I really like  is that I my self feel really safe walking in the building of Holcombe Rucker highschool. It's really safe and everyone is treated equally by the teachers. However somethings that needs to be improved is creating more clubs and extra curriculum activities that way students have the chance to follow their hobbies and create their resume for furthermore advantages.", 'We have emergency exit when ever there is an occasional fire drill on every building on campus.', 'We as students are able to participate in many after school activities that help us congregate with other student on campus.', 'Parent that live around the area look around for their kids and other kids safety and education so that they may be able to improve themselves, so that they will be able to reach their goals.', 'The teachers give hard challenges that really put us the student to work hard on any task given, we are encourage to try our best and keep up with all the work so that we can be able to do our own research to show where we got our information.', 'I feel safe being in the school never felt threatened, also there security guards and cameras in the school looking out for the students', 'I would do it all over again if I had to is because I like the students in the school and the staffs', 'The teachers are very helpful they make sure no one feels felt out and they care about the students education', 'School make sure every kid is on point, lots of help', 'There are some smart students in my school and it also a competitive school, less drama and very good teachers. i would go back to the school.', 'Rucker is a wonderful school because its a community High School that helps it students into achieving success . Teachers in the school hate to see there Kids fail so they do as much as they can to help! Making Friends in the school is great,people all around are friendly, open minded , kind and Helpful ! Also there are a lot of extra curricular activities. HLR all the way !', 'In my school we are only offered social studies classes, we do not have music nor art class nor a class to learn other languages. We do not have an auditorium nor a gym.', "Every student must come in school in uniform. There's a good percentage of students with perfect attendance and honor roll, happy to say I'm part of it. There's never almost no bullying at the school. The staff and principal takes this very serious.", 'Technology wise we have a computer room, where most of us the seniors hang out because we usually have a paper to write or projects to print out or type. The counselors are really friendly !. Our counselor for seniors is called Desiree Polonia and she has helped us with college applications. She has helped us on how to apply, what majors are we taking what schools offer us the class or what we need. Etc. Some teachers stay after school to stay and help students. They do not get payed for the extra hours they stay after school, so I appreciate that.', 'Is not so bad. Sometimes the school orders us pizza.', 'Some teachers teach good and also they stay on top of you until you understand the material they giving you. Some teachers prefer when you work together, they always wanna test us on how we do with other people and we get a group grade and individual grade. Not only are there some good teachers but they are really good at teaching and make hard things seem easy. And also makes the classroom fun.', 'no competition between students. students were like crabs in a barell', "the school didn't really have enough health and safety protocols"]

column2: ['My experience in epic is amazing they are very nice. I have met super cool students and staff. The teachers are super helpful.', 'I like that at my school there isn’t a lot of bullying and it’s a small school that offers a lot of one on one attention so you don’t feel like just another face to the teachers and staff members. However I feel that overtime our school has lost its core values of fellowship and lost the feeling of being a second one.', 'a wonderful school. A small school but teachers will have much care for you. As a student of epic south it made me feel comfortable especially coming from a bigger school is made me feel at home because of its ability of making me feel remembered and special. It is a new school so clubs are still develop but in my opinion it is a top school is queens.', 'This is an exceptional school. The teachers become like your second parents and they do want whats best for your future. However, the school is very small so there is not a lot of privacy academically. This is a school for growth and for finding yourself. Even though there are not many clubs you can create own. Lots of room for leadership. Very welcoming and loving environment.', 'I attended Epic High School  South since it first started in 2014. I can confidently say that my experiences there have helped shape me into the person I am today. The staff change throughout the years but old or new they always cared about their students well being. They made sure that our voices were heard for every thing we thought could been improved, changed, or added. My overall experience there will definitely be unforgettable.', 'This school is very welcoming and is very efficient with making sure that the students are on track and stay on track to graduate and begin the next step in their lives after high school.', 'The students are nice but, can be really disrespectful. The staff attempts with teaching skill. This school is unorganized however, seniors and juniors share a tight bond.']

['Harrison High School is a very friendly school, where bullying does not exist, where integrity, honesty, and accountability is key in its students and faculty.', 'I like the teachers and the enthusiasm that the teachers encouraged in students.  They gave every possibility for a student to succeed and most teachers taught at a college level to ensure that students were on par to be sent to college. What i didn\'t like about the school was some of the strict rules that were unnecessary and the lunch that was being served at the school. Students have no option of eating outside therefor have to eat food that is "healthy\'', 'I like the building,the extracurricular activities, teachers, diversity and what i love the most is how everyone respect each others.', "Harrison High is an average school. It is not an art and tech school but it carries a variety of art and S.T.E.M. courses. The school is very proud of its boy's soccer team considering the school is in a soccer town. other sports and outdoor activities include boys and girls swimming, girl's soccer, tennis, softball, baseball, football, cheerleading, bowling, volleyball, basketball, cross-country, Colorguard, and band. I do wish there were more language class offered and more AP classes offered. Teachers are friendly and understanding of students. There are a variety of clubs offered to students and students have the ability to start their own club. Harrison High tries to keep its students safe. To enter the school students must scan their ID cards. Drills are also practiced every so often. This includes fire drills and break-in drills (code C). Scheduling is hectic. Summer assignments and schedule requests are made at the end of the school year but classes are placed in august.", 'The teachers at Harrison high school are very supportive. I loved my experience at HHS. The school provides you all the resources you need to succeed. The faculty and staff are very caring and considerate in all fields.', "- Average- Diversity (Largely Latino/Hispanic)- I feel that there should be more translators available, or maybe more bilingual workers in the school to effectively reach out to students' parents", "Having attended Harrison High School for all four years, I can honestly say that the administration is very adaptable and willing to make changes for the betterment of its students' safety and satisfaction. They have been sure to adhere to whatever concerns and suggestions were made by the students. As an example, after the Parkland tragedy occurred in 2018, principal Mr. Matthew Weber worked alongside a few students to plan a demonstration that allowed for speakers to inform/share their feelings on the event. Councilmen like Mayor James Fife as well as the Director of Personnel James P. Doran attended. Additionally, PTSO meetings are constantly held, which beneficially gives a voice to the parents of this small town. My experience in Harrison has been nothing but a good one.", "Sports are valued more than academics. There are a few teachers who actually teach. Every year, the school gets worse and worse. If I were you, don't attend this school.", 'As a freshman, I really do think this school is a great high school in a small town. Although there are some things that are pretty average and not profound in some ways, it does make it nor a bad or perfect but something in between.', 'Compared to other schools Harrison high school is good, sport and education go hand and hand in this school good grades and great athletes.', "Harrison High School was a very memorable experience for me. The teachers and faculty were very kind and understanding. Most of the teachers really strived to make the most out of educating their students. The bond created between students and teachers is like no other. Overall I really appreciate what Harrison High School has done for me and my academic career, and I'm very grateful I attended this public school.", "Okay school. Faculty don't really prepare you for college readiness, they only care about uniforms and phone policy. Another big factor is they only care about sports and not clubs. They put all their money into sports and have barely any money to give to Soundwaves.", "I did notice much favoritism which I dislike, so I'm hoping as more people speak out and as the years pass by there will soon be change to that. Aside from that, my personal experience was pretty great.", 'The majority of the students are Hispanic or Latino. The diversity has increased, but I do not believe that this is favorable since it would be difficult to attend a primarily white institution or a historically black university due to unfamiliarity. There are a handful of teachers that are too good for this town, but the others do not care enough about the students or teaching them. The students are not being challenged well, resulting in awful work ethics going into college. This makes it very hard for anyone graduating from Harrison High School to even have a chance at being accepted into an Ivy League institution. It is especially because the administration does not care enough about the few outstanding students, but rather accommodating the rest of the student body. Since sports are prioritized in this high school, clubs are left in the dust with little to nothing for a budget, creating a false sense of leadership for the "presidents" within the school.', 'I met great people and earned many great experiences here just like any typical high school would give.  However, I wish I was more prepared for college.', 'Great community for feeling at home.  Lacks a lot in preparing for college as seen with the way information is handled and classes are taught.', 'Most of the teachers at Harrison High School push you to your limits. It is a very close knit community, filled with people who want to see yo succeed in life. Some aspects that I would like to see change is the different courses that can be taken, and have students better prepared for the transition from high school to college courses.', 'Harrison High School has not been an easy school to attend. It can often make me want to pull at my hair and wish graduation could come sooner. Yet, as I do get closer to graduation, I wish time would stop and I could stay in Harrison High for longer. It has become my second home, from countless hours spent in drama club to running around school for my class adviser. I love Harrison High School, despite its flaws.', 'Very diverse high school that was well established full of resources, security, and learning environment all available to the students. Made everyone feel comfortable to a new place after middle school.', 'Great teachers, nice area, up to date with technology. The teachers have a willingness to teach and meet all student needs as a group and individual.']

column6: ['This is an overall good high school with great opportunities to excel. What I enjoyed most about this school is that the faculty is kind and that there is also a wide variety of clubs and after school activities.', 'Bathrooms right by gym are perfect spots for quickies👅 if they are unlocked ufcourse ahaha. Me and some senior always get it going when she has gym class nd she sneaks oh to come have some fun for 5 or 10 minuts. Just be careful nobody sees', "I'm a student athlete, HHS is for the weak. We don't do weak🙅🏽\u200d♂️ Weak is unacceptable 😾 We are strong alwas on that grind 💪🏽 We look up 👆🏽 Meanwhile this school looks down 👇🏽 I cannot complete my student athlete life 😤 I need to be a champion 🏆 But HHS only drags me ⬇️ Other than that thanks family 🙌🏽 Thanks god 🙏🏽 Have a good life 👏🏽👍🏽", 'Teachers are very kind and charismatic, but too easy on the students. They should challenge the students more to better prepare them for college.', 'My overall experience attending Harrison High School was amazing. High School is a very important part of a persons teenage years and Harrison High School allowed me to live these years to the fullest. The amount of school spirit and the relationships students build with not only classmates or teachers but with the counselors, administrators, security guards, janitors, and cafeteria staff as well, are such strong bonds it feels as if we are all family. Students are surrounded with people that will not only help them academically but will also guide them into becoming an intelligent adult ready to succeed in life.', "Good school! Just doesn't really prepare for college well. For Example, not much information is giving about Scholarships and Culture is great. Faculty and Teacher really bring try to encourage us students to have school spirit by initiating all sorts of activities throughout the school year. But overall it's not the best school but it isn't the worst.", 'Most teachers try to get the student into the lesson. Many of them have preferences. They have "favorite students". Sometimes these students are very rude but teachers do not care about it.  Counselors are OK. The town is pretty safe.Students do not try their best.', 'Harrison high school is a place to feel at home. It is such a diverse school where you learn about cultures not from a textbook but experience it through each individual student. It is a relatively small school where everyone knows everyone making the student body a family. The administration has a close relationship with the students being able to personally know your teachers. Since every face is familiar it is easy to be yourself and feel safe. I would change the college readiness since many students are caught off balance when they enter college, but overall the Harrison high school experience has been great.', 'My overall experience at Harrison High was not the best. Although the building is new and clean, you will not graduate college ready.If you are lucky, you will encounter some of the most passionate teachers here.  However, most of the teachers at HHS do not care about your education. HHS offers a few AP Courses. We could possibly improve on that.', "Harrison High school was quite an adventure for me as a student. The first years as a student I felt both at ease and anxious going through the hallways and sitting through my classes. Just like any other high school, you'll meet the people who you easily connect with, and people you wish you could avoid like the plague. For me, it was quite an experience. 2017 will be my last year, and now after four years, I've realized that I'm not the same person who walked through these hallways who exuded lack of confidence, but instead someone who walks tall, emanating confidence.", "Harrison boys soccer is filled with very talented young individuals that go unheard of, there should be more scouting going on for these young boys. But, besides a few sports teams we do not provide like most schools for example we don't even have a track team", 'I have not been challenged within this school at all i feel like my true potential has gone to waste.', 'Harrison High School contains teachers that either go above and beyond what is expected of them or provide nothing, i feel as throughout my high school career I have not been challenged enough. We also do not have any programs that help cater to future careers that a student dreams of becoming.', 'I agree with the user that said our school is mediocre.', 'Majority of the student body are minorities.', "No one participates in the clubs and the teachers that monitor the clubs don't care either.", 'Due to the education I received at HOME by my parents, I will not be naming any names :)\r First off, most of the teachers here do not teach and do not care about your education. You will not be prepared for college in this school.\r Second of all, the school "over-hypes" their Culinary Course. To the staff member who obviously wrote that review about HHS\'s vast "opportunities", NICE TRY. Want to know what people in the Culinary Program did this past year? They sat on their phones in the lunchroom recording Snapchat videos the entire time. \r This school enforces the uniform policy more than it enforces our education. Students will be taken out of class and sent home if they don\'t wear their polos, but you will see a teacher on their phone in class and nothing will be done about it. \r The Guidance Department is something to be ashamed of. I personally experienced a guidance counselor discourage me from taking the SATs junior year and instead take it for the FIRST and ONLY time senior year. On another occasion, the same counselor did not mail a student\'s college application  because she believed he would not be accepted. The Guidance Department is in charge of scheduling student\'s classes. They will put a student in a class that they already passed simply because it fit with their schedule. The counselors and administrators will discourage you from taking an honors or AP class rather than pushing for the student to strive for "harder" classes. \r Honorable mention to the football players that are failing classes yet they are still on the team and receive no disciplinary action.\r With just a click, you would find the mediocre SAT scores of the students on the NJ School Performance Report. Only 13.2% of students score above a 1550 out of 2400. \r And to the idiot that gave this school a five-star rating and wrote "I am a very \'studios\' student", you\'re just showing all of us the ignorance and idiocy encouraged in Harrison High.', 'Although the school is new (less than ten years old), has 50 inch televisions in every classroom, computers, and air conditioning, the quality of the education here is atrocious. This school does NOT prepare you for college. The highest expectation in this school is community college (and if you\'re lucky the local state university that\'s a mile away). This school simply does not prepare you for the rigor of higher education. First of all, the grade inflation in this school is so common that students will fail state testing and struggle in their future college classes yet have a 3.4 GPA throughout all of high school. 90% of the teachers do not care about teaching, even honors and AP teachers. There are a few exceptions that include teachers who are retiring, so.... Teachers in this school do not get hired because of their qualifications, they get qualified because of connections. It is clearly shown when faculty members are related or they come from the same exact school district. Good luck learning something useful from these "teachers".', "Most of the clubs at this school don't do much to get new members and barely have any resources available.", 'From parents that I know, they get involved in their kids education and care about it. They try their best to keep their kids in check to get their work done and try to lead them to success.']
column8: ["Most teachers don't care about the students education. Some teachers even stop teaching because one kid can't behave and respect the rules, which in fact is a great disadvantage to the other kids trying to learn.", 'I like how this school accepts that we are all different. I do not witness a lot of bullying, but there are many security cameras around the school. This way if someone tries to escape, then we would know who it is. As for the nurse, she is sweet. She provides ice packs and helps if you a have a headache. Overall, this school is pretty safe.', "There are no many extracurricular opportunities at this school like I hope. For example, we don't have cooking. Also, with the after school programs few people attend, unless it includes sports. Many people attend the volleyball, football, and soccer games, but not really the other programs, like the Environmental Club, Yearbook, Debate, etc.", 'My overall experience at this school was fun. Since HHS is a small school, I can connect with the teachers and get to know them closer. I feel like the teachers treat the students as friends sometimes; they become strict when they need to. The teachers here are really great, and I love their happy and positive attitude. I remember talking to a teacher once about the anxiety. This teacher really did help me overcome my anxiety, and he continues to make me stronger. At HHS, I can say the teachers and the guidance counselors are here to help you if you need help.', 'In Harrison High School, the teachers are very engaging with the students. When I need help, I know I can depend on them for help, such as homework help and advice. While this might not be considered the best school, HHS definitely has many opportunities if you work diligently; HHS has AP courses, the written driving test, Financial Literacy, Mandarin, and a Culinary Program, which is not offered in other schools. Also, the teachers definitely push the students extremely hard, and they challenge the students; while HHS might be small, there is a lot of love. Many students attend the basketball games and football games to show their support. Also, with the Tricky Tray, many students and staff were willing to attend and help out. However, one thing I dislike about HHS is the enforcement of uniforms. I understand wearing uniforms are important, but sometimes I feel like the uniforms are more important than learning. Yet, besides that, Harrison High School is a pretty great school.', "They are amazingly helpful. They do what they're supposed to and more. They're truly all about helping and benefiting their students.", 'Great clubs, different activities for different people', 'the knowledge is top notch. Respectful with students', 'Everyone pretty much does their own thing', 'The teachers took out there time to teach the class and gave the students the chance to engage in questions and answers. From my experience, anytime i had a problem or did not understand something my teacher was willing to stay after school and take there time to go over with me whatever problem i had which is much needed in a lot of schools.', 'They had lots of activities...talent shows..fundraising..chorus..sports which i participated through out my years attending there', 'I felt very prepared to enter college with all my achievement and learning all that i needed to learn in order to go on to college. I have always been a studios student. Where i applied all my time and effort into all my school work and still doing it in college. I want to succeed in everything that i wish to accomplish in my life.', 'We have a officer office with a local police officer there in the school building. Our principal does not tolerate violence or anything that may hurt someone or take away their safety.', 'almost all our sports excel at being the best from our competitors', 'A very great school. Safe environment. We have high quality equipment and the building is brand new. Teachers are great, and staff is always there to help. Principal is very nice and school has a lot of fun activities for students to stay on the right track.', 'I,  in particular, participate on the swim team and this team is very great. We get along very well with coaches and teammates and there are never arguments.', 'There are a variety of clubs related to the arts like mural club and art club and drama club. These are among the most popular clubs in the school.', 'The only team that loses all the time football team. They had a 4 year losing streak', 'Lots of pressure and lots of group sepreration', 'Most teachers are not strict enough.  Too many of them put a movie on instead of teaching.  Homework is very rare!']

column1: Archimedes Academy for Math, Science & Technology Applications
column2: ['The students there were all different and very kind. The teachers were great and truly cared for their students and what they wanted to do.', 'This school sucks a lot! the food taste like rocks . They teachers are good but the food sucks. And the bathrooms are not clean at all, students pee on the floor and throw wet tissues everywhere, They even student harass students in the bath room. DEFANTLY NOT MISSING THIS SCHOOL', "I'm finally a senior this year as much as I don't wanna leave my favorite teachers,  this school taught me to not go to a school that is near my house just because it's close. Some of the teachers are disrespectful and will possibly misplace your stuff and five you an F bringing your grade down. But I like that we get out earlier now.", 'Being a very quiet student, I never thought of getting any support in school, Archimeded proved me wrong. Even though they are not the best, a very hardworking community and they try and give their very best. Most of the teachers are super nice and caring. They have supa classes for their seniors and a national honor society which is very nice.', 'I am a senior of the school. The leadership was down right terrible and the principal was scared to leave her office. She never left her office to the point people did not know we had a principal. The bad kids did whatever they want and there were no consequences for their bad behavior.', 'Archimedes Academy gives us students a chance to show what we know in our academics. The school allows us to expand in ourselves and give ideas in what we want to make the school even better. Also, the school gives us many opportunities to try out new things and experience what we can experience in a college environment or in the real world. I am a National Honor Society member and have helped this school tremendously with getting  students, parents, and strangers outside of the school to get involved. Archimedes Academy is like a second home to me and everyone is like family.', 'What I liked about this school was the way the teachers would connect with some of the students on a personal level. If they were having issues with something going on the teachers would pick up on it and lend a hand or speak with the student to see if there was anything that they can do to help. What I would like to see change would be some of the faculty and college readiness. I feel that the school is average at preparing the students with the skills they need to be successful in college.', 'I had  great time when I attended Archimedes, the teaches were great and the academics really helped me prepare for college.', 'I like the teachers that care and wanted us to pass and succeed, also the great friends and memories I have made there.', 'A relatively small school; thus being a positive impact mainly because students are able to connect and interact with one another perfectly as well as they are with their teachers. The teachers in this school are more than just educators, they are inspired by their own subject they teach and strive to help  those struggling.', "Very good staff. The people are what make the school great. The faculty seem to get along well and the teachers care if we pass or fail. The school is very very small. This is both a pro and a con. It's small so there is a block system. You dont choose classes. But it's small so your ideas and participation in sports and clubs matter a ton. And though I said the teachers are good. They may only be good for now. A lot of them have left. I have not yet had many new teachers because im a senior. Im not sure how the underclassmen like the change. But the new teachers give off a nice vibe.", "I applied to Archimedes Academy because I loved the idea of a small school where I knew all the students and faculty. I was able to flourish because it provided me the attention I needed to succeed, they offered a push that I would have lost in a bigger school. The fact that it is such a new school is also something I liked because I was basically growing up with the school I was there to experience changes that future generations won't. The mistakes and confusion that comes with it and to be able to see that they are putting effort in trying to make a school in the Bronx special makes me happy because these people are actually trying.", "There isn't many after school clubs.", 'My overall experience was so-so because of the lack of organization', 'Most tecahers devote their time into students who are struggling the best.', 'The safety guards are really great they get along with everybody and make sure everyone is safe and leaves the building safe.', "The activities in the school are great almost everyone is involved.  The one I really like is basketball been playing this sport since freshman year and it breaks my heart that I'm leaving soon and won't be able to see my teammates anymore.", 'What makes the school unique is all the different types of cultures and activities we do at the school. Everyone respects each other. MY favorite experience at this school is the athletic team I like being part of all different types of them because I love expereincing new things, and yeah if I could do it all over again I will go to the school because I got motivated to do what I do now.', "The teachers at this school are very understandable I can always count on them. Whenever I'm in need of help they are always there ready for me, they are also helping me with my college applications.  I love some of the teachers at my school and I am very comfortable around them.", "I honestly can't see myself in any other school."]

["Aspirations was a good and bad experience for me. The staff is really great, caring, and help you get where you need to be regardless of circumstances. They help you get in and get out as long as you do what you're supposed to do and come on time everyday."]

column1: Benjamin Franklin High School for Finance & Information Technology
column2: ['I am currently a senior for this school. I’ve learned a lot academically, but also I’ve learned life lessons. This school has helped me better myself and the people around me, staff and students have lifted me up when I was down. I am happy I was able to go here and meet these wonderful people.', "It had good teachers and education but there are some aspects that could be improved in. The facility members aren't the nicest people you will meet and fights are very common here. Safety in this school is below average and could be improved, pickpocketing and bullying is common I  this school.", "So far benjamin franklin high school for fiance & information technology is good school to me it is actually my first year in the school and I'm really impressed.", "Doesn't offer a variety of AP classes or classes in general. The highest science offered is Chemistry. Although the teachers are involved and there is a sense of community, it is clear that teachers do have our best interest at heart. But there isn't a variation in the curriculum and 2020 might be the first year to offer an advanced regents diploma since opening.", 'BFIT is a very nice school. It offers very intellectual courses and along with clubs and activities.', 'Benjamin Franklin High School For Finance and Information Technology recently held its second annual National Honor Society Induction Ceremony in the Campus Magnet auditorium in Cambria Heights. Lofty academic requirements are required to be a member. Benjamin Franklin is a new small high school and has just added the junior year to the school.', 'I have been in BFIT for exactly 4 years and i actually had time enjoyed it because it was fun and sad and i made friends i can count on. it is a good school and because its such a small school everyone is involved and is here for each other', 'I would like for this school to treat the students with more respect like the young adults we are. The school should also create a more entertaining learning environment where the students are more engaged and interactive.', "My experience throughout Benjamin Franklin High School for Finance And Information Technology was good and beneficial to me in multiple ways , it allowed me to Focus my mind on things i didn't know. Although it was challenging since i was learning something new and the teachers also had a new feeling to them. I learned that the environment in the school grounds are safe for students to be in.", 'A well developed school with a good staff and potential. The school is relatively young having only 5 years and one graduating class, but build great young minds.', "The experience in Benjamin Franklin was long. Teachers always made sure that my work was being done and making sure I was on track. Some schools don't care about their students and let them do whatever. Bfit was preparing us for the world to make sure we would all become successful one day.", 'It was a great run and I feel this school and prepared me to start off a good college career. The programs within this school has gave me extra knowledge unlike other highschools. The sports system was excellent and very fun as i was on the basketball team.', 'I like that this school teaches students how to be college ready and this school could change how they operate.', 'The people here are fun to be around and some teachers teach us things that we will need to learn, like financial literacy and college readiness class, and we also took some fun classes over the years such as Photoshop and web design, but the schools is small and the students do not really have any clubs and do anything that stand out. Its pretty depressing', 'Not too bad of a high school. However, it could be better, the curriculum could use some work , the way we are thought in the classroom is not very beneficial to our college career choices and I believe that our learning experience should be insightful.', 'I loved this school mainly because of how I can connect with the teachers and consuls had there doors open 24/7 for kids in need. Seance we had a new principle, the school is a little slow but gets better over time.', 'My overall experience by staying in "B-FIT" is that it was a great one. What I like most about "B-FIT" are the staff members. All the teachers expect each student to do their best and know that we all have potential. The teachers will do everything they can to help their students pass all their classes. However, One thing I would like to change is the uniform policy, and I feel like it would be better if there were more advanced placement classes, as of now, there are only 3 AP classes. About the Uniforms, you must wear school gray shirt, black pants and MUST have ALL black shoes. My experience in school was great, the only thing I did regret was not joining the activity in my early high school year and I decided to wait for my last year to join a sport. My advice to any future student going to this school, be respectful to the teachers and try to enter an activity as early as you can. Ask for programs that you could do because the school offers MANY!', "Over the 4 years being at Benjamin Franklin it wasn't all easy. Being the second graduating class meant we had to be held to high expectations. I was always quiet but with the teachers pushing me to be more confident as they said It is mandatory for college I started talking more and making friends. Now I sit here apart of all the clubs given toward me and I take all the opportunities given to me too. With the help of the teachers faculty and staff and students we have built this school up to what it has become today.", 'Benjamin Franklin High School for Finance & Information Technology is nicknamed, BFIT. The school is small and has a comI liked the teachers at Benjamin Franklin High School. They seem to care about advancing the education of the students. When struggling I am able to seek the advice a teacher whether for academic or personal reasons. Now the school is growing and the environment feels less comforting. It has become more like the New York City, constantly moving type of vibe. The new administration do not interact with children as before but there are still some good ones on there.', 'The staff is inviting and caring. Teachers, parents and government officers believe the school is orderly and more disciplined than the other surrounding schools. Most individuals will agree that the former principal, Dr. Carla Theordorou, was an effective leader and did remarkably well in grooming her staff and students . Parents, students and teachers generally respect one another and trust each other.']

Most individuals will agree that the former principal, Dr. Carla Theordorou, was an effective leader and did remarkably well in grooming her staff and students . Parents, students and teachers generally respect one another and trust each other.']

column2: ['Mount Vernon High School has been the only school I have attended the past 4 years. Despite that it may lack in a few departments, I was given the best possible education they could offer. Mainly from the teachers. I hope that my school systematically improves. I really have high hopes that the students and faculty will take their positions and roles in education seriously.', 'I am a MVHS Alum and I loved my high school experience. The school is somewhat big but class is small. Everyone knows everyone. My favorite class was Music with Carmen Nemeth. The school has a lot of sports and great home games. The town is very supportive when it comes to sports. The academics are also great. The teachers and counselors are the best. They help you with a lot, including getting ready for your college experience.', 'My experience at Mount Vernon High School was good. While it sometimes get a bad reputation it is all based on the student. The teachers are caring if you show that you care and are interested and they will often go out of their way to help and make sure you do your best.', 'my experience with MVHS has been great over all . MVHS has been full of  opportunities and different resources  that I can use in the rear future', 'In my opinion, I think that Mount Vernon High School was actually a good experience. Sure, there were some up and downs , but what school doesn’t? I think Mount Vernon High School is different from other schools because it shows students the diversity of our community and that sometimes our differences is what makes us stronger.', 'Mount Vernon High School has been a rollercoaster experience for me, it has its good traits and bad. I have met great people there and teachers that really care and have supported me all the way through. I have been taught many life lessons and participated in many opportunities such as classes and programs. It is a big School with a lot of students but has lot to offer from sports, classes to academic programs and after school programs. There is space for a variety of people to fit in and everyone no matter who you are finds somewhere where they belong in the school!', 'My personal email experience at Mount Vernon HIgh school Was pretty great . . I stayed to myself & focused on my education . . Luckily , I had great teachers who helped me along the way of my career. I had a great guidance counselor , Ms. Peggy Williams , who really loved her students & their future .', 'They try their best to help but not everyone accept their help.', 'It can be improved. I hope it does sometime soon.', "I like it there but some kids need to be moved out the school. That's all I have to say", "The school is okay. Why? The administration and staff is great! There expectations are high but it's the kids who bring the school down with there unacceptable behaviors well some of them. Otherwise , a teacher would work with you one on one in his/her own time or any other staff.", 'scheduling is fast and easy, workload is only as hard as you make it', 'people are open minded about everyone', 'They NEED band or some type of music club', "This school has a faster time and effective way to get a degree but I wouldn't go here again because they don't have music", 'The teachers are understandable, and love to teach they make lessons fun and help the kids who struggle', "This school isn't as horrifying as everyone makes it seems. If you come to the school with intentions to do what you came there for then you'll turn out just fine. Mount Vernon High School offer the student multiple opportunities at chance to excel. One of my most memorable times was the Junior Step Up Day when  was a sophomore .", 'The teachers attempt to always put their best foot forward to help the students. At times the curriculum can be a bit challenging due to the new standards of the common core. On the contrary, I feel that if the students  their pride aside sometimes than they will be mentally prepared for what it is that the teachers are trying to prepare them for.', 'They security are a working system almost as if they were a machine. The security is very friendly with the students which gives them easy access to knowledge such as when and where a fight may be happening.', "All the student/athletes are extremely competitive and as soon as you walk into one of the sports practice sessions you can easily sense it, their hunger to win and become national champions is like the hunger of a starved tiger. Unlike other schools our equipment is definitely not the best but the athletes don't care they still make it work. If the students were given the right material they could easily be best in the state but another factor is the athletes need to over work themselves to ensure victory can lead to chronic injury in certain aspects of the season."]

If you come to the school with intentions to do what you came there for then you'll turn out just fine. Mount Vernon High School offer the student multiple opportunities at chance to excel. One of my most memorable times was the Junior Step Up Day when  was a sophomore .", 'The teachers attempt to always put their best foot forward to help the students. At times the curriculum can be a bit challenging due to the new standards of the common core. On the contrary, I feel that if the students  their pride aside sometimes than they will be mentally prepared for what it is that the teachers are trying to prepare them for.', 'They security are a working system almost as if they were a machine. The security is very friendly with the students which gives them easy access to knowledge such as when and where a fight may be happening.', "All the student/athletes are extremely competitive and as soon as you walk into one of the sports practice sessions you can easily sense it, their hunger to win and become national champions is like the hunger of a starved tiger. Unlike other schools our equipment is definitely not the best but the athletes don't care they still make it work. If the students were given the right material they could easily be best in the state but another factor is the athletes need to over work themselves to ensure victory can lead to chronic injury in certain aspects of the season."]
column6: ["The parents of Mount Vernon want their children to obtain greatness and you can tell by their support of their children, but the parents also expect that their child will take care of things on their own in school as long as the are supported emotionally and economically. This may be a problem because some students understand that their parents work hard to support them so the children push themselves hard to not let their parents hard work go to waste but some of the children don't fully grasp this concept and focus more on the opinion of their peers which may be bad influences so to speak. It is rarely the parents who are messing up but most of the time it is the child who sees school as more of a hangout rather then a place to gain abilities to succeed.", 'Mount Vernon High School is a school with a high potential for greatness but is many times looked away or disregarded due to its previous reputations but we are in a new era full of new students with fresh minds and high ability which are fully capable of taking the world by the. The teaching staff is trying 100% to give there best to push these student towards the right path. Teachers may sometimes seem strict but that is to make sure the students never lose their way and always stay on their goal of success.', "Most peers were positive and some weren't.", 'Some teachers were very caring and others were non-caring. I strongly believe they needed to teach with more engaging activities/lessons.', 'Best experience at this school was a play they had performed and the talent shows. I also attend most of the athletic events like basketball, baseball, and volleyball.', 'The teachers at this school are great. Most of them want you to succeed in life and make something of yourself in the long run. Most of my teachers created an environment in which my classmates and I where comfortable with.', 'Track and field, after school program.', 'Most of the teachers are okay, and genuinely care about the students.', 'Students have to sign an agreement, basically agreeing to follow the rules, do home work, no bullying allowed, we have a health class that is mandatory and students must pass in order to graduate.', 'This school is ok, some of the teachers are really great some not so much, but I am able to go to my teachers if i need help.', "The school really cares about the academic lives of the students and that's what I like about it.", 'I would choose to go to this school again the ex prince was good. The teachers where all very helpful and understanding. My favorite experience was  the after school activities, there where school games, after school programs  that had a verity of subjects.what made this school unique was the fact that there was a lot to do and they thaugh you subjects you need to go to college.', 'I wish that the adults would act like adults and respect us like we should be. Janitors should take their job more seriously and a few teachers should be enthused. I would not like to have done it any other way because being at this school taught me a lot about life and  people in general.', 'We have strict security guards during the morning . we have scnasers to out our bags through. We also have 2 or 3 guards posted on each intersection.', 'Teachers are very personable and eager to have that one on one connection with all the students.', 'After school program with different activities and credit recovery. We now have a CNA class. We have 8 sports teams. There is a time where everyone in the school sets a goal to join a specific team but they never fully commit to it.', 'School officials at my lack maturity , respect and enforcement. There is a lot of favoritism and not a lot of authority. My principal is excellent and tries very hard to keep everyone happy and effective. Theres not much enforcemnt in bullying because everyone seems to be cool with that .', 'I would say it is okay because the most effective or " important " teams at my high school are the basketball team and the track team. volleyball , tennis, football and soccer do not get much recognition because they lose most of their games .Also there is not much sportsmanship if we have teams that do not accomplish a lot. Things that affect most of the athletes is peer pressure , discouragement and lack of confidence.', 'My teachers are some of the most intelligent teachers who teach a certain way that is easy to comprehend', 'The food menu is great. It would be nice for them to include hot lunches somtimes']
