column2: ["Keansburg High School is a welcoming school in general. Despite the school and Keansburg in general as a town being a bit small, no matter who you are, you'll fit right in. The teachers and academics at Keansburg High School will make sure that you are prepared for college and the world itself.", 'I loved all my teachers at KHS They gave me knowledge and guidance to become who I am today. I met many wonderful lifetime friends. Sometimes this school gets a bad rep but ultimately the teachers are doing a great job for the students to achieve their goals', 'I like the welcoming energy all around this district but it’s more of rushing to learn/study for a test rather than actually taking our time to learn the criteria correctly, also the food comes out cold half the time and it’s absolutely disgusting,', 'Sports are about politics if you know the right people you get to play varisity sports the teachers are all about paychecks they come in work and are out the door at dismissal', 'Keansburg High School is a school dedicated to the education and development of its students. This is clearly evident through the student-teacher ratio of 10:1, the plethora of after school activities available to students, and the willingness of faculty to go the extra mile for the students. Every teacher knows every students by name at Keansburg and vise versa. I never had to compete for the attention of my teacher, especially when I needed extra help with a topic or assignment. After school, I always had something to do thanks to the variety of varsity sports offered at Keansburg High School as well as the clubs such as the Heroes and Cool Kids Program and National Honor Society.', 'Teachers who actually care about their students. The academics are also really well paired the problem is with the politics of it everyone is super worried about how appealing they look to the board.', 'There are some really great teachers at that school but overall the school is a mess and it needs a lot of work. I have not enjoyed my time as a student there.', "Keansburg high school will not prepare your child for college. They give easy work and the students refuse to do it just because someone is telling them what to do. The children with behavioral issues spend their days learning from a trailer next to the school and get take out for both breakfast and lunch everyday. The kids that actually do what they're suppposed to do not get rewarded.", 'The classes are easy to pass as long as you hand everything in on time.', 'Most people try to fit in but others are themselves.', 'We have one police officer, and two security guards.  I always feel safe coming to school.  We have fire drills, lock down drills, and evacuation drills often.', 'We have tons of different clubs and extracurriculars to chose from, which makes it easy for everyone to fit in somewhere.', "My favorite thing about Keansburg High School is our Athletic Program.  I've cheered all four years of high school.  My freshman year the football team made it to the second round of the State Playoffs.  Every year after that, they've went 1 and 9 for the season.  The support from the school and community still remained the same all four years.  Whether we lost by 1 point, or by 60 points, every Saturday game had alumni, parents, classmates and teachers in the stands.  The Athletic Program at Keansburg High School is more like a family to me.", "My educators are the most dedicated and selfless people I know.  Personally, aside from my mom, I'd have to say that my teachers are my biggest supports.  They're always in my corner, cheering me on in everything that I do.  In the past four years of High School, I have endured many personal struggles, academic successes and failures, and because of the effortless attempts from my teachers, to connect with me on every level, I am able to pursue my goals and dreams.  They have truly help shape me into the individual I am today, and I'm beyond grateful for attending Keansburg High School because of them.", "Most of the students take part in drugs and drinking and talk freely about it like it's no big deal.", 'The students barely show up for after school activities and most clubs have less than 10 people in them. The football teams record has been losing 10 games and only winning 1 game every season for as long as I can remember.', "There were many times tat I'd be walking the halls and hear a parent screaming at a principal or teacher to change their child's grade or to pass them.", 'I have been through the district all of my life, and I am not happy with the level of education I am receiving. Some teachers do not teach the students. They read off of powerpoint presentations that were not created by them and give out worksheets after.', "After school hours the school dosent offer much for all students. Unless you play a sport or you're involved with music many kids just can't wait to go home after school gets out", "There's been good and bad days but truthfully I'm not happy at my school. I know I could he offered so much more knowledge at a bigger school. I love being in a small school that's not the problem, the problem is students don't get treated fairly and many of the staff members point it out to even the students"]

column6: ['Coming from a very small town a good education is not really given. Only a select few of my teachers are amazingly brilliant but some I just feel like are wasting my time and not teaching me what I need to know', 'Although some kids are under-disciplined, no students go unnoticed or unappreciated. This school as well as the entire town is a big family.', "This school is very small compared to others. But you really get to know everyone and the teachers are really dedicated to their job. We have a bunch of activities so there is something for everyone. We don't offer the most sports but we do have quite a bit and some of our teams are really good like our cross country teams, boy bowling, boys tennis, baseball and softball teams. In general the school is a lot of fun.", 'For what we have in such a small school our athletic director keeps everything top notch. He prides himself in taking care of all fields, equipment, and athletes.', 'It definitely prepared me for the real world. Definitely could have used more help in the college aspect.', 'Faculty and staff are always available to the students.', "There were many different types of clubs: national honor society, tri-m, student council, be the change, foreign language, key club, chess club, etc. The more fun options for me were student council and be the change. In student council you're there to hear what's going on in the school first, you get to help plan things and it looked great on college applications. Be the change club was a specific club in our school that actually raised money to bring Challenge Day to our school, which was something that you begged to be apart of. It's a day where you become closer than ever to your classmates, faculty and administration.", 'The nurse is always doing drug testing in her office and is rarely ever available.', 'There is a lot of diversity in my school.  Many kids come from different backgrounds and settings and fit right in with the school.', 'Many kids, including myself, complain about the school lunch as well as the lunch ladies.', 'Many of our varsity sports due well and make it to the playoffs.  Almost all of our sports have few kids on the team, because our school population is roughly 400 kids.', 'I am very involved with the school, but I wish more kids were the same.  A lot of students in my grade are uncooperative and do not care for the "high school experience".', "Many of the academics the school offers are great.  Due to our small population, our school doesn't offer as much as I'd like, but for the most part, it'll do.", 'The athletics department is great and full of school spirit. Our facilities are limited but we do keep great care or each of our fields and our gym. All games are well attended and after school activities are well attended also. Athletics are taken very seriously at my school. Students are equally motivated from the players to the fans.', 'The academics offered include general classes, and AP/honors classes. But the curriculum could use a refresher. Students do have a good variety of courses t take but the variety could be a bit bigger. The workload for the general classes is average but the AP/honors classes the workload can be intense at times.', 'The teachers are okay. Most of them live around the area so many things students go through the teachers can relate so as far as interest that great. The instruction is satisfactory and the teaching is average. Overall our curriculum just needs a refresher and i believe our teachers will be consistent.', "We've had plenty of threats and gas leaks that involved the school and the school did follow proper procedure. Every emergency is taken seriously. I do feel that my personal safety is in good hands as far as protocol goes.", "Students aren't allowed to wear hoods, or any other head accessories such as scarfs. Students are also not allowed to wear open toed shoes. and shorts that are not passed your fingernails. The dress code is somewhat strict but students still try there best to work around it. The staff involvement is prominent being that it is a small school, but the guidance counselors can be a but more involved.", "The extracurricular activities are average. We have the usual clubs, groups, and teams just as any other high school. But we do lack diversity clubs and more high culture learning activities. But I give an A- because the school is open minded about whatever a student has in mind so support wouldn't be a hassle to get an idea started.", 'I go to a very small school. Everyone knows everyone and the atmosphere is dull. But I do take advantage to having such a good relationship with many people because of the closeness. The fact that my school is small the opportunities for classes, friends, and clubs is limited. I do enjoy the ability to be comfortable in my school. But I also would enjoy a chance to experience something different. I would not choose to do it all again.']

column2: ['If you are looking for a high school to prepare you for college this is not the one for you. This high school is more career oriented and it won’t help you get a good grade for you SATS. The teachers don’t teach the way they should be teaching English and math. The councilor that is supposed to help students doesn’t do anything but sit in her office and only offers help to her favorite students. So if your not on her check list she won’t help you with colleges or scholarships and how to apply for college. Yes you might be learning about what you want to do for your career but that doesn’t mean much if you can’t get into a good college. So if your looking for a high school to really prepare you then look somewhere else because you won’t find it here.', 'Bridgeport Military Academy is a unique school that not only offers the JROTC program but a first responders program as well. The teachers are deciated to helping their students through personal and academic problems. The staff really cares about the students and encourage them to shoot for their dreams and make sure nothing gets in their way and cloud their sight. The only thing I would like to see change in this school is for the uniform to include only leather combat boots and not an option to wear all black sneakers.', 'The main reason I enjoyed attending Bridgeport Military Academy was due to the confidence I have gained in there. I had a chance to gain confidence and become a leader also increase my military knowledge. Though one thing I would like to change would be the location, I would like the school to become bigger in order for more students to attend.', 'We always study fire drills and lock down drills.', 'We have Drill Team , Forenics , Self defense club and It is a very fun experience to learn different things.', 'Bridgeport MIlitary Academy is a school for First Responders or students who would like to join the Military. I really do enjoy this school our school has traits of Polic, Fire, EMR , Home Land Security and Military.', "When I first started to attend Bridgeport Military Academy two of my Freshmen teachers had left the school and my Freshmen class did not have a Spanish or English for months. Towards the end of the year our offical English teacher had came. Now that I am a Sophmore I say that a lot of the teachers are very supportive for us students, they help us with things that we don't understand, they just want us to be the best and as successful we can be in out lives and I am so thankful for that."]

['I have had a great couple of years here. This school and professionals have taught me so much more than I expected.', 'As a transfer student, I have felt that the professional at this school have made me a better person. I have come a long way and learned so much more tan my previous school experience .', "The food is pretty good for public school cafeteria food, our cook is actually really good about seasoning food so it doesn't taste bland. Most of the food is pretty healthy (i.e. no white rice, baked sweet potato fries). There is always and alternative for those of us who prefer not to eat meat.", "The overall culture of the school is better than most schools like it in Brooklyn. There is never any fighting still, kids will be kids. People gossip but thats regular high school stuff, its easier to stay out of drama at this school though. Its also a small school there is only about 200 kids and seven Advocate Counselors, so that everyone has someone looking out for them. It's not like other schools where students just feel like another face in the crowd."]

['Bronxwood is a very good school but the teachers do not teach the children the accurate information for tests and state regents.', "My experience was an odd journey in this school. However, I adored all my teachers and I'm extremely grateful to them for supporting me throughout the years. I wouldn't have had the will power to graduate without their guidance and hard work. They make the school amazing despite the difficult environment it can have sometimes. If there is anything wrong going on within the school it's not the staff, I promise it. The kids in the area are very difficult and have many behavioral issues. As a graduate of 2018, I have to say that I loved the school. Actually no, I loved the staff of the school. The students were almost intolerable and made it difficult to do anything nice in the school.", "DIDN'T REALLY LIKE THIS SCHOOL FOR MY DAUGHTER. WHEN I TRIED TO TRANSFER HER THEY KEPT PUTTING IT OFF UNTIL SHE COULDN'T.", "I don't like nothing about this school, this school is full of teachers that really don't care about any child's success. For instant, if you are failing classes they wouldn't do anything to help you. You have to stick to yourself and make a change for yourself, while other schools help you and stuff, Bronxwood Preparatory Academy doesn't help you at all, indeed. What I'll like to see as a change is that kids will be more respectful to others and more responsible with their actions. I'll like to see this school move from where the location it's at as well because it is a bad neighborhood and it's not safe to walk after school, ever since that incident with the guy who has gotten shot. This school deserves to be shut down.", 'The organization of this school is the best because I always can get staff I need during school time.', "The security system has strong responsibility on students' safety and education.", 'The after school activity did help a lot in my SAT and fashion design. I so appreciate this program is available to us.', "Parents' participation in school was good and they stayed in school to talk to teachers to know the students' education.", 'They are so kind and friendly to help me to solve every question I have and explain to me with details.', "I personally had a great experience at this school. The staff and teachers are amazing, and extremely understanding. They really want what's best for their students and they strive to help everyone achieve and pass.", 'the teachers are great and helpful but just the student are not helping the school become a better one.', 'Its a great school because no one will judge you based on what you do. the teachers are always there for you when you need help. we get to learn many new things, and work among other students and share our opinions.', "The overall experience of this school was okay. I liked the school, but I wish that they had better programs and more opportunities. The school is a good school, but I would choose a different one before going there. I wouldn't choose this school again because I feel like if I went to different school I would likely have more fun and participated in more things. I would've had a better experience.", 'its okay but i wish there was more sports', 'the teachers actually care and want students to succeed', 'this school is not bad and its not good. even though you might get discouraged sometimes by distractions and friends, you have try hard and believe in yourself that you will make it out of here with success.', 'the school administration has many policies that help students to prepare for their future and all of the staff are committed to helping students to reach their goals', "Some teachers provide you with extra help when others don't have time, extra curriculum activities are not much to choose from, some of the popular classes are only Ap English and Ap u.s history other then that not much to offer.", "There is a lot of security guards around school, there are scanners to prevent contraband , bullying can happen sometimes with new students, school nurse takes forever to assist you ,this school it's somewhat safe but not the neighbourhood", "There is no healthy options other than fruits, variety it's not something we see often but yes we do see it, there is no snacks available and some people like me are vegan and have to go to school without eating a meAl,"]
column4: ['Bronxwood is a very good school but the teachers do not teach the children the accurate information for tests and state regents.', "My experience was an odd journey in this school. However, I adored all my teachers and I'm extremely grateful to them for supporting me throughout the years. I wouldn't have had the will power to graduate without their guidance and hard work. They make the school amazing despite the difficult environment it can have sometimes. If there is anything wrong going on within the school it's not the staff, I promise it. The kids in the area are very difficult and have many behavioral issues. As a graduate of 2018, I have to say that I loved the school. Actually no, I loved the staff of the school. The students were almost intolerable and made it difficult to do anything nice in the school.", "DIDN'T REALLY LIKE THIS SCHOOL FOR MY DAUGHTER. WHEN I TRIED TO TRANSFER HER THEY KEPT PUTTING IT OFF UNTIL SHE COULDN'T.", "I don't like nothing about this school, this school is full of teachers that really don't care about any child's success. For instant, if you are failing classes they wouldn't do anything to help you. You have to stick to yourself and make a change for yourself, while other schools help you and stuff, Bronxwood Preparatory Academy doesn't help you at all, indeed. What I'll like to see as a change is that kids will be more respectful to others and more responsible with their actions. I'll like to see this school move from where the location it's at as well because it is a bad neighborhood and it's not safe to walk after school, ever since that incident with the guy who has gotten shot. This school deserves to be shut down.", 'The organization of this school is the best because I always can get staff I need during school time.', "The security system has strong responsibility on students' safety and education.", 'The after school activity did help a lot in my SAT and fashion design. column6: ["Team performance can do better, school spirit it's not good because much students don't go , fan support only come from their friends", "There not a lot of activities to join, and due to that fact some people don't get to join extracurricular activities , some options are basketball , soccer and volleyball.  Some clubs are fashion and design and SAT prep", "Some teachers give more and beyond but some just average work when they can do better, teaching style it's not advance for students to pass regents and advance, some teachers have no interest in others , communication skills are super low, and the consistency grade is average.", 'The teachers really do their job.', 'The after school activities were fun an educational.', "It's pretty average, whenever there's a home game a lot of people show up.", 'The faculty is great, the counselors are very helpful.', 'I liked my school, the after school programs were fun.', "The academic are good, the teachers really help you an they're a few AP classes such as pre-calculus and AP U.S history.", "The school itself was pretty standard. The faculty was very helpful throughout my post graduation and getting ready for college though. The school suggested a college now program, which is a program that let's you start early on your college credits and classes and it gave me an idea of what to expect in the future.", 'It could use more diversity', 'The teachers could use training a bit more and be more disciplined when it comes to the uniform policy.', 'The counselors do a very good job and help out alot.', 'The school gym and their weight room is the only good athletic part of the school since they dont have any sports field.', 'This school was very good to me and for the most part I have been able to enjoy it and this is where I also have met my girlfriend and my future wife. This is where I was able to do better in my grades and do good in the soccer team, being the captain of the campus.', 'The clubs were alright they just need to add more variety.', "It is supposed to be a uniform school but they the staff doesn't enforce it as much and espcially later on in the school year. ", "we do a lot of fire drills at my school and also drills in case there's any intruder in the building. ", 'It is the same thing almost all the time', 'All they do is walk around and do nothing']

column1: Queens Satellite High School For Opportunity

column2: ['I would like better teachers with an actual passion for teaching instead of just teaching for a paycheck.', 'My high school experience has been average up to now because my school runs differently compared to other high schools.  I wish my school received more financial support to better assist students.', "I liked the academic and social experience I've had at School For Excellence.  Socially, I prospered, I made a lot of acquaintance's, a couple of great connections and friends as well. Academically, it's so hard to focus in that environment but it made me realize that you have to want to do better for yourself not because someone told you to do so.  School For Excellence is a sink or swim environment, you either pay attention and get what you need to prosper in life or you become a super senior and become a statistic.", 'Things in that school are alright its not the best school out theee but it does whats needed the staff are kinda great yet the after school activities are a long list they dont have many things i wish i could do. High school is tough and not only bevause of school work', "I believe mostly everyone that works in this small school are trying their absolute best to educate and improve the lives of the students that attend.   However with the limited amount of resources this school has and the environment we faced made it hard to focus on learning. Going in to college I didn't feel prepared not one bit however i learned to appreciate it more. Learning felt new and great. Im not saying this school is the worst place in the world I just feel that with more money for books, programs and resources that maybe the kids attendance would have gone up and maybe we would have graduated with more students that year.", 'The school needs to work on athletic and fitness opportunities.', 'Teachers were unique in their own ways.They cared and wanted us to succeed.They really believed in us.', 'When I was in school they did not serve halal food at all.That was a big disadvantage many schools face.That really needs to change.', 'We were always reminded of the rules and policies.During the warm season,notices would go out about dress codes and policies every year', 'The work was not as hectic as other schools but their were classes that we had workloads and had study options.Sometimes I would be in school an hour earlier that way I can study before class and be able to make it to work after school.', 'I was well prepared for the real world and college because I was ready to stand on my own two feet.I learned that I should not wait on others to make things possible for me.I had to go to people for help.I had to make smart decisions for my own good.', 'I personally had a good experience because I was able to graduate within two years after my transfer from Gambia.I took advantage of opportunities both in school and outside the school.When it comes to the people I would choose this school but the quality of the courses I might not.', 'The school is surrounded by projects and many of the students are from the area.Students like myself are surrounded by people who use drugs and more on a daily basis.The school does try their best to provide safety for its students but the outside influence makes it challenging.', 'Students know that at this school the faculty are always there to help.Computers and printing was not a problem.Even though we had the opportunity to take college classes, the school could use more college prep resources.As for the bus I never had to take the school bus.', 'The amount of students who were very involved and those who were not to me were balanced.There were students who showed great effort in getting involved then their were those who did not.As for the racial diversity or religion and sexual orientation, every was accepted no matter how you looked or what your background was.Being a muslim who wears a veil over her head I have never experienced ant discrimination from my peers.', 'I think this school lacked in the amount of clubs and extracurricular opportunities. Although they tried to make things fun,the school still needs help.This would also help students want to stay in school and build their resumes.', 'We have a doctors office in our school so we can schedule appointments if needed, any check ups, anthills.', "We're in class to pass, we don't even need to learn.", "Disgusting. There are days students don't even eat lunch. The food is old and disgusting. Our school can not access the cafeteria so we get our lunch brought up to our class rooms.", 'Transportation to get to school is okay. Usually packed but you get where you need to get on time.']

column2: ["The High school did not have College Readiness classes.  In my Junior year I was told I was in the right path to Graduating on time.  That was not the case  in my Senior year,  I was missing one more Regents in order to graduate.  The certification for technology was no longer used as a regents credit ( this was decided in 2019 the year I graduated).  Some teachers were attentive others didn't care and others just didn't know how to teach.  Overall I met good friends, but it's not what I expected from a High School education.", 'Bronx Engineering & Technology Academy is a very good high school in the Bronx. The focus and shift towards technology and technical skills should be further emphasized. These disciplines should be taught during freshman year and not during the end of junior year and the whole of senior year. other than these minor gripes this is truly a school worth enrolling in.', 'At Bronx Engineering and Technology  Academy (B.E.T.A), their mission is to education students, they are able to manage this by opening opportunities for students by allowing them to go on out of state trips to colleges as well as meet real life engineers in an engineering program which benefits the students and help them decide what they would like to be in the future.', "It's an overall average experience. I like the the after school programs like robotics and year book club. Something I would like to see change is the way the principle run thing. She like to run thing more as a dictator", 'Bronx Engineering and technology academy, is a good school. This school will offer the opportunities needed to succeed and all you need to do is reach out to your teachers.', "Apart from the jokes we make about having a wack school, they're just jokes. I'm sure I'm not the only one who thinks that B.E.T.A is a pretty good school. The teacher's are nice and friendly, and B.E.T.a gives you a lot of opportunities I don't think other schools would bother to give, like substituting Spanish Regents for a CTE diploma, giving you a steadily managed schedule fee waivers for college applications and good involvement by the counselors, and insistence on helping apply for internship opportunities and college-crediting courses.", 'What I love about beta is the liveliness within the school. People treat each other with respects teachers have good skills teaching and safety is beyond great.', 'What I like about Bronx Engineering & Technology Academy is the programs they offer. some are the ACE Mentor Program, CTE Industry Scholars Program, Robotics, Computer Science, AP Honors programs and more.  What i would like to change is the architecture of Bronx Engineering & Technology Academy. add a little bit of spirit in to the walls and decorations.', 'My time in the school was ok, the good parts were the faculty and the diversity, but also some classes were useful towards the major that I pursued. What I would like to see change is more resources and also more awareness towards readiness for college and to have some experience of the field that students want to pursue.', 'I am a current senior at this school and have been here the past 4 years the atmosphere of this school is great and the teachers are always looking to help you out.', 'My experience with Bronx Engineering and Technology Academy was a pleasant one. The best part about this school was the diversity and the opportunities students are given their junior and senior year. Students are able to have paid internships. These internships allow the students to work with companies the train you for the real life work fields. Along with the internships are the classes. The classes are challenging but are offered to anyone student. There are several advanced placement classes that have several students striving for the next level education. Lastly, the sport teams and clubs offered are really helpful for the intended major students want to have in college. One thing I would like to see change is the involvement with parents and the students connecting with the school environment.', 'It was a very fun and enjoyable learning environment. Met many friends and grew with them. Activities were set to include everyone who wanted to participate. Ebcouraged closeness and teamwork.', 'What I liked about Bronx Engineering & Technology Academy is how connected a well educated student can connect easily with the teachers.Its important because it helps the students understand an assignment or to have a chat about anything just to create a better enviorment.I honestly believe that if my school does this and selects good students who urge for a education than the schools can reachs its expectations.', 'Although Bronx Engineering and Technology Academy is known to be a "bad" school with low graduation rate, it provides for it student a variety of  engineering  career options like our international robotics team for student to get involved in hands on and other ways of knowledge', 'My experience at Bronx Engineering and Tech Academy has been mixed, the students and order could be better. Also the way faculty like the dean and counselors could better when providing for the kids. On the positive side i feel like as if you would never find a place where the teachers care as much as in this high school. Even through the hard times the children give the teachers the teachers still stick through it/', 'Everyone in our school feels safe. There are no such incidents ever happened in our school, no that i am aware of.', 'After school activities are the most interesting my school. I am in the student council and senior committee. This two are the most important and entertaining in my life. The after school activities engages students to stay in school.', 'I had great experience in this school. School have provided me classes and opportunity that helped me choose my career. The clubs in my school made me discover the skill of leadership.', 'Teachers at my school always motivate students to aim high and set goals in there lives. Also teaches class in a way that students would be engaged and display interest.', "Over all I just got an education wouldn't say the best. Pretty much its not really worth going here unless you want basic education and want to take. An easy route to graduation."]

column6: ["The teachers over all really aren't good. There are only a select few that can be recognized as good teachers. Most times the teachers don't really know what they ate teaching. Often tines they do not care about the student. They have unfair grading policy. If a teacher makes a mistake the student suffers and the teacher blames them.", 'BETA is something different. be ready to see all kinds of people.', 'School provides good food, staff, clubs and athletic needs.', 'The cafeteria in my school provides a wide variety of healthy food. There is a salad bar which students can help themselves to.', 'The staff try their hardness to ensure that student are obeying the rules. If the rules are not meet to standard by the student body, consequences are given to the necessary extend.', "The athletic fraction of my school is very important to both the staff and student population. many of my piers take their athletic interest seriously. Many of the students that are involved in an athletic program are highly devoted, and don't complain about anything. Their are a huge variety of sports and opportunities to follow up a athletic persons needs.", 'Teachers in my school try their best to reach out to their students in an organized and creative manner. Many teachers give students advice for the real world once an individual has planned on graduating, which is highly appreciated from the student body.', 'The Extracurricular activities provided in this school really help the students and staff bond. Many of my colleagues and teachers have a special bond, which helps them participate in school activities more often.', 'There is a good amount of technology involved in the school, and the guidance counselors are helpful.  However, there could be more parents involved, and there seems to be a techno-phobia when it comes to the teachers.', 'There are a good amount of school teams and school facilities, and the soccer/football field is in good shape.  There are also a healthy amount of students who are involved with sports, but the school spirit is nonexistent, and rarely anyone goes to school sports.', 'There are some teachers who are really great and there are some who are really bad, but most are just okay.', 'There are starting to be more things to do after school, but it seems like the school just shuts down once class is finished, and the after school activities are not encouraged or pushed very much.', 'No one is bother by sex or cultural diversity in the school', 'I felt I was ready to go to college.', 'Loved it,teachers were really into helping students', 'Teachers were very dedicated into helping the students with school work .', 'Some use their education for good.', 'There are plenty of clubs ,but low funding.', 'The teachers at this school had the best interest in all students regardless of whether the student did bad or good. They made lessons understandable, though challenging. The help was always available. They were numerous teachers qualified to help in different subjects from what they specifically taught.', 'The safety at this school was great. Security on all floors, always walking the halls. There is an active clinic with nurses and doctors.']

There is a salad bar which students can help themselves to.', 'The staff try their hardness to ensure that student are obeying the rules. If the rules are not meet to standard by the student body, consequences are given to the necessary extend.', "The athletic fraction of my school is very important to both the staff and student population. many of my piers take their athletic interest seriously. Many of the students that are involved in an athletic program are highly devoted, and don't complain about anything. Their are a huge variety of sports and opportunities to follow up a athletic persons needs.", 'Teachers in my school try their best to reach out to their students in an organized and creative manner. Many teachers give students advice for the real world once an individual has planned on graduating, which is highly appreciated from the student body.', 'The Extracurricular activities provided in this school really help the students and staff bond. Many of my colleagues and teachers have a special bond, which helps them participate in school activities more often.', 'There is a good amount of technology involved in the school, and the guidance counselors are helpful.  However, there could be more parents involved, and there seems to be a techno-phobia when it comes to the teachers.', 'There are a good amount of school teams and school facilities, and the soccer/football field is in good shape.  There are also a healthy amount of students who are involved with sports, but the school spirit is nonexistent, and rarely anyone goes to school sports.', 'There are some teachers who are really great and there are some who are really bad, but most are just okay.', 'There are starting to be more things to do after school, but it seems like the school just shuts down once class is finished, and the after school activities are not encouraged or pushed very much.', 'No one is bother by sex or cultural diversity in the school', 'I felt I was ready to go to college.', 'Loved it,teachers were really into helping students', 'Teachers were very dedicated into helping the students with school work .', 'Some use their education for good.', 'There are plenty of clubs ,but low funding.', 'The teachers at this school had the best interest in all students regardless of whether the student did bad or good. They made lessons understandable, though challenging. The help was always available. They were numerous teachers qualified to help in different subjects from what they specifically taught.', 'The safety at this school was great. Security on all floors, always walking the halls. There is an active clinic with nurses and doctors.']

column2: ["What i like about Validus is that it is a small school and everyone knows everyone, the teachers and staff are very helpful and Validus gives out opportunities to students like after school programs, community service,sports etc.It's a good school with good classes.", 'I recently graduated from Validus and all I can say is wow. Time sure does  fly but with the encouragement of teachers and staff and the comfort of friends that will be with you forever it seemed like a breeze, although it wasn’t a some points lol. Validus is a good school and it’s not any better or any worse than any other urban public school in the Bronx. Honestly, the experience you have and what you take away when you leave with your diploma  is all up to you depending on how you carried yourself , how much work you put in and how serious you took those four years.', 'I have been at validus preparatory academy since freshman year now a senior I look back and se the good and the bad. The teachers are great supporters of students even to students who are at risk of failing. The diversity is amazing. Every year at the end of the year we hold a culture festival where diffrent cultures are represented. Through dance, music, singing, food and fashion shows. We have a program called buildOn in my school which focus on highschool students giving back to their community through community services. I was able to travel to Southern Africa this summer to build a school. By far amazing experience at validus.', 'Overall, I have had 4 wonderful years at Validus Preparatory Academy. The teachers are beautiful lovely people, who will lend you a hand when you most need it. They offer AM and PM for those who arent doing so good and need to get second chances. Also, thry offer AP classes for those that like to push themselves to do more. Everyone gets along with eachother, and its a very supportive environment.', "This school is excellent, the content taught here means to engage the minds of the students in the community and help them create strong mindsets. The content is excellent and the teachers genuinely care for their student's education and have a passion to go the extra mile to engage their students even through hardships so they can attain the best education possible.  Whereas it's academic profile is not superb, being due to its transparent admission requirements which mean to accept students from any cultural and academic background, Validus Preparatory Academy prefers to engage and aid students of the community despite their background so they can achieve success, instead than to keep an excellent academic profile by placing admission requirements and bragging of falsely  uplifting the community while doing so in a selective manner which ultimately does not uplift the community, much like schools in the area.", "This is a great high school. Each teacher is dedicated to giving students as much help they need and beyond to become successful, graduate and most importantly, make them college ready. Not only is it rigorous, it is also very much like family meaning you'll be able to fit right in with no problem while progressing academically. I loved my time there!", 'I like how pro college Validus Preparatory Academy is but our graduation rates are plummeting and it feels like there is no room for how the students express themselves, ways other than academics.', 'Validus Preparatory Academy is a school that provides a safe and caring environment to all students, parents and staff. The teachers are very committed to helping all students become college ready before graduating. Many of the teachers encourage the students to complete all important assignments in all classes and strive for a high grade. Specifically my English teacher assigns his students rigorous assignments and motivates others to have a high order thinking mind that will allow us to read and write analytically. There are multiple other teachers that motivate students to learn. Validus facilitates extra curricular activities, for example BuildOn, A non-profit organization that allows high school students to do community service and learn more about their environment and neighborhood.', 'My experience being at this small ordinary high school that provides their student the highest educational toolsTo prepare for college', 'This school has very great teacher who cares about your education sometimes even more than you. However this school can use a lot more activities and organization.', "I liked the opportunities they gave such as going to the wilderness which allowed us to find ourselves. Also a lot of programs such as BuildOn and Trek for knowledge which allows students to earn community service hours and allow students to go to countries with low resources and in poverty to build schools for children that don't have. Programs like these are great however, I wish there were more SAT preparation and wished there were better teachers to actually teach!", 'My experience at Validus Preparatory Academy has been great. I can honestly say that since my freshman year, I have grown as a person. Everyone is super supported of each other no matter what.', 'Nothing is wrong here everyone is very diverse I pretty much made friends with every race in this school.', "The school learning base here is so EASY I just don't get why I do do all of my work most of the watchers put me 0's for things I've done and I know I have handed in did a complaint but no one attended to me with this. This school is like an atheltic school if you are not in a sport you're basically a no body. I don't trust none of the teachers here I don't like any of the teachers here very little support that they have the principal he's probably the only person I like. Scheduling process the worst I took chemistry beginning year of sophomore year in Dwight morrow high school. When I got to this school they put me in earth science a class I had taken in 7th grade. US history 2 I passed that geometry wasn't given to me till junior year when I had this in DMAE sophomore year beginning basically the whole classes they give me junior year I had taken sophomore year in the beginning back in New Jersey DMAE.", "I was bullied in this school once. As far as health I don't contribute into some gym activities because I don't feel comfortable it's here and there that I would I also failed gym if you guys had a one on one with me the difference between my old school and this school is MAJOR difference. School nurse I don't know I've actually never have gotten hurt vomitted once due to half raw meat a hamburger stopped eating school lunches. Health programs I wouldn't know", "To be honest I don't do anything in this school basically because I don't like to engage myself in anything this school does no sports all I've done was go to college tour trips that are suppose red by Bronx works.", "If I had the choice I would have never chosen this school. I'm actually considering transferring", "My teachers at this school are kinda not that well trained being so that their grading policies are like more on the below average scale, since I moved from jersey I learned way more and in November of 2014 is when I started attending this high school and the way they teach is bad I if you ask me what I learned I wouldn't be sure what to say. I'm a good student and its surprising for me and my parents that my average was a 3.3 dropped to a 2.3 because of this school and it may have so be my fault a bit because I don't participate and that's what I guess counts in this school. But my rating for teachers would be 7 out of 10", "If an incident were to happen right now, all students will be told to safely go home, while the police and school safety are all over the block making sure everyone is not in harm's way.", "Although there are a lot of extracurricular activities at the school, many don't try to take advantage of it and that's what makes it okay."]

column6: ["I've grown accustomed to being with the class of 2016 and actually calling them close friends. We all have the same ambition; to succeed, so that helps us motivate each other. Also, the other grades are friendly and are going to be missed. Everything was made to happen just for 2016 and I hope everything goes well, when we leave.", 'Since the school is small, students and teachers are able to create open relationships.', 'I have had a great deal of good memories in this school. The most memorable ones are those of the bike club that had opened up during the freshman and sophomore years. My favorite topics in during my time in this particular high school were all of the sciences, all of the history courses, a few English courses thanks to the teachers that taught them, and most of my gym classes since they were fun and challenging. If I had the chance of returning to this school, I would with the only condition that I get the power to replace certain teachers for better ones.', "I have had some really great teachers, but I've also had some really bad ones. The good teachers in this school know how to engage and instruct their students properly with an ample amount of information and real world examples. While on the other hand there were a few teachers who really poorly tried to grab the students attention and failed to engage the students in the the subjects they were teaching. One of the worst memories of teachers I have in this school was during my junior year where we had a total of five different geometry teachers. Each one quit one month after the other leaving us students with a really poor foundation on the subject of geometry. Only a few students passed the geometry regents that year. Although there are some good teachers in this school, the bad ones outweighed the good.", "With in the four years I've been studying in this school its been a great  experience with great opportunity's .", 'Given that fact that my school has had a lot of mishaps when it came to hiring teachers who know their material well, and know how to control a class room efficiently, it was not the best. However, with our new principle, they are now moving forward, and are hiring better teachers, and on top of that they are now offering AP courses, which I am currently enrolled in.', "The inconstancy of the schools rules and daily requirements for students are very noticeable. For instance new rules implemented last year with a new principle are different from rules of this year and the school doesn't even notify students of these new changes. Like the uniform policy, they made new uniforms that we are now forced to wear even if for students that are sophomore, junior and seniors, upper class men now have to buy new shirts even though last year they said we can wear the old shirts. Not only are the rules unorthodox but teachers quite almost every year or if not middle of the year although they get a new teacher the new teachers are not good and can't teach a classroom that well have classes feel like middle school.", "I like and dislike this school in a way, i like this school because the teachers have a strong connection with their students. The students also have a bond with each other and they respect one another religion and culture. What I dislike about this school is not that many trip, the teacher are not good at teaching. I wouldn't choose this school again because their is no challenge going on their.", 'Things are changing for the better.', 'The staff and teachers are really good in many ways because they would help with anything. They will help you figure out a plan to overcome any obstacles.', "At my high school, there aren't a lot of clubs because students lost interest in the clubs they offer. When I was a freshman, there were dancing, cooking, chess, fashion, table tennis, tech squad, leadership and more. These programs were good to learn and adjust to the new environment.", 'There is no competition among students.', 'Every student in the school feels safe because there is no bad influence in the school.', 'The school has baseball and softball team only. Most students want to play different sport activities.', 'Healthy but the food is not much.', 'Teachers give quizzes to test students knowledge on a topic.', 'The school attendance is perfect and the school admistration is a good influence.', 'With my experience, the school could be better at choosing classes, because the process is somewhat tedious.', 'Teachers are always there to help with the college experience and they will always keep you on point with the different opportunities this school has to offer.', "People don't often get hurt, but, with my personal experience the nurse is excellent. The security is good especially because we don't need metal detectors."]

column1: High School for Teaching & the Professions
column2: ['It was very difficult fitting in at first being the tallest female there . But then I started to make friends the 2nd week of 9th grade .', 'High School for Teaching and the Professions has been such a great experience so far. The teachers treat their students like their own.  We have a special class called AVID to prepare us for college. This school also offers AP classes and many college trips.', 'The school has many faculty members who help to push students to do their best. The school also has many after school activities that students can get involved in.', 'I didn\'t like it for the start. For one, on my first day I got tricked by the security guards who were supposed to guide me to the right classrooms; they guided me to wrong rooms intentionally (given by their smirk). Furthermore, there was a cranky old lady teacher who saw me walking up to the front entrance of the school, and she was intensely angry and shut the door in front of my face. Moreover, there is a ridiculous amount of classes that are "required", such as dance... Next, the staff is overall unhelpful. When I reached out to them one day, hoping to get transferred to a different school, they said "next year I can do so". A year later, they said "it\'s too late to change schools". The only way I\'m able to sustain my sanity in this school were friends.', "The high school for Teaching & the Professions is such a great school. There are a lot of good resources to use, the college readiness classes really help you get prepared for college and the necessary steps, starting even in the 9th grade. The academics are challenging but not too hard so it's a good mix for us students. There are plenty clubs to get involved in which is a plus. If you're failing classes you always have the opportunity to make it up after school with teacher help one on one.", 'One thing I like about the school is how connected the principle is with us. There’s no confusion about who he is or where to find him ever.', "In this school child lrenbhelp one another, there a great teacher student relationship and it's a comfortable environment to be in. This school should get more clubs for its students that vary", 'I had a great time in this High School. I received a lot of help when applying to colleges. My counselor made the process easy and not stressful. There are multiple club/activities a student can join.', 'Was a lot to do, many clubs and opportunities to get involved, but you have to learn to motivate yourself.', 'I graduated June 2014 and the staff was very dedicated to my success.  They try to find incentives to encourage student to go to class and they make the students feel good about getting good grades.', 'School put students safety first.', "School lunch provide's healthy food.", 'My high school is a high quality school.', 'the is less extracurricular activity', 'not many people are involved', 'only people who are in the team are dedicated', 'a lot of workload but teachers are willing to help', 'A lot of peer pressure, certain groups hang out with each other but everyone is cool with one another', 'Not really helpful and not too many opportunities ', 'Not a lot if offered so take advantage of anything that comes your way']

column2: ['New Brunswick High School is overall a decent high school, but I would not recommend it to people. The school has staff and faculty who care about students to a certain extent, but not enough to motivate them. Teachers in particular have a tendency of giving up on students once they begin to slack off. Instead of asking the students if they need help, or if anything is wrong with them emotionally, the students are punished and reflect a poor academic performance. Other than school work, the clubs are frequently promoted and students feel compelled to join because of that.', "I like how the school isn't that big and that I can navigate around the school easily. The teachers try their hardest to keep everyone on the same level so that no one is left wondering what they are learning. The school overall is good and I would recommend many students to come here.", 'I liked being a part of the community at the high school because of all the hard work the staff and students put into making a healthy environment. Also being a part of the fine visual performing arts is amazing because of all the opportunities I was given and also the different people that I was able to meet.', 'What I tend to enjoy about New Brunswick High School is the community that is well presented as NBHS, my alumni’s tend to show their passion into school and tend to show how much of being a student at New Brunswick High School means. Without the people there would be fewer opportunities. However the change that needs to be offered is for the school to offer Spanish AP classes to those students who are very intrigued into their education and seek to want to advance their learning but in their fluent language, so overall y it is a good school with great protection but furthermore it’s surely a place you can get along with the people and advance your learning.', 'I love how diverse New Brunswick High School is, you never feel like an outsider. I love how much the teachers care about you and push you to be your best self and help unlock your greatest potential. My experience there was a great one and I hope to visit in the near future!', 'Very diverse school with a lot of opportunities. A lot of classes offered to get students prepared for life and their future career.', 'My school mostly consists of culture and people from different ethnicities . I feel like I belong here and I can connect with the people around me. I don’t feel different from anyone, there are people from different race and color, in a way we can all relate to one another.  That’s one of the things I like the most about my school. In addition, every administration is very friendly and are always looking out for every student both mentally and academically,making sure everyone is ok at all times. We have many talented people in our school and I enjoy looking at the marvelous art hall that consists of different painting, sculptures, etc. Once in a while we have people act out plays and show off their talent in the auditorium room where everyone can go watch. I enjoy coming to school and I feel safe in the environment that surrounds me.', 'Too many students not enough teachers the, teachers their are very good lot of work but good but we need better superintendence and school counselor to help students apply in to college.', 'Some teachers are easy to talk to and willing to help if you ask. There are clubs offered if students want to participate. There are enough security and cameras to keep the school safe but some students are not mature enough to avoid conflict. Overall, the school may not be the best but it is slowly getting better.', 'This high school has a poor education system; although some teachers provide us extra help sessions after school. There are also lots of violence, but the staffs try their best to prevent that with police officers and security monitors.', 'There is only opportunities if you really look for them. Personally I was able to find a lot but this was only because I really involved myself with school. I also found a group of friends who were willing to help me and be my support.', 'Teachers can\'t teach at this school. We are treated like animals because we act like animals. There\'s fights in this school every single day because security guards fail to supervise the pod\'s staircase and bathroom. Sports and club are good. If you want a decent education at this school, you must enroll in all honors because people in these classes tend to care more than the student in regular classes. We have DUAs and it takes time away from our education because we have to be taking hour long testing for what that doesn\'t cover what we learned over the semester. Staff at this school doesn\'t like students to advocate for themselves. Staff constantly say " let your parents call".', "I like how we have Advisory after blocks 1 and 2. Also, I like how there are security guards roaming the hallways and doing the best they can to watch and protect us, students.The students have no respect over their teachers but there are also a few teachers that are disrespectful towards students as well.In order to improve New Brunswick High School we need teachers that don't bully students and teachers that do not make fun of students.", 'not the safest school. Needs more safety and regulations. Students need mo disciple. Has good classes and programs being offered. Different sports to try out.', 'New Brunswick High School was an overall great experience for me due to the company of my friends. The school work was educational yet seemed to be off track since it focused more on learning the structure of standardize testing and how to be able to score well on it, instead of teaching the valuables of each subject in order for students to be able to carry out the information through their lives. The teachers were a joy to have since they were both friendly yet strict, for education purposes of course, but the administration seemed to be focused more on enforcing school rules, instead of listening to their students on an equal level. The school needs to be more flexible on the rules and dress codes in order to provide a healthier environment. Adding on to providing better school meals of course.', 'New Brunswick High School was effective in exposing students to a very diverse environment which is useful when coming into college. However, it didn’t provide enough clubs for people to get involved. There were also high expectations for us because of the fact that people look at the school as dangerous. There was also very judgemental individuals, students and faculty that I felt left a lot of people feeling as though they will never be able to succeed.', "There teachers at this school who genuinely care about their students' future beyond academics. The school is mostly filled out minorities such as Hispanic/Latino & black/African American. There are college readiness classes but the students have to go out of their way  find  out about such class themselves.", "I've been attending New Brunswick High School for three years now. If you're in honors classes, you're teacher will care for you and provide you with any resources you may need (if they have them). Taking more difficult results in a better education for any student that goes there, the regular classes have careless teachers.", 'The overall student body is very much interactive with each other as well as staff. The school is maintained and effuciently moving and progressing. The lunches could be better as well as morning procedures but within every bright side is a negative. This school has helped me graduate and grow.', 'There are a lot of opportunities at New Brunswick High School. There are many clubs to attend and after school activities. The teachers are very caring and helpful towards my education. This school showed me how to become independent and that I can do anything I put my mind too. The children are always save and me as a student and a senior i feel as such I consider myself safe in this school.']
column4: ['New Brunswick High School is overall a decent high school, but I would not recommend it to people. The school has staff and faculty who care about students to a certain extent, but not enough to motivate them. Teachers in particular have a tendency of giving up on students once they begin to slack off. Instead of asking the students if they need help, or if anything is wrong with them emotionally, the students are punished and reflect a poor academic performance. Other than school work, the clubs are frequently promoted and students feel compelled to join because of that.', "I like how the school isn't that big and that I can navigate around the school easily. The teachers try their hardest to keep everyone on the same level so that no one is left wondering what they are learning. The school overall is good and I would recommend many students to come here.", 'I liked being a part of the community at the high school because of all the hard work the staff and students put into making a healthy environment. Also being a part of the fine visual performing arts is amazing because of all the opportunities I was given and also the different people that I was able to meet.', 'What I tend to enjoy about New Brunswick High School is the community that is well presented as NBHS, my alumni’s tend to show their passion into school and tend to show how much of being a student at New Brunswick High School means. Without the people there would be fewer opportunities. However the change that needs to be offered is for the school to offer Spanish AP classes to those students who are very intrigued into their education and seek to want to advance their learning but in their fluent language, so overall y it is a good school with great protection but furthermore it’s surely a place you can get along with the people and advance your learning.', 'I love how diverse New Brunswick High School is, you never feel like an outsider. I love how much the teachers care about you and push you to be your best self and help unlock your greatest potential. My experience there was a great one and I hope to visit in the near future!', 'Very diverse school with a lot of opportunities. A lot of classes offered to get students prepared for life and their future career.', 'My school mostly consists of culture and people from different ethnicities . I feel like I belong here and I can connect with the people around me. I don’t feel different from anyone, there are people from different race and color, in a way we can all relate to one another.  That’s one of the things I like the most about my school. In addition, every administration is very friendly and are always looking out for every student both mentally and academically,making sure everyone is ok at all times. We have many talented people in our school and I enjoy looking at the marvelous art hall that consists of different painting, sculptures, etc. Once in a while we have people act out plays and show off their talent in the auditorium room where everyone can go watch. I enjoy coming to school and I feel safe in the environment that surrounds me.', 'Too many students not enough teachers the, teachers their are very good lot of work but good but we need better superintendence and school counselor to help students apply in to college.', 'Some teachers are easy to talk to and willing to help if you ask. column6: ['Honestly New Brunswick high school does give you a real world kind of experience.It shows how there are many times we you have to be on your own and use your own voice to get something done. I wish their department for working to apply to colleges/scholarships was better and that those in the department would work to get to know the students more BEFORE their senior year. But overall going to school there has given me a chance to meet a couple of diverse people; it really let me see things in a new light as i haven’t lived in a predominantly Hispanic community before.', 'We get to learn new things that people enjoy. Also, to learn what careers people want to become. For example if you want to become a cop. There are classes to take like criminal justice, intro to law, and intro to security and loss prevention. You learn the advantages and disadvantages of being a cop and the bill of rights.', 'The school had many clubs and activities students can get involved in. It was fairly good in academics.', "I transferred to New Brunswick High School my sophomore year, I was nervous because I only had very few friends and also came from a different school environment. Going to a public school that doesn't enforce uniform makes you want to fit in with others, it made me want to get the latest fashion sneakers and brand clothing. As I got older, I realized that changing myself to please others opinions on me wasn't necessary. The curriculum isn't challenging, the teachers barely care for their students. The only thing that makes the school decent is the people you let around you every school day.", 'I enjoyed the diversity within the school. The school is very modern and constantly trying to improve which is good.', 'For the most part, my experience at NBHS has been good. The teachers that I have, have been nice and excellent teachers. The students in my class were also of acceptable/tolerable behavior. The circulum was okay but there could have been more to cover that would have been beneficial and defiently the pacing is something we need to work on because sometimes we have to take things slowly for some kids.', "My school isn't the best. It's far from it, the teachers refuse to help the students, the students have no schools spirit, and no one bothers to try. Very few students care about the school and keeping it clean and making it a fun, healthy environment... Guns are allowed in the school, knives are allowed due to security not thoroughly checking bags. Teachers curse at students, Students threaten teachers, and bullying isn't taken seriously.", 'I liked how teachers are available to get help from and how students and teachers can cooperate with each other efficiently.', 'New Brunswick High School provides many clubs and sports for students for free. The teachers are good and are willing to help any student. One thing that can improve are the school lunches.', 'All i can ever talk about this school is how great this school is . All the teachers are excellent  when it comes to teaching. Most students at this school are very competitive when it comes to education .  We have a excellent sport team . Kids go to practice then go home late and yet do there homework and maintain good grades. Our school is so good that it provides us  the student with good programs.Play smart is an after school program for athletes to do there homework and provide them with opportunities like community service . This school has programs such as National Honor Society,  Future business leaders of America  , Stem a club ,  Culinary arts etc. This school  makes sure that students have a bright future .', 'I go to New Brunswick Health Sciences Technology HS, a part of NBHS. They introduce various career choices regarding health care, due to a partnership with Robert Wood Johnson.', 'What I like about New Brunswick High school is being able to share a school with a diverse culture of peers from all different races and feel safe and united. Also having the support from teachers who want to see you succeed and counselors who help assist you onto your way of college.', 'You can really tell that the teachers care about you and want you to succeed even after high school.', "There is always be help for students who need it! Whether it's programs such as Play It Smart or the teachers who provide extra help.", 'Teachers are great, care about their students . However the counselours are not helpful. I had to get college advice from another source at school', "lunches should be added, smaller classes, and student's travel time to and from class should be increased", 'Overall I can say I had a good experience. There are some teachers that really want you to succeed. There are also many resources that a student can have in everything that they are interested in.', 'I actually go to New Brunswick Health Sciences Technology High School, but my school is commonly unknown. My diploma says New Brunswick High School and I cannot receive the recognition I believe I deserve. The teachers were amazing people as well as good teachers. They honestly cared about their students. Overall the high school experience and school spirit is nonexistent, but this school surely had a learning environment.', 'New Brunswick High School is a school with many opportunities to learn. It is filled with a diversity of people, and a equal welcomeness to all students.', 'The school did the best that it could. Some of the teachers were really involve in making sure you succeed others however were not. The classes taught the minimum and some of the teachers did not even bother to teach. I was placed in all honor classes and all my teachers were focused on teaching everything in the curriculum. The AP classes however are more focused on passing the AP exam instead of actually making sure the students understand the information.']
