column2: ["This school is like any other high schools. It has a few problems like fights, uncontrollable kids, and people who are just annoying. But that's only and handful of student's. This school is preparing you for the real world, Its basically showing you that there are going to be people in you life that you don't like or can't get along with but as long as you stay focused on what you wanna do they will fail and you succeed in life. And if you can't take the hard truth ,then this school is not right for because the students and teachers will tell you like it it, brutal but honest.", 'The school is good academically. It can be much better. I started there In the bridge program July 2016 and as an official freshman September 2016.', 'I made many good friends and the teachers really push for you to get an advanced regents diploma. The ap classes are great as well. They offer many after school clubs and chances for community service as well.', "The experience at It Takes A Village Academy is something I would consider average due highly to the fact the school's resources seem limited. The faculty and staff are helpful now but previous administration weren't the best and are to blame for a lot of transcript mishaps. This school is an extended day school and that's has it's perks such since we're in school longer we take more classes which provides more credits to become available for students. We're also provided with a number of college classes to gain college credits. The downfall of my school would be it's curriculum.  I personally believe an extended day school should provide classes that encourages creativity and problem solving skills rather than the typical math, science, English, and history. Student life here is a basket of god apples but also bruised, if you stay true to yourself and don't follow the wrong crowd you should be fine.", 'It was a good high school - if you know what you go to school for. Otherwise it can be a big distraction with the students, teachers and constant shenanigans that go on in that school.', 'This school greatly prepared me for college and proved a variety of sports to chose from. The majority of teachers are great. There is always a chance to work with teachers. The sports provided me with a new family that I could look up to.', 'I liked it takes a village academy even though I was able to make good friends at that school. And I was able to entertain myself with all the fun activities. All schools have their downsides but however I was able to learn and pick up the thing they teacher tought to us quickly. I am really grateful for the school and all the opportunities the have given me to learn how to treat others. I also learned who  i am too', 'Im now a Senior at It Takes A Village Academy. Over the years it has been an okay experience. I give my school four stars because i feel our graduation rate is above other schools which is great. Also, most students feel as a family after their first year in the school which is necessary and helpful for a lot of our students. My school also has a variety of activities even swimming and robotics. My biggest con of It Takes A Village Academy is that phones are taken at scanning meaning that we are not able to keep our phones with us during the day. As a student i dont like the idea of the school having my phone but it keeps the distraction away.', 'I’ve been going to It Takes a village academy since 10th grade and I can honestly say that I’ve enjoyed every bit of it since . ITAVA brought a lot of different customs and new experiences to me as a student and a person . Teachers have unique ways of teaching which all always us to learn on the same pace so no child is left behind . Attending ITAVA I’ve been college ready since 11th grade and on the track to graduate since 10th . With their extra curricular activities and their wonderful sports clubs I didn’t mind staying in school until 4:15 every day . But I will say it was a relief once I got to 12th grade and began early dismissal. Over ITAVA has been a great experience. Even with the shift of principals we still managed to stay on track and stick together no matter what came our way .', 'Great Leadership - Ms. Vinitskaya is an excellent principal! She created a program where all students can get college credits for free, AP, SAT prep are free. Graduation rate is 90%. There 25 clubs at school and 30 sport teams.', "My overall experience was pretty good with It takes a village academy. It takes a village academy offers many classes. For example, you can take classes like college prep chemistry and pre calculus. It Takes A Village Academy gets you ready for college. Teachers are stern and treat class like a college class. It Takes A Village Academy also offer programs like robotics which many other schools don't have. At this school after school help is also offered. If you do not understand the work that is taught in class, teachers will help you after school.", 'I would like to see more investment put into our school for the things that we need and I would like for the students to have more of a voice', 'This school is a very plain school i have nothing to really complain about my school. i can easily understand the subjects except math. the teachers are normal teachers who just do their jobs. they help us with college. however it is hard to find clubs that fit my schedule. food is cheap like all the other food in NYC', 'This school is horrible! The faculty at this school are extremely rude , this school is not a safe environment for any student.', 'It Takes a Village Academy seriously prepares you for college. We have great clubs and good sports as well. Some of the policies need to be changed.', 'The only thing I liked about this college was they offered the students some college class. However, I would like to change how the school forces seniors to take electives and class that were not needed when they had more credits than needed to graduate and gave us free periods and did not force the seniors to stay in school until 2:30 pm and 3:20 pm', 'My experience at It takes a village Academy has been very good, I learned a variety of knowledge that will be a tool for me to use wherever I go. The teachers at It takes a village Academy are very caring and understanding they will help you adapt to the school and they will be a supporter when needed. There are amazing Sports at It takes a Village Academy and there are also clubs and activities that will you learn new tools and tactics that will always be useful no matter where you go.', 'This is a great school they provide useful resources for their student. In It takes a Village Academy they teach student to be respectful and well manner. They also challenge student knowledge. The school has amazing skills for both reading and writing. So far in this school i have experience how to read and write all over the text. I learn how to answer multiple choice question. I also learned how to write a well developed essay.', "HelloIt takes a village academy is a great high school that I would be proud to say that I love it very much teacher's\u200b are always there to help in any way there can and there are always in activity to keep student entertaining in school as much as they can . The club  activity are swimming, volleyball, soccer, basketball, flagged football, baseball,track and field, music.those are all the activities that it takes a village academy have to offer.", 'It Takes A Village Academy is located in Brooklyn New York not to far from Ralph avenue, it is a quiet neighborhood  which creates a sort safety for the Students. I was accepted to that school one year ago when first came in the United States.  The school has basketball, football, soccer, pool,  volleyball, and track. Certainly in the school there is a lot of athletes.  Our form of education is impressive because as your in high school the school gives you the opportunity to take college classes. In Fact the school give you a good environment to learn . Though it is a good school discrimination can be a big issue in the school because there is multiple nation in the school therefore that create a big tension sometimes in the school.  Despite the downfall of the school i believe it is a great school that somebody should go to and have a wonderful experience just like me.']

It Takes A Village Academy also offer programs like robotics which many other schools don't have. At this school after school help is also offered. If you do not understand the work that is taught in class, teachers will help you after school.", 'I would like to see more investment put into our school for the things that we need and I would like for the students to have more of a voice', 'This school is a very plain school i have nothing to really complain about my school. i can easily understand the subjects except math. the teachers are normal teachers who just do their jobs. they help us with college. however it is hard to find clubs that fit my schedule. food is cheap like all the other food in NYC', 'This school is horrible! The faculty at this school are extremely rude , this school is not a safe environment for any student.', 'It Takes a Village Academy seriously prepares you for college. We have great clubs and good sports as well. Some of the policies need to be changed.', 'The only thing I liked about this college was they offered the students some college class. However, I would like to change how the school forces seniors to take electives and class that were not needed when they had more credits than needed to graduate and gave us free periods and did not force the seniors to stay in school until 2:30 pm and 3:20 pm', 'My experience at It takes a village Academy has been very good, I learned a variety of knowledge that will be a tool for me to use wherever I go. The teachers at It takes a village Academy are very caring and understanding they will help you adapt to the school and they will be a supporter when needed. There are amazing Sports at It takes a Village Academy and there are also clubs and activities that will you learn new tools and tactics that will always be useful no matter where you go.', 'This is a great school they provide useful resources for their student. In It takes a Village Academy they teach student to be respectful and well manner. They also challenge student knowledge. The school has amazing skills for both reading and writing. So far in this school i have experience how to read and write all over the text. I learn how to answer multiple choice question. I also learned how to write a well developed essay.', "HelloIt takes a village academy is a great high school that I would be proud to say that I love it very much teacher's\u200b are always there to help in any way there can and there are always in activity to keep student entertaining in school as much as they can . The club  activity are swimming, volleyball, soccer, basketball, flagged football, baseball,track and field, music.those are all the activities that it takes a village academy have to offer.", 'It Takes A Village Academy is located in Brooklyn New York not to far from Ralph avenue, it is a quiet neighborhood  which creates a sort safety for the Students. I was accepted to that school one year ago when first came in the United States.  The school has basketball, football, soccer, pool,  volleyball, and track. Certainly in the school there is a lot of athletes.  Our form of education is impressive because as your in high school the school gives you the opportunity to take college classes. In Fact the school give you a good environment to learn . Though it is a good school discrimination can be a big issue in the school because there is multiple nation in the school therefore that create a big tension sometimes in the school.  Despite the downfall of the school i believe it is a great school that somebody should go to and have a wonderful experience just like me.']

column1: Edward A. Reynolds West Side High School
column2: ['I love that they allow me to express myself and when I got surgery  they helped me do my homework from home. The people come from different places and are different in general I learn a lot by hearing them speak and talking to them .', 'it was amazing to be part of that school', 'They are very much involved. From registration to graduation. They help a lot.', 'The teachers makes it very comfortable environment to learn. I appreciate every effort from their part.', 'they were amazing. they try to help any way possible.', 'i love this school. the students treat each other as family. its great place of learning']

['Well, i was able to successfully walk through the right path with the help of my  assistant principal,Mr Ettiene and some other teachers like Mr. pellew, Ms. Lucas, Ms. Houge, Mr. Pintro and a couple of others.', 'I love that the teachers are eager to help you learn. They teach us how to get answers using the information from the question rather than just telling us the answers. They are overall friendly and are always ready to help. I also like that there are competition amongst the students as we are always striving to be the best.', 'The teachers are very nice and helpful. They strive for our success and have high expectations from the students. Everybody feels comfartable and interact with each other very fast and easy. The assistant principle is very caring and disciplined.', 'very cool place and awesome teachers and staff', "It wasn't that great however, it wasn't that good either", 'Not that bad however, they need to have more equipment or government fund so they are new and useable.', 'Most of them are very helpful and very engaging. Motivates you to do things beyond your thresholds (ex. they motivated me to graduate early) Teachers try their best to provide student will all the support for their ideas and easily approachable.', 'Great team and very helpful people. You just need to know what you are passionate about, team coach and members will motivate you.', 'I had a great experience and as a student and a president of class of 2014 I would recommend it to others. My teachers helped me to be confident and to be adventurous. I would say great environment, there are very helpful and kind people.', 'This high school provides different means for helping one apply to college. My guidance counselors initially help us out with the whole process,and is always available whenever we need help, no matter how busy she is. She also recommends us to another outside organization that can help us apply to college and help us pay for the application fee.', 'We have had a few minor fires,which where set by students, which causes us to evacuate the building. The security in my school is very tight. We have scanners and cameras in my school.', 'The social scene is very diverse. My school has progressed a lot over the last 4 years. Their are more students clubs and teams available. The violence has dimmed tremendously. Most of the gang members have graduated,which reduces the peer pressure.', 'The extracurricular activities are not that many in my school. My school offers robotics club, food club, book club, recycling club. The robotics club is the most interesting club I believe. The mentors work with students to build a robot that has a specific function,and then we a annual competition in which we compete with schools from around the world.']

['The teachers and staff here really care about the students and helps them in any way they can for you to meet your goals.', 'Orange High School is an okay school. I wish there were more resources provided. And the school is not very diverse. The food is not my favorite. Sport teams are okay, there not the best in the division. I am far from college readiness, the academics could be better.', 'Orange High School is very fun because of the friends you make in the school.Also the teachers are very friendly to me, and they gave  me the chance to make up work. The sports team is very good due to having great teammates and coaching staff  which was really important to me and the guys.I wish highschool would never end.', 'Orange High School is an Okay School at best. Occasionally you will get some good teachers, but they eventually leave because the find better and are treated much better.', 'The school should add more science classes. They should add their number of AP Classes. They should add AP Chemistry, Biology, and Physics. They Can also add to their variety of sports such as tennis.  They are great in certain sports such as dance, volleyball and softball. Some teachers are helpful and some are not. The', 'Orange High School overall is an okay high school. I wished they worked on the building because some rooms looks bad compared to other high schools. There are few a teachers that are great at teaching and engages students on their class. While other teachers that need to work on their teaching and keep class interesting.', "I personally did not like going to Orange High School and I did not really want to go there. Unfortunately, you can only go to the high school within you district, therefore I was forced to go to that school. My experience in that school was terrible. I was bullied in school by another student who once was my friend. That particular student was of African descent and was new to the school. I befriended her so that she would not be lonely, but she later turned on me. I guess she felt that I would be an easy target for her. I would not personally recommend that school to anyone. But of course if you live in that district and your parents can't afford to pay to put you in a private school for 4 years then you are stuck going there! Education was average and I felt like I was not properly prepared for college upon graduation.", 'Orange High School is very family oriented .There’s always someone willing to help and offer oppurtunitoes . However, the violence going around in my city and the college readiness level could be better.', 'I met some of my closest friends at Orange High School and the best people I could have asked to be in my life. It is a fairly small school so athletics are minimal, but I tried to take advantage of what I could do. AP and honors classes are also minimal so there are not as many opportunities to challenge yourself in a diverse set of fields as there are in other larger high schools. The staff is very attentive and care about the students. The safety is fairly average and the lunch is average as well.', 'I’ve been going to OHS since the 10th grade. It’s honestly not as bad as people say it is. You really have to get to know your teachers and administrators to get first dibs at upcoming opportunities. One thing I would like to change is the dedication of the students.', 'My experience so far in Orange High School is pretty great. They give you the resources to be prepare yourself for the world out there. They get you prepared for college. The teachers encourage students with their academics and help them reach their goals. They are encouraging of diversity, parents involvement, and the safety of the students.', 'It’s a very good school, the teachers there are very helpful and supportive. The prinicpals are also looking out for the students pushing them to be the best. The only downside are the students as like any typical highschool have a few share that are willing to be the one kid who doesn’t care about anything', "Orange high is a really good school but it could've been better but of course students they tried everything they could to mess it up. I like really the programs offered there and the recognition provided when doing good in shcool.  The one thing I would love change about it is the students for them to stop fighting and be all about school rather than always fighting.", 'At orange high school you a babied. They treat the students like infants we have no freedom, because they choose to baby us we are not prepared for the College world', 'The orange school district is prideful, progressive and is always seeking recommendations to advance education for each an every student every day.', "Orange High School offers students a variety of programs that'd appeal to individuals interests. Programs like  RWC, Seeds, and TAP; confronts students to real-world problems faced in society.  Orange High School also provides students the opportunity to work and communicate with kids with a diverse background. One thing I wish to see change in Orange High School maintenance within classrooms, since the school is fairly old. Orange High School was built in 1869, and it hasn't made any adjustments since. I wish to see Orange High School more modernized.", 'My overall experience was good. Orange has a very good arts program. I met my mentor there (Mr. Milmes). He inspired me to follow my dreams of becoming a musician. As a result, I was accepted to one of the top Music school (Berklee College of Music).', 'I will never forget Orange High School because that chapter of my life brought me both joy and pain. It is not the best school but the people who attend are so lively and have character which brightens the school.', 'I like this school with academically. I would like to see more change with this school club sports and academically capacity.', 'I have had a positive learning experience at Orange High School.  The staff has been very helpful.  I currently play volleyball and I have had a great time with the students and the staff.']

I would like to see more change with this school club sports and academically capacity.', 'I have had a positive learning experience at Orange High School.  The staff has been very helpful.  I currently play volleyball and I have had a great time with the students and the staff.']
column6: ['I love my school. The teachers and administrators care about us and want us to succeed. They go above and beyond to provide us with the skills we will need in life. The only bad thing about Orange Highschool is the location. The neighborhood isn’t the best and the crime rate is very high.', 'I have learn and improve through what ave experience in Orange High School and also the people there such as teachers and administrators have helped me grown and step towards my goal and i would like anybody who have attempted or will be attempting to have the same experience. Not much changes is needed from my experience but a a bit more restrictions, regulations and rules.', "my experiences in orange high were different.At first, I didn't know where my classes were, but now its pretty easy once you know your way around.We are pretty good in sports, but I wish our academics was better. the programs we have are fun, I've joined at least 5. Overall I think Orange High is ok they just need to work on some certain areas.", "I like Orange high school  for its diversity. It has more resources available for the students. But it's safety issues is the difficult thing of all because the community is surrounded by gang violence , is hard to go to school and feel at the same time. It's sometimes scary but we get through it and overcome as a community.", "Orange High School doesn't just teach you about everything it teaches you how to get ready for life. They help with everything and anything you need.", 'I love Orange High. The honors and AP classes are very rigorous and the teachers are very helpful. The school seems to care more about sports at times however the administration puts in a lot of work to make sure their students go off to college on the right foot.', 'Orange High School is like every school with its bullies and crowded hallways.  Its in an under privileged community and violence everywhere. But the school was a haven where education is encouraged and thanks to that I graduated and succeeded.', 'All the teachers and Staffs members are really nice & I would like to thank all of them for their hard work :)', "Despite the fact that Orange is a small town and has financial problems, the principal and staff work very hard to provide the students with a fun learning experience and I'm very happy to be graduating in June 2017. My favorite thing is that the principal engages with the students and doesn't mind to meet with us to talk about what we need to improve as a student body. There are a lot of programs and extracurricular activities for everyone to take part of and assistance with academic or personal issues.", "I liked how the administration overall cared for everyone to be successful. They all cared for one another and would always push us to do better for colleges can take a good look on the students. The only thing I didn't like is most of the students still don't take that in consideration.", 'I liked the multiple extra-curricular activities. However, I did not enjoy when selecting classes there was such a small class size for the most fun choices.', 'Being an orange high student has made a bigger difference in my life than any other person have. Orange high has shaped me into a better student and a wonderful senior. What I like best about my school is that no student is left behind. Orange high staff and students are a big family. We as students are encouraged to participate in school activities, such as sports and music. My teachers play a significant role in my life. When students go to those teachers, we are told everything being done is out of love and to prepare us for college and the next chapter in our life after graduation.', "I wouldn't recommend Orange high school for the fact that nobody's really helpful , you ask people for advice and they'll tell you to look it up instead of sitting down with you and going thru the process of your difficulties with you. The school is good when it comes to sports they'll go out their way for that And they'll go out their way to stop a fight or argument. Everybody could easily  knows their way around the school.", "I attend Orange High School in Orange NJ. This school isn't the worst school or the best. It had its pros and cons just like every other high school. It has a lot of extra curriculum activities for the students who attend this high school. The football and basketball games are very complex and interesting we have a lot of support from family and friends. Everyone in this school has their own set of friends or separate groups they hang out with such as cheerleaders with cheerleaders, football players with football players, basketball players with basketball players and so on, but I love this school. This high school gave me a great experience.", "i believe this school could be better, this way teachers teach isn't the best, the faculty is bad. I'm Happy I'm  graduating, im so tired of this school", 'Orange High School is honestly Under appreciated. The city of Orange has bad stereotypical views but the High School gets their students prepared for college. They take pride and try their best to educate students with the funds that they have. If I could change one thing it would be the parental involvement. Although it is progressing it is not happening fast enough. The strive and motivation for an education begins in the household.', 'Because Irange High School holds a lot of minorities, there are many opportunities there. There are many clubs and free SAT Prep. There are many AP classes as well. I would like to see more trips, being that I usually only go on one.', "My 2 year experience in Orange High School was a little rough at first. I thought because it was so many distractions going on, I wouldn't make it out. I found myself hanging around the wrong crowd until a light finally came on, telling me to get myself together. I then joined the volleyball team and I had team mates who were helping me academic wise. The principals their selves were great speakers and wanted the best for their students. They motivated me to push harder but it's up to the other students to make it happen. Changes I would love to see in Orange High School is at least one student wanting to make peace around the school environment or someone to step up and tell others that Education is important, Education is key.", 'Orange high overall is a great school to go to. What I like about it is that all the students are involved in the school either playing a sport or being in a club. What I would like to see change is that it would be better if we had more college courses classes.', "Orange High School is essentially a typical urban high school: they're not going to be able to compete with top schools, they don't have the resources, teachers are underpaid and we can see it in their performance. The school is okay."]
column8: ['What experience at Orange high school was great. I met a lot of great teachers who help a lot. The school does not have much of elective but it has the main elective like Music,Art and computer.At Orange High school I made lot of greats friends. the school is getting better every year. the teachers at the school are really helpful when it come to helping students  get into college. the Administrator at the school are the best. they are always having meeting with the kids to help them out. the school is pretty much a safe school.', "I enjoyed my school very much. The teacher's helped me every step of the way.", 'A lot of shootings going on in Orange, NJ but the school does a decent job of keeping everyone in it safe.', "Extracurriculars are always going on so it's prominent but not a lot of variety.", "Education part of it was okay there were obviously some things I could've done better throughout the years but I've been trying my best. I don't like the school but at the end of the day its what you make of it.", 'There are teachers at Orange High School that word hard everyday and vastly underpaid/respected by kids but then there are straight up bad teachers that need to find another career.', "There are no concern for student safety to a certain extend, there is no system for controlling bullying, and the 'safety measure' such as security and use of force is excessive.", 'There were a handful of extracurriculars but there were so many students and not even funding to make a noteworthy experience.', "My overall experience was bad at this High school. There weren't many clubs to choose from and the quality of education was bad being that the funding was terrible. Some teachers made the experience a little brighter but overall it was terrible.", 'The teachers pick and choose who to help and make it somewhat difficult to give help when needed. Certain teachers will ignore struggling students and pretend to care.', "Unsure about  safety measures and police and safety services. There is a nurse but their hours are unclear and they are not help in case of personal emergency. Even though the school has security guards and metal detectors the guards don't check the bags well enough to make sure that there are no hazardous weapons in case there is an unknown argument between students.", 'There are many activities going on all year round, even at the beginning of the summer and at the end. Students are very committed to clubs that best suit them. Administrators also show immense excitement for the clubs just as much as the students.', "This school has its up's and down's but now if I wasn't in an academic program called NJ SEEDS then I would have asked  to move since year 10. To me the curriculum every year is the same, especially in regular English class. Orange high school does not talk about college readiness until it's to late for some students.", 'The diversity within the school allows students to explore other cultures.', "If the school was completely safe, then there would not be so many doors which students can sneak out of. There also wouldn't be so many fights. The nurse's office is also not the best. Students go there just to skip class.", 'The extracurricular activities are honestly the one thing that keeps many students in school in the first place. It is what keeps them motivated. Even though more funding should be given towards these activities, they do a great job with the little funding they have.', 'The one thing I miss about this school was the students. They were great people to be around; well my friends anyway. I disliked the fact that not many educational services were available to the students which is why I struggle in college now. The school could also have been a little more rigorous, education wise.', "It is not that the teachers themselves are bad but they do not get to teach the class that they actually want to teach most of the time. So they end up not being as knowledgeable in the subject they are teaching because it isn't what they are used to.", 'At this school there have been some milestones, I like appreciate the teachers and the education that they have provided for me, sometimes the environment of the school can be quite dysfunctional but overall the school is decent. I suggest that the school can improve on keeping the school safe.', 'The teachers at my school are decent, they stay after school to help with the students who are falling behind and give them guidance to make sure they perform well in their class. During class time the teachers engage with the students so the students can have a better understanding on what they are learning.']

column1: Bronx Career & College Preparatory High School
column2: ['In BCCPREP i had a lot of fun and a great academic year. This school gave me the opportunity to go to Syracuse summer college program and that was a wonderful experience. I would like to see a change in extracurricular activities, they could add more sports and clubs. The overall staff in that school are very welcoming and understanding, barely any students fight inside the school and we have a great diversity in personalities. We have the anime lovers, the very smart ones, the sporty ones and the ones who love makeovers. This is a great school to come to and find who you are as a person.', 'What I love about it was how dedicated and helpful each teachers & staffs were. I don’t believe anyone finish that school and could say no-one was there for them. In my opinion each teacher or counselor went the extra mile to ensure that their students are on the right path and will graduate when they’re supposed to, but the students have to do their part. Furthermore, it Did not matter if it was college or vocational I believe that every student was given the resources and help to ensure that they get there. This school is exceptional on college readiness. For those reasons I think it’s great.', "my high school experience  here has been good. I been here for 2 years and within the  two years I've had a lot of attention. A lot of great opportunities have came my way and I've had a chance to be in a very powerful role in helping theirs adjust to the school.", 'I had graduate from Bronx Career and College Preparatory High School in 2013, which I graduated as Salutatorian. My experience was amazing. I recommend many students to attend the school because it obtain a great environment and every teacher care about the students academics. I plan to go back as a History teacher and still maintain the same mission. The school had offer many opportunities to students and taught us how to achieve as young adults. The school has offered college courses, various internship programs to help students to declared a career path and gain work experience, and also counseling was offer to all students. The school was an open door policy which many students took advantage because teachers were willing to offer tutoring. The entire student class will organized a Thanksgiving party for our teachers to show our appreciation for the school year. I really hope this school will be known throughout New York City because this school goes way beyond the stars.', 'The staff  is great,they get involved witb students and make sure that everyone is on the right track. Although I would like to see the inclusion of more sports team', 'My experience is my high school will always be unforgettable. I began the school as an opening new school. In the beginning, many things were unorganized and we were particularly test  Guinea pigs but overall, things can in order and ran smoothly. My senior year was the best year for me. This school prepared me with real college work and having a mentally preparation.', 'I like that the Teachers are always looking out for the students they make sure every student is Good in school and outside of school.', 'My experience in this school is that its a competitive school which all students are ell determined towards their academic success. Also what I like about this school is that it has a high teacher to student ratio in which a teacher could spare mostly out of his or her free time to assist the students during after school programs and also have different cultures coming together celebrate our roots . The thing i want this school to change is most the violence between students, i will be glad if that changes ensuring more school safety around the premises', 'In my school I feel safe, students usually get along with each other. I feel the teachers and counselors are available to help and clear up any misunderstanding with other students or with our classes.']

column1: High School for Service & Learning at Erasmus
column2: ['The High School for Service and Learning offers a wide variety of academic opportunities as well as a safe ground for students and administrators. As a senior who has been attending the campus for an ongoing 4 years, I am so happy that I have decided to attend this school. I am an honor roll student as well as a participant in numerous clubs and sports clubs. The teachers here are so loving and caring for the students. There is nothing that motivates me more than having people push me to succeed because they believe in me. There was never a time where I felt that I could not communicate with anyone when it pertained to my mental health and my grades. A school that has a great support team makes it easier to come to school ready to learn. All you need is an extra push.', 'Hssl is a really good school with professional teachers and adequate facility i joined the school in 10th grade and have been there ever since they also offer college classes, Ap 2classes also and i feel really comfortable there', 'What I like about my school is that there is a lot of resources available that will help you pass a class or test.What I would like to see change in my school is the cleanliness of it,the violence,the environment, and teaching methods.', "Teachers are amazing and always find ways to keep their students on tasks.The food is not the best one can get, therefore you can see them try their best to ameliorate the quality. One of the biggest issue one might pinpoint at HSSL might be the lack of safety, however, security do their best to assure students' protection.", 'I really liked the teachers because they believed in me when no one else did. The whole Erasmus hall campus was split into 5 different  schools but we were actively communicating with every one in each school. I played basketball for the school so I became friends with people from different schools. The teachers and the guidance counselor really care about your succes in the future.', "I really liked the teachers there. When I first got in the United States, I didn't speak English, but with the help of encouraging and caring teachers, I was able to overcome this barrier. Now, I am fluent in English and learning Spanish. But one thing that made me liked the school more is the Advanced Placement courses. While being in school, students are able to take college courses in a real  college setting. I will say that the school is becoming better every year.", 'At the time when I went to Erasmus I like that my teachers were caring and prepped me for college. What I want to change is safety of the school. When I went to the school it wasn’t as safe.', 'My experience at this High School was exceptional, but there are some concerns I have for this school. First, the classes offered were above average in terms of college readiness. My teachers were friendly to me. I often assisted my teachers and stayed after school to help them send some paperwork to the main office. The problem I have with Erasmus is the school culture; because fighting was encouraged among the students. I myself was involved in a fight. I think the safety of the school should be evaluated by the department so that some procedures can be implemented for better student safety.', 'The school itself is amazing but the sports, academics, is horrible the teachers are lacking motivation and enthusiasm in their classes,', "The school offers great opportunities for students and their always on your case to make sure that your on track. It's not hard to graduate from here you just can't be distracted. Other than that, the school needs to be cleaner.", 'I met my closet friends there. It is a lot of fun. We have plenty of sports such as volleyball, football, track, swimming, etc. You name it! The teachers are the best my grades are always high. They even offer afterschool help.', 'Some of the teachers are assholes', 'Not a huge varity, very underfunded school.', "Teachers didn't care or didn't understand.", 'Every kid is eager to be involved of course.', "Parents are supposed to go hard on the kids. They want to make sure that their future is looking the way it's supposed to.", 'They make sure that every student count and understand each lesson beeing taught. Basically, no one is left behind.', "My experience in this school was both good and bad, and it taught me many important lessons about life. As any freshman entering high school it was one of the most nerve wrecking experiences of my life. The elementary school and middle school that i attented were both only a few blocks away from my home so i grew up going to school with a lot of the same people i was ajusted well to the environment and i felt comfortable in these schools. But high school changed everything i was going to a attend a school that was fourty minutes away from my home. It was my first time traveling alone on public transportation to attend a school where I knew nobody. Soon i adjusted to the environment and reacted to this experience optimistic as possible i soon made friends and lost some. In this school i felt myself maturing. I learned that it was okay to have different ideas from others and i also learned to become independent and to not let anyone make decisions for me. I learned if i wanted to succed i needed to work hard, because nothing was going to be handed to me. This school was good because the teachers put the students to work hard and gave everyone a wake up call that they needed to work hard . This school also had negatives, because it tempted you to do what you weren't supposed to and follow the wrong crowd. This school was cery unique because it got rid of stereotypes, because of the not very pleasant neighborhood many people would assume that everybody in my school would be trouble makers and drop outs, but in fact this school carries very intelligent students i was astonished at all the new things i was learning from my fellow classmates i was introduced to new music new foods and got more insight on their cultures. Also this school was unique because all teachers had close relationships with their students and they tried very hard to get everyone on track, students were always eager to help our teachers when help was needed and every one had inside jokes.", "i thought it was pretty fine for me because i make the best of it, i focus only on school assignments and never mingle with anyone i don't know in the school or want to know them either. I was more of a quite but smart girl. as soon as i start getting into my second and third year in the school, things were changing, for example diversity, and the bad apples were leaving the school.", 'There are a variety meals to choose from. Everyday, the cafeteria provides us with different meals and gives us a list ahead of time about what they are going to prepare for the week.']
column4: ['The High School for Service and Learning offers a wide variety of academic opportunities as well as a safe ground for students and administrators. As a senior who has been attending the campus for an ongoing 4 years, I am so happy that I have decided to attend this school. I am an honor roll student as well as a participant in numerous clubs and sports clubs. The teachers here are so loving and caring for the students. There is nothing that motivates me more than having people push me to succeed because they believe in me. There was never a time where I felt that I could not communicate with anyone when it pertained to my mental health and my grades. A school that has a great support team makes it easier to come to school ready to learn. All you need is an extra push.', 'Hssl is a really good school with professional teachers and adequate facility i joined the school in 10th grade and have been there ever since they also offer college classes, Ap 2classes also and i feel really comfortable there', 'What I like about my school is that there is a lot of resources available that will help you pass a class or test.What I would like to see change in my school is the cleanliness of it,the violence,the environment, and teaching methods.', "Teachers are amazing and always find ways to keep their students on tasks.The food is not the best one can get, therefore you can see them try their best to ameliorate the quality. One of the biggest issue one might pinpoint at HSSL might be the lack of safety, however, security do their best to assure students' protection.", 'I really liked the teachers because they believed in me when no one else did. The whole Erasmus hall campus was split into 5 different  schools but we were actively communicating with every one in each school. I played basketball for the school so I became friends with people from different schools. The teachers and the guidance counselor really care about your succes in the future.', "I really liked the teachers there. When I first got in the United States, I didn't speak English, but with the help of encouraging and caring teachers, I was able to overcome this barrier. Now, I am fluent in English and learning Spanish. But one thing that made me liked the school more is the Advanced Placement courses. While being in school, students are able to take college courses in a real  college setting. I will say that the school is becoming better every year.", 'At the time when I went to Erasmus I like that my teachers were caring and prepped me for college. column6: ["my overall experience of this school is great. i enjoyed the staff, the security guards and the teachers. the school have a very competitive spirit when it comes to sports and this will make students that's interested in any type of sport work harder. the free clinic was a great thing to have in the school. overall its a great school to go to.", "i didn't eat much in the school but every time o would go to get a meal it was good i always liked the fruits options and was tried my best to get more than one when possible.", 'the school have rules to many that is just like many other high schools and the teachers and staff makes sure that the students follow the rules.', 'many students attending the school is attracted to some type of sports and do their best at it. for that purpose many of the school sports are some of the best in the state. the programs in the school is more than excellent because the coaches become like a close friend who makes you work hard to better yourself.', 'teachers in the school help the kids out of class,  friendly and are approachable. they are devoted to their work and do a great job of it. their are some work that i come across in college that i automatically remember the examples that my old teacher gave me in school.', 'i was in a club in the school while i attended name TTC (Teens Take the City). This club was basically based on helping our community and finding things that can be changed and go to city hall to propose our ideas that can make the community a better environment. some after school programs was to help students study for regents. others were the sports like basketball, soccer team, track, wrestling, baseball and and swimming teams.', 'its a great school to attend because of the many good opportunities like the imentor program that was in their. Also the teachers really try to help the students pass.', 'The school nurse makes sure to keep this between the patient and her/his self. Safety agents are always around.', 'We had a great college advisor that helped us out and our counselors were always there if we needed a question. Many parents were always at PTA meetings and a couple joined the School Leadership team to get involved.', 'When I attended this school, nobody had an issue with being an outcast because of their culture. Our school consisted of many people from different cultures and it was very easy to get along with each other.', 'I mean sometimes I used to think the suspensions given to students were ridiculous but then I realized that the deans give it out for the safety of other children. They are very big on safety and following school rules.', 'The football team is awesome! There are so many sports to get involved in and if you dont know how to play the sport, the coaches are willing to teach you and work with you.', "There was a lot of clubs, for example Teens Take the City, SLT and the leadership team. There's definitely a lot of sports to take part in and it's very exciting.", 'I loved, loved all of my teachers throughout my high school years! They were so motivating and kind and they cared so much about the students and put their efforts into the students who wanted to succeed. They were like mothers and fathers who showed tough love and kept us in reality. If we ever needed to personally talk to them about our grades, they were welcoming and willing to help us boost it up if it was low. Their teaching styles were phenomenal and easy to learn from. I really enjoyed my teachers and I am happy I was able to be their student.', 'High school for service and learning is filled with teachers and faculty staff who educate their students about college life daily. They truly helped me become the person I am and I am truly thankful for them. I do not regret attending Erasmus Hall High school. After graduation, I felt very prepared for college. Our college advisor, Mrs. Stern, was extremely helpful and was there for us every step of the way. Because of her dedication, everyone in my graduating class was able to attend the college that they were interested in.', "Overall, so far I have had great experiences in my school minus the drama that some females may bring. Coming into Erasmus I can say that i was very young minded and immature but from all the experiences that I have gained being here I can say that I have blossomed into a smart, strong minded, mature young woman who is ready to take on the world! My favorite experience was when our football team made it to the championship and played against Tottenvill High school at Yankee Stadium and WON! My school is unique because the students are unique. E-hall wouldn't be E-hall without the students. We are one of the most talked about schools in Brooklyn. If I had a choice to come back I surly would because it changed me for the better.", 'The teachers listen to the ideas and oppinions of the students and try their best to plan and create activities outside of the school, ex. trips', 'More of a Caribbean feel than anything. There are few kids from the east asian', 'I dont eat the school food or even attend lunch in my 4 years of being there', 'There is a school clinic located in the basement that helps students from cuts to birth control and anger management']

column2: ["- Although you may feel as if your being overworked it's only a head start for what's to come in college.- Many labs take place in the different science classes.- There are trips to Soup kitchens, Hospitals, and Colleges.- Pace yourself well so your on track by 11th grade 32 credits is where you want to stand", 'High school for medical professions provide the help you need , always available to help I recommend this school because it takes good care of students', "There were little to no opportunities for me to grow and get into great colleges, such as sat/act prep, etc. There isn't anything really medically related. The principal focuses more on sports than academics so those who work hard academically do not benefit. This school doesn't push you or help you unless you're an athlete. The only thing I'll miss are some teachers.", 'What I liked from High School it Medical Professions was how the teachers actually cared about the students passing the regents. They made it mandatory for us to pass in order for us to graduate on time. What I would like for them to change is the amount of resources the school has since it does not have many clubs or sports.', 'Average school . needs more improvement in college readiness area and health professions area. but there is diversity in the school and they make sure you complete the needed classes to graduate on time .', 'Definitely a school that will leave you with a lot of memories. The teachers really care for their students and really try to get students to participate in not only class but any clubs that are present.', 'great school does wonder for my daughter, always help the kids stay on track and make sure they are set for the future', "I was in the first graduating class at this school, so I've seen it grow from just a few kids to hundreds of kids. The school was very organized and over the years I believe that it has gotten better. ", "It's okay, but I think there should be cameras within the classrooms.", "It's great! Most students get involved and enjoy the clubs they are in as well as making a contribution to the club.", 'What makes this school unique are the teachers as well as the coordinators and the principal. They make sure students are okay and they give it their all in making the environment a better place for the students. They always listen to the feedbacks on what they can do in making the school a better place for not just the students, but the school as a whole.', 'They are respectful, caring, and are always willing to assist the students. If a topic is difficult to understand, they will go out of their way to make it understandable and ask questions to make sure the students understand the topic well enough to move on.', 'The school tries to stay as safe as they can there are frequent fire drills and lockdowns. There are very strong on security on the front door.', 'My favorite extracurricular activities are tennis and Global kids.', 'I wish the school would focus on how to succeed in college more.', 'Ms. Jackson is one of the best teachers there is in the school. She is very attentive and will help you with any question you need.', 'Its a great school that gives out many possiblities to their students. However, the behavior of the students leads outside the school leading to misbehaviors.', 'Every teacher has their own way of teaching, but if you need extra help they will make time for you no matter when.', 'mostly sports but very little arts', 'i have no additional comment']

column6: ['i serve on pta and student leadership =\r - so i am exposed to the plsnning and concern that goes on here, they strive for the best and earned a level of pride.', "There is an abundance of ways to make sure someone isn't carrying a weapon or contraband", 'Again there is a various amount of clubs and things like that but not as much as other schools and not as used and extensive as other schools', 'It is an okay school and i enjoy my friends at the school but it has strict policies that will get you detention or worse for breaking once.', 'Some teachers are ok but once in a while you will get a teacher who calls your house every week for no reason.', 'I would choose this school again because it shaped me', "Well, This school wasn't the school I wanted to attend. My mother chose it for me, but I must say that a lot of the teachers at this school really push the students be successful in life. I know most of the students don't like it at the beginning but at the end of it all I realized that it was all for our benefit and our success.", 'I love my school, but some things could be changed.', 'There is always someone to talk to if i need to.', 'Mostly male students take part in sports and school spirit', 'we accept each other for who we are .', 'My teachers each teach their subjects differently', 'my school offers a plethora of different but i do not partake of any of the clubs.', 'The school is helpful and provides us with prominent health related information.', "The vending machines were your best friends if you didn't like anything that they were serving and that's if the vending machine was working during your lunch period. Sometimes they had different toppings you could put on your food to make it taste better.", "The people i met during my time at this high school made my overall experience better. Besides all the ridiculous regulations and the actions of some naive and ignorant students, it's the only reason why i would've chosen this school again if i could have done it all over. I've experienced things i'm pretty sure i wouldn't have at another school and i'm glad to have met and worked with certain students, teachers, and other members of the staff.", "The policies are ridiculous. They're strict in certain areas that they shouldn't be. Students would get suspended for up to 5 days for not being in uniform we realized that that wasn't allowed. Then they would receive detention. You would also get detention for having on different colored shoes or having a sweater that wasn't allowed on you. Even if it wasn't on your body, but in view. It was confiscated. Whether you were in an argument, merely breaking up a fight, or participating in a fight, you would be suspended all the same for 5 days or more. If you were late, you had detention instead of your first period class. Even if you were just a minute late after the grace period they provided due to the excessively long lines at scanning. On top of that, you were pulled out of your last period class during the final 10-15 minutes to serve an hour detention or basically 1 hour and 15 minutes after school. They also had bathrooms locked the majority of the time. Bathrooms were closed during the first 15 and last 15 minutes of the period. They were locked after school and you really had to appeal to someone to be able to go. It was always a struggle to find an authority who had the bathroom key and maintenance wasn't allowed to open it for us. If you wanted to earn a dress down, you coudn't use the bathroom passes for that marking period.", 'During my time there, the weight room could have been better. Depending on their reason for being on the team, student involvement was pretty good. A lot of people would attend football games and wrestling matches. The school had a lot of fitness opportunities. We had handball, tennis, softball, baseball, basketball, football, wrestling, rugby, and track and field.', "The health and safety policies of the school are okay. It would be very hard to bring a weapon into school because of the metal detectors. Our school is very strict about conflicts and very likely to assign suspensions. You would get suspended for 3 or 5 days just for being in an argument. You would also get suspended for attempting to stop or break up a fight. Bullying in the school definitely isn't allowed,  based on the bullying you see on television isn't something i've seen often in the school. Just females and males having issues and always trying to solve it in a hostile manner, whether it be verbally or physically. If you were in an argument, a dean would try to mediate the problem in a different room to decide on which action to take next.", "The school could be cleaner in certain areas. It's rare to find soap and napkins in the bathrooms. The technology in our school is regular, however they did get new Smartboards. They do offer tutoring after school. Some of the teachers do care to help you succeed in some of the areas that you're lacking in. In my senior year, there wasn't a lot of parent involvement that I was aware of. I believe that the school had some type of college prep, i'm not really sure, but if you needed help with anything and needed advice you would be able to find some teachers willing to help you."]

column1: Providing Urban Learners Success in Education High School
column2: ["I started attending P.U.L.S.E due to the fact that I was always getting sick and just wasn't meeting the requirement of passing. This school is considered an accelerated HS. I believe this school really helps students. They motivate you and give hope to you when you don't have it. They work with you sit you down and make sure you understand the material. They would stay afterschool and help students with tutoring, educational activities, and even help you find jobs. The principle is such an amazing woman. She really cares for her students and goes beyond measures to see them succeed. I will recommend this school to anyone who is feeling hopeless or anyone who feels that they can’t be someone in the future.", 'Pulse High School has been a good experience for me so far.', 'The teachers at my school are not that bad but I think everyone need improvements', 'no nurse, barely any security']

["I integrate this school on 11 grade and I just come  from Haiti in the Catholic school where I spoke French. At the beginning, communicate with my classmate was challenging. Specially my counselor Raymond Michele made a good curses  for following the ESL classes. I really appreciate how the teachers encouraged me and let me know that I can achieve my goal. Finally I got 28 credit, passed 7 regents, obtained 3.5 as a GPA and graduate. I love this school very much. the teachers are friendly. There is a good time sheet, good planning for all activities. I don't regret one moment in my life to integrate this school.", 'Most teachers are good. Need to widen the variety of classes and ability to choose classes and make a schedule, it would help college readiness. They also need more activities and clubs for students to attend.', 'I wish my school had more extra-curricular activities. I do enjoy one of the ones offered but I feel like we should do things like theater or drama club.', "Queens preparatory academy is one of the most highly developed high school because the teachers and stuffs helped students to push for excellence and always motivate individuals to be successful. Students experience at Queens preparatory academy is delightful because everyone was like friends/ family to each and we all shared peace in any situation. It would be hard at the first but teachers are always there to help everyone overcome that specific struggle and let the process keep coming in everyone lifestyle. It was horrible at the first moment because students had to adopt to the environment and share the peace within the years i attended Q.P.A. the school safety is super protected because the students always feel like if they're home and always fighting is prohibited because nobody want to be suspended.", "In this particular school I went there for two years. I started in my junior year. It was a super great experience. I met new people and different way of reaching me goal in life and not to give up on reaching that goal no matter what others may say.Here we got people who care concerned about every child's health and needs and helping them to get there is what they do.", 'It was good. I felt accepted.  I had a little trouble finding friends but then eventually I found some. The teacher are really helpful and the administration socialize with everyone. There are security guards around the building to keep us safe. You must go through scanning before entering the building.', 'This school prepares my sister from college. I see the readiness in her.They teach well and encourage the students to attain their goals.', "I transferred to QPA at the start of 10th grade, but I feel like I've been enrolled in the school since freshman year. I can honestly say that it's like a family. At first I was reluctant to get involved in anything that school had to offer, but I was enveloped and encouraged by my peers and faculty to go above and beyond. Getting the help one needs to succeed is always within arms reach at QPA. I never felt like I was alone.", 'The school lives up to its expectations of college readiness. The teachers are some of the best at their craft and are always willing to help students.', 'What I love about my school is that it has a wide diversity of students that comes from different varies of background cultures and religion and nevertheless we grew as one, as one family.', 'Queens prep help me to be prepared for college. They know how to prepare you for important exams . That also helped me to graduate on time .', 'Im a junior, and In September I will be a Senior. My experience at QPA has been Inspiring. It has made me into a better person.', 'I like how the faculty not only cared about the students grade but also their well-being in trying to relate towards each and every student regardless of their background in hopes of them finding what they want to do post graduation whether it be higher education or even a trade.', "The people are really nice and its easy to form a bond with your teachers. There are some good teachers, as well as bad ones but all in all they're really helpful.", "My experience was not all that good. As a senior I'm still trying to fix the mistakes of this school. Teacher experience many of them were very awesome teachers who fight for the kids. However they left the school because of the principal we have. I know with a new principal NY school would be great.", 'I graduated almost two years ago. My time at QPA was fun overall. It is a small school so you get to know your teachers on a personal level. They offer AP courses which look good to colleges. They help prep you for college.', 'There are no trades at this school.', 'This school mainly has sports. There is also Model UN, Debate, and Improve; however Model UN is accepting entries for the first time and the Debate team just started this year.', 'Some teachers teach in a way that may be confusing to majority of the students and do not know how else to explain. However there are other teachers at the school that will definitely help if you ask.', 'This school provides students with informative sessions that makes us aware of scholarship opportunities, internships and also college recruitment. We are given the opportunity on a day to day basis to improve our grades, work ethics and future plans.']
column4: ["I integrate this school on 11 grade and I just come  from Haiti in the Catholic school where I spoke French. At the beginning, communicate with my classmate was challenging. Specially my counselor Raymond Michele made a good curses  for following the ESL classes. I really appreciate how the teachers encouraged me and let me know that I can achieve my goal. Finally I got 28 credit, passed 7 regents, obtained 3.5 as a GPA and graduate. I love this school very much. the teachers are friendly. There is a good time sheet, good planning for all activities. I don't regret one moment in my life to integrate this school.", 'Most teachers are good. Need to widen the variety of classes and ability to choose classes and make a schedule, it would help college readiness. They also need more activities and clubs for students to attend.', 'I wish my school had more extra-curricular activities. I do enjoy one of the ones offered but I feel like we should do things like theater or drama club.', "Queens preparatory academy is one of the most highly developed high school because the teachers and stuffs helped students to push for excellence and always motivate individuals to be successful. Students experience at Queens preparatory academy is delightful because everyone was like friends/ family to each and we all shared peace in any situation. It would be hard at the first but teachers are always there to help everyone overcome that specific struggle and let the process keep coming in everyone lifestyle. It was horrible at the first moment because students had to adopt to the environment and share the peace within the years i attended Q.P.A. the school safety is super protected because the students always feel like if they're home and always fighting is prohibited because nobody want to be suspended.", "In this particular school I went there for two years. I started in my junior year. It was a super great experience. I met new people and different way of reaching me goal in life and not to give up on reaching that goal no matter what others may say.Here we got people who care concerned about every child's health and needs and helping them to get there is what they do.", 'It was good. I felt accepted.  I had a little trouble finding friends but then eventually I found some. The teacher are really helpful and the administration socialize with everyone. They know how to prepare you for important exams . That also helped me to graduate on time .', 'Im a junior, and In September I will be a Senior. My experience at QPA has been Inspiring. It has made me into a better person.', 'I like how the faculty not only cared about the students grade but also their well-being in trying to relate towards each and every student regardless of their background in hopes of them finding what they want to do post graduation whether it be higher education or even a trade.', "The people are really nice and its easy to form a bond with your teachers. There are some good teachers, as well as bad ones but all in all they're really helpful.", "My experience was not all that good. As a senior I'm still trying to fix the mistakes of this school. Teacher experience many of them were very awesome teachers who fight for the kids. However they left the school because of the principal we have. I know with a new principal NY school would be great.", 'I graduated almost two years ago. My time at QPA was fun overall. It is a small school so you get to know your teachers on a personal level. They offer AP courses which look good to colleges. They help prep you for college.', 'There are no trades at this school.', 'This school mainly has sports. There is also Model UN, Debate, and Improve; however Model UN is accepting entries for the first time and the Debate team just started this year.', 'Some teachers teach in a way that may be confusing to majority of the students and do not know how else to explain. However there are other teachers at the school that will definitely help if you ask.', 'This school provides students with informative sessions that makes us aware of scholarship opportunities, internships and also college recruitment. We are given the opportunity on a day to day basis to improve our grades, work ethics and future plans.']
column6: ['One aspects that makes may school unique is that it is a part of college summit. This program trains us and our peer leaders to get everyone prepared and ready for college.', 'The teachers at my school will go above and beyond to ensure that students are successful despite what their race or ethnicity maybe. For example at my school we use turn and talks, seminars and mix and mingles in order to voice our opinions.', 'QPA is a very small school. These last four years has been a life changing experience. Each year I grew in some way or form. QPA taught me that if I focus and work hard I can become very successful. Failure is not an option. If I could do my four years at this school over again I would. I would want to join as many clubs/teams that I can.', "All of the teachers that I've had/have in QPA since 2012 are the best. My principle knows what we need to do well and she provides every bit. My favorite teacher is Mr.Bednar. He goes up and beyond for his students. He brings so much to the table at our school. From AIDS walk to the blood drive to college now courses he makes sure everyone has an opportunity to do something good for our community. Mr Bednar is also a great history teacher. I learned a lot from him in the last two years.", 'The school safety system is reliable.', 'The after school programs are up to standard', "The parents support their child's education and try to make sure they do all their assignments.", 'The teaching staffs are up to standards and help students meet the requirements', 'My past four experiences at Queens Prep Academy were some of the most mediocre moments of my academic career.', 'Some of the staff are dedicated to helping and ensuring the sucess of their students.\r Trips are fun.', 'I am not too fond of this school I was very disappointed to end up at this school with kind of low standards.  They are unorganized and insufficient. If I had the opportunity to leave and go to a better well rounded school I gladly would. Although. Nothing is stopping me from getting my education other than the occasional disruptions', "What I've eaten is okay don't really fool around school lunch", 'They are sort of strict when it comes to rules and regulations', 'The fitness room is in need of More tools', 'Tennis, basketball,volleyball, track and field', "It's very diverse and very less perplex situations were brought up due to someone care and safety.", 'The extracurricular activities in my school was very unique, beneficial, and productive for various students take part in.', 'I loved the facilities and the sports teams.', 'They where always there for you. Aways helpful, but determine to never make a student feel lost or miseducated.', "The helpfulness and care from the principal and teaching staff  is superbly awesome. Also I honestly felt secure I'm this school than the other schools that I attended like my whole life."]

column2: ['This school is changing for the better but there is still some problem area.1. The food service can use a face lift in terms of quality and quantity.2. The quality of the technology is good but its always broken and unserviceable   .', "Newark Vocational Technical High School is overall really good and a positive environment for your child's education. Teachers are nice, friendly and supportive and want your child to succeed ahead in life. I am currently a senior and graduating in less than two weeks, throughout my high school time I have seen that my school has been on one of the excellence of our community. The building is new and is mostly more clean than other schools. My principal has been an inspirational leader for me and he has taken necessary protocols in order to make this better and better.", 'Prep style uniforms\r Technology Enhanced Active Learning Center (TEAL Center)\r Best In sports (Basketball and Track & Field)', 'The food served at the school was still food but certainly nothing to brag about.', 'Authorities were rather involved in evincing the school policy.', 'The teachers were very understanding towards the situations and circumstances of the student. The teacher ensured that the students received what they needed to in order to succeed.', 'Due to the fact that Newark Vocational is a trade school there were various activities students could partake in. Those activities included being in the art club, music club, construction, science, math and etc.', "Well high school mainly prepares you for the work load that may come along with being a college student; It doesn't really teach one how to manage their time so much.", 'The curriculum is average, like many other schools', 'The administration team has strong policies.', "In my school we don't have many extra activities. we have only maybe 5 extracurricular options for students to participate in.", "The teachers didn't help the students as needed.", "They didn't teach you anything.", 'They serve you the same thing over and over again.', 'There were no study groups or tutoring.', "Students didn't care where you came from as long as you were friendly.", "The teachers and administrators don't care about the students", 'I loved all my teachers, they all were very understanding and helpful', 'I prepared myself while in high school I got a job at the age of 17 and paid for all of my senior dues, and college fees. I\'m still currently doing all the financial responsibilities for myself. I was very prepared for the "real world"', 'The administrative team were very strict within their policies to make sure the students were getting the academic success they needed. Our dress code system was based of uniforms, slacks, and polo shirts and black shoes. If no one abide by the rules they would be in trouble.']
