column1: George Washington Carver High School for the Sciences
column2: ['George Washington Carver high school is an excellent school. The teachers and staffs are respectful and nice, the environment is sometimes blissful and the art classes are fun!!', "Since I've been attending Carver Highschool, I've been exposed to multiple opportunities and experienced many educational internships and outings. Towards the ending of freshmen year, I received a paid internship through the school with an animal hospital, since I wanted to be a veterinarian and I volunteered with them until my Junior year, whilst still getting paid by the D.O.E. The summer after my Junior year, I changed my interest to nursing and through Carver I received an internship to work in a hospital. I like how Carver has many college readiness courses and diversity. I had the opportunity to go to Albany and advocate for AP classes and meet my area's senate. The clubs in Carver are very welcoming and wholesome. I would love to see a change in the amount of exposure to Carver. I believe that not too many students know about the wonderful opportunities they have a chance of experiencing with George Washington Carver Highschool.", 'My experience at GWC was a memorable one. In my four years of attendance I was able to build great connections with all my teachers and staff. Having a small student body gave me the ability to find who I was and helped me to blossom into the person I am today. One thing that I would like to change about George Washington Carver are the communication skills of staff members. An example of better communication skills would be making import events known a week or two in advanced not just a couple days notice. All in all my experience at Carver has really molded me into a strong willed individual.', "I have gotten into Cornell University with a full scholarship and I'm grateful for this school in helping to mold me into the brilliant young woman, I am today.", 'I like that the school has a variety of sports even though the teams suck. I also like ....aw nevermind nothing else. What i dislike does not matter.', "My experience in George Washington Craver High School for the Science was very memorable. The school had potential to be the best If the teachers employed their showed more effort into teaching the students than rather having them learn on their own. Not to say all of the teacher were incapable of teaching, because there was a few who actually showed effeort and determination to ensure that  the student  didn't  leave the classroom without understanding what was thought. If more teacher  like that were hired, the school would perform so much better. My 4 year term in that school was a rollercosater ride from freshman year till my final year. If you plan to attend the school make sure you can learn by yourself and be able to speak for yourself.", "Many teachers genuinely care about the well being of their students. There's also a grand feeling of community as the school clubs constantly interact. My biggest concern for the future of GWC is the choice of curriculum. As stated in the name , it is a high school for the sciences. However, compared to the other high schools in Queens, the school is behind in all aspects. This includes resources for scientific research, the number of qualified science teachers, and range of scientific programs offered to students. Of course, by my senior year, I learned that Carver is indeed trying to improve. However, while other schools are moving at lightning speed, Carver is advancing at the speed of a horse and buggy. The school's funding should focus less on its already flourishing athletics program and be directed towards the art department and science classes. Despite everything the school is blessed to have so many talented and goal oriented students come into the building every day.", "I really love George Washington Carver high school for the science because I have been here since freshmen year and now it's my senior year in this school I just love all the teachers they are very nice and helpful.And all of the staff member,guidance counselor are very nice.", 'The large majority of the teachers are very supportive, kind, empathetic and understanding. A small few will let you cruise through the class as a quiet, asocial or introverted person but some will truly draw it out of you to participate. In a good way of course! With that participation/debate/discussion we were made and allowed to have, were able to solve complex equations in Algebra or we were able to inspect and see why certain governments in a myriad of different countries failed. That’s what sticks out to me at GWCHS. In a way, the teachers and staff are kind of like family.', 'I am currently a senior in my high school. My overall experience was extraordinary, I got to connect with majority of the people other than my race. I became friends with some of them and that showed me a lot of their part of life and culture. Most of the teachers are amazing. They are really friendly and caring. One thing I would change about my school is to have more space and to be funded more. In my 4 years I rarely went to school trips.', 'In the school, it is somewhat like a campus because it is being shared with other schools but i would say it is still a good school in general', "when I first enter that school I was so lost because of the different language and environment but when I took the time to look around me I realize how diverse the school is, how many different kinds of nation was in the same place, I liked it right the way. the reason I didn't give it a five start is because some student in the school do not really know their value so they disgrace the school and make it seems bad.", "It's high school. I enjoyed my experience. Try and make a great and memorable experience for yourself. Join clubs and sports.", 'Overall my experience was average. Although the school does have its flaws, I strongly encourage students to take advantage of all opportunities given to them.', 'I am currently a senior in this school and so far, I love it. The teachers do their absolute best for us students. There are so many clubs and organizations that you can join and even if you do not feel like you belong in any of them, you can open your own club. Most of the students on the other hand are not taking advantage of this school and are wasting time and resources. The schools food is also bad and can be changed to something better and more nutritious.', "I've been going to this school since freshman year, right now I am in my senior year and words cant explain my disappointment. They do not help children with college readiness one bit. I am currently struggling on my own with no guidance from teachers or administration. do not send your child here.", 'My experience was average. This school has a good amount of disruptive, ill-behaved students.( Oddly the students are still incredibly friendly) After enduring that for a while, the teachers tend to become more vulgar. Other that that the teachers seem to care more about the kids than they care about themselves. They also have very few clubs and activities to participate are get involved in.', "I'm a fellow student at this particular high school it's isn't the worst but it isn't the best. I enjoy the people there however, the faculty good be of better standing. I could only vouche for at least 5 teachers in my school without having to be asked. I believe at this school I had a regular high school experience. Although for a school with with four schools in it there could be better academics and college readiness programs. I feel this way because no one even told my peers and I about the act fee waiver until the week before the deadline and same with sat. But hey what can you do🤷🏽\u200d♀️", "This school is the average quality of NYC public schools. Besides being one of two veterinary science programs in the city, nothing really stands out. T Everything is pretty run down as well; they need some upgrades. Also, when I went there they had a roach infestation. It was a huge problem, yet nothing was done to solve it. Unfortunately, I'm pretty sure the roaches are still there.", 'George Washington Carver High School for the Sciences is one of the most loving, caring, nurtured environment I have ever had the pleasure of being apart of. Teachers, administrators and other faculty are respectful, responsible and gets to know each and every student on a personal level while making education fun and encouraging . This school is seriously taken for granted and deserves to be highly acknowledged and respected. This school saves my life and helped me planned for my future.']

This school is seriously taken for granted and deserves to be highly acknowledged and respected. This school saves my life and helped me planned for my future.']
column6: ['Wonderful lively and diverse enciornment with teachers that have a personal connection with students and want to help them.', "The school is great for students who are dedicated about their grades because they can get really high grades they deserve to get into a good college. Sadly this school is much better at athletic than teaching. The worst thing about this school is that teacher are out for the majority of the year or don't return for a second year so you don't get to really connect with the teachers.", "Overall this school needs improvement. Students display a lot of negativity and act like they don't care about school which is hard for those trying to learn. There are cockroaches in the school which is disgusting and there are no mirrors in the bathroom. The school shows favoritism to gateway students which is unfair in my opinion.", "Now that we are allowed to have our cellphones in school there have been countless incidents where students take them out when they are not supposed to. As a result of this phones get taken away and people get upset. Some administrators don't mess around and will suspend you but if they do suspend you it's usually for a good reason", "No matter what team is playing there is usually a decent size crowd watching and cheering on. The fields aren't the absolute best but they are good. The pep rallies are okay but they could be better and longer", "Most teachers don't push students as much as they should.", "There aren't many clubs to join at the school", "I can't speak or the other counselor, but mine is just the worst. She's older, and I can understand if she forgets, but she's always busy, and whenever you want to talk to her, you usually have 5-10 minutes to get everything sorted out before she has to do something else. Her not being there to guide me really strained our relationship, and I'm still having a hard time getting in contact with her. I feel like I'm going into the college process blind, and vulnerable, just because she can't spend and extra five minutes to just walk me through.", "I bring my own, but my friends food, I won't eat.", "Many good teachers have left. Now we've got meh", 'Lots of Caribbeans and Spanish with some black.', "There isn't much variety besides the ave. sports", 'Students who are part a sports team they enjoy it because they like it.  Most students from our school and other schools like to come watch out basketball team play mostly and they are alright. Basketball, track, soccer and maybe wrestling, volleyball, football people enjoy watching them. Guys on the basketball team have to dress up when they have game and other sports as well.  We have a large gym and two smaller gyms.', 'There just okay. Nothing special.', "My overall experience was okay. I met some people I could socalize withy and they were alright. I didn't learn much and I wasn't happy when I came to school. When I first came i joined the volleyball team which was fun at the time I did it for a couple of months and that's how I met new people easily. I can't wait for senior trip and senior acitivtes that are coming up . I just probably would have choose a different school because this school isn't diverse and feel like I wouldn't be how I am as of now if I had gone to a different school.", 'Sometimes the csu has movie night for kids to watch', 'The building is very old. It needs a lot of renovations.', 'Some classes are not even offered, such as art and precalculus.', 'I admire the principle for all the hard work she has done. Its also a privilege for all the Advance Placement (AP) classes that i have been offered. This school is not too bad.', 'Some teachers are good, some are very cruel, and some should not be teaching at all.']

column2: ["For more information about this school visit Meri Yallowitz Don't Tread on Educators page to get the full information about this place!", 'Metropolitan Diploma Plus High School is a terrible place. The administration is abusive and corrupt. They encourage and pressure cheating from teachers.', "Horrible administration. Corrupt teachers. No real teaching. Lots of cheating and illegal activity that takes place. This is not a school. It's more like a detention center for students and the new teachers unfortunate enough to have to work at this horrible place.", 'My experience at metro was very pleasant. I attended this school after living s year in florida because my credits would not properly transfer over so i had to stay an extra year in high school. When i came to metro i at first i was nervous but the faculty and staff also with the help of other students quickly help me to get comfortable .', 'The school is small. The paint in the hallways are pretty.', "The principal is very involved. She likes to get to know the students and know how they are doing in there classes and outside of school. The guidance counselour is amazing also. She helps you figure out how many credits you need, which classes she's going to put you into, and wants nothing else but for her students to graduate on time and go to college. The office staff are really nice. They mostly just do office work though. Bullying is not tolerated in school. If there is bullying there is a consequence of suspension or expulsion. The dress code lets you wear almost anything you want but inappropriate clothing like shirts that are cut in half. Attendance is very important. If you have poor attendance you won't pass your classes and you won't be eligible for after school activities or special events like prom.", "There isn't really any extracurricular activities but the basketball team.", "The food is okay. Normal school food if that's what you can call it. Sometimes I don't even know what the food is cause it looks to gross. Other times though their pizza is like the only normal food they have. ", "    We have to the share the gym with 2 other schools and it gets pretty crowded. All we do in gym though is shoot basketballs. it gets boring after a while. It also gets dangerous because you have like 10 basketballs in the air and people sometimes get hit with the balls. \r    The weight room is small and filled with water bugs. the equipment in the weight room though is all rusty and disgusting. \rThere is only basketball teams and I'm not a big fan of basketball. I would rather have the school have a soccer team.", 'I like my school. The teachers there are absolutely amazing and caring. The guidance counselor is always on your back about graduating high school and going to college. The students are pretty cool depending upon what kind of friends you want. ']

column1: William E. Grady Career & Technical Education High School
column2: ['My experience at William E. Grady CTE High School was very informative and very helpful towards my goal in life. I was academically challenged and socially accepted very quickly.', 'william e grady is a great high school for your child to come to , presenting many opportunities to earn practitioning certificates in multiple courses', "Love it it's A good school for trade and academic education    , great diversity in cultural, and educational opportunities and job opportunities as well.  I'm happy to be a student at this school.", "I really enjoy attending at Grady because there are many opportunities that students have access  to that we could take advantage of. Also, as the years went on, the school culture has gotten better because many students would get involved with the school more. I'm surrounded by positive people that are focus about going into college as much as I am.", 'I like the different career workshops they offer from culinary to construction, IT, and etc.  The staffs are very helpful and does their best to put you on the right track for college. They can upgrade the environment and the look of the school in general such as a ,ore colorful paint and better appliances and electronics to make it better for student to become more comfortable, and feel at home almost.', 'very average school , not at all bad students, teacher are great/ staff safe school to go to they offer CTE diploma .', 'Attended from 2009 - 2013 , Grady was undergoing a make-over. 4 years later things have changed and this Career and Technical High school is a great place to learn key vocational skills to implement on the day you graduate.', 'everyone gets an opportunity to play.', 'Make sure that u are healthy', 'they will help u succeed in school and train u throughout college.', "It's okay if you stick to yourself and work hard.", 'The sport and fitness program at Grady high school is excellent. It give the students a chance to experience new thing and being physical fit.', 'The teachers are dedicated, helpful, caring, and motivational', 'The academics offered in this school is very beneficial and challenging.', 'The nurse and health program are both great. School safety is also great', "My experience at this school has been life changing for me. I've become a big and better person", 'School facilities and guidance counselors are extremely motivational to our students.', 'The principle is very much involved in everything', "It's is very easy to make friend at this school. Everyone gets along very well.", "I'm extremely excited for college"]

column6: ['There is always extracurricular activities for the student. There is sport, student government, robotic, debate club, and many more.', 'The food is always fresh, health, and delicious for the students', 'The gym work out room is very nice from all the new equipment we just got  here. The cafeteria has also been introduced with a splash of school colors and new school themed tables', 'the students get a school wide sex health presentation from outside health professionals who come to our school annually.\r there is also a health office which is always opened to the students at any time.', 'my teachers are always showing that they are available to students even when they are piled high with their own work.', "I am currently valedictorian and i feel that without the support and help of my guidance counselors and teachers that I wouldn't have reached my position.", 'my teachers try their best with the students at my school, so the students feel motivated to go harder and farther.', 'the school administrations is very open to students and show their availability to us at all times. they treat us as if their kids.', 'with all the school activities and teas in our school, its almost impossible to not have fun!', 'i love our school lunches because of the varieties and salad bar!', 'Food servings are okay and offer a large variety of meals during the week. Snacks are also offered occasionally.', 'Academics is great. Teachers are helpful and guide you toward success!', 'My experience at this school was amazing. I got a great education and met new friends, teachers and staff that always help and accompany me. I was offered many great programs and internship opportunities and took full advantage of them which helped me gain experience and knowledge in the work force. Many sports and clubs to join while here! This school has shops classes that guarantee certification by junior to senior year and help you find and apply for internships and jobs!', 'There is many policies that is followed in this school. We have a very strict bullying policy. Anyone who is a witness of bullying or that has been bullied themselves, can make a complaint to the Principle and the issue will be addressed immediately. All deans and staff are helpful and ensure that students are where they should be and stay out of trouble. Dress code is strict and students who do not maintain a 90 % uniform dress code will not be invited to any activities, school trips, etc... Great staff!', 'This school in my opinion is a great school, I love it!. It has many opportunities, clubs and after school programs to keep all students busy and focused. This school also has a large variety of sports such as, football, soccer, baseball, volleyball, softball, wrestling and much more. Great Shop classes that guarantee you certification by junior to senior year. Great staff!', 'I did really well in my school primarily from joining after school clubs and activities. By joining student government and various sports such as football and baseball, I was able to meet and socialize with some great peers and teachers.', 'The Coaching staff at my school have a way of communicating through the toughest kids and touching their hearts to become outstanding individuals. There are many inner city kids at my school and a lot of them join either basketball or football. The coaching staff in both sports would be considered spectacular with the way they work with my peers. As for the gym in our school, it is also outstanding due to the variety of workouts it offers. I personally love to work out because it builds up my confidence along with reading books. My coaches trained me personally in those gyms and my body now is in great shape.', 'This one of the reasons why i came to this school is to be part of the sports team for me was baseball, there is enough coaches for each team and sometimes even more than enough.', 'Our school is great when health issues come up because of the janitors and nurses we have they take care of us and keep this school really healthy.', "In our school there is a dress code with polo shirt and pants. This school doesn't tolerates bullying at all if you do their will be some punishment going on, if your in a sports team you don't play for a few games or you become eligible to play anymore games. Our staff is great because they get to know us the best by talking to us personally or in school wise, specially our coaches we make a special bond with each other making them just like another person of your family.   "]

column1: Bushwick Leaders' High School for Academic Excellence
column2: ['Well I’ve been in Bushwick leaders for 4 years now and I’m finally graduating my experience has been awesome I’ve learned new things made new friends and shared many happy sad moments I eill miss this school so much.', 'My experience has been good so far. I am a senior and I will really miss the school teachers and staff. This is since they helped everyone to succeed not only went going to college but life in general.I will like to have more clubs and activitie, better food and sports.', 'The relationshipwith students and staff is great while the facilties are not good. I enjoyed my time at the school I do wish somethings were improved but that is over my control.', 'I had an alright experience at this school, I feel, however, that after I graduated I was not ready for college at all.', "Since the first day of my freshman year, I always felt that this school was a perfect fit for me. The teachers and staff are welcoming and very caring. Over time I've built very strong relationships with my teachers and I felt like it should always be like that because students look up to them and look for them when in need. So To Build Strong relationships with them is key. Bushwick Leaders Has Some Flaws But None, That Can Overcome How Great The School and Staff members in them are. They take you in as their own and Help is Always giving 24/7. What I Love About Bushwick Leaders Is How their Main Goal Is To Get you prepared and Ready For College from the first step to when you walk Out .", 'The extracurricular activities are very fun and exciting. It keeps the student guessing for what going to happen the next day. Everyday there is something new, a new activity.', 'The school has a program within school hours. This program help students interact with others and have individual counseling.', 'The teachers at the school are very concerns about their students. They mentally challenge us, so we can better ourselves. The teachers constantly make students engage in reading and critical thinking discussions. The teachers encourage us to do better.', 'it is a great school overall. there is a lot of support with college & life. there are no sports teams but the afterschool activities makeup for it', "I enjoyed the experience simply because of some of the teachers I met and the close knit friends I made but if I could take those people with me to a different school and do it all over again I would. I entered college feeling incredibly insecure about my education and it took a toll on my learning experience at the university, I didn't know just how unprepared I was until I entered the university which is not the best way to find out just how much the school did not prepare you.", "There isn't a kitchen and so food is delivered from another school down the street. There aren't many options because there isn't a kitchen amongst other things.", "Dress code exists but it isn't really enforced, the attendance always changes, etc.", "There aren't sports and the gym that the school has is also utilized as an auditorium for events. What sport gear the school actually has is always falling apart or in poor condition.", "There are certain departments with amazing teachers who give their all for their students but there are also departments that have teachers that aren't good at delivering a helpful instruction. Then again teachers are always leaving and new ones fill their spots.", 'An after school program was added to my high school after I was already a junior and was participating in a different program I had found outside of my school.', 'I have had a small handful of amazing teachers there but the school did not prepare me at all for college and left me feeling cheated out of an education that I needed and felt like I deserved.', "If it was not for the friends and 4 teachers that I really enjoyed having that I have My experience would have been even worst then it was. The school did not have no sports team, no healthy food, some of the teachers were rude and inconsistent. I still visit the school but simply because of the 4 teachers that were the absolute best but once they leave I will not longer be visiting that school cause it just isn't a good place to spend 4 years at. You better off going somewhere else because this school doesn't have much to offer.", "The food was never that good. Sometimes students would rather go a whole day without eating because the food was that bad. They never have a variety of food it was either you eat what they served or you don't eat at all and if you did not make it to the cafeteria within the first 15 minutes then you would miss out on eating because lunch time is only 25 minutes and if you was not done within the 25 minutes you had to throw your food away.", "The staff is really concerned about the safety of the students in the school but because the students don't fear nor have respect for the staff they would do as they please and In result the school would have a lot of fights and once a kid ended up in the hospital due to a Snapple bottle being bashed against his head. We did have a dress code but it was not always followed and sometimes the staff would not even allow the students in the school because they did not have the dress code and sometimes because they came late to school so they were not allowed inside the building.", "My school did not no sport teams at all. My high school was not big enough and it did not get enough funding for even a little golf team. The weight room was in the back of the gym and it would get messed up. Some students messed up the weight bench and others would use it to just sit down and do nothing so people never really used it to work out. Because  there was no athletics there was no school spirit. Students would always start a fight cause that's the only way to see any entertainment in the school"]

column1: Frederick Douglas Academy VI High School
column2: ["I've was enrolled at Frederick Douglass Academy VI in September of 2018. The school has limited resources and is quite a small school however the teachers try their utmost best to work with students and involve their parents so that it can be an environment of learning and fun. Parents however, rarely involve in the school and this affect their children's grades, attendance and overall behavior negatively. There is a limited number of clubs and activities to participate in and for the ones that are there, students barely get involved. The school's food is not as tantalizing as I had expected it to be and as a result many students go throughout the days not having lunch at school, like myself and majority of the school population. The safety there however is off the hook, the school safety officers does their jobs perfectly and ai must commend them for that.", 'During my experience in Frederick Douglass Academy VI my four years were like a roller coaster. Even though I had a great experience with the teachers and their support towards college readiness, the student environment felt unsafe and was in need of improvement.', 'The teachers were understanding.  The counselors also  helped me prepare for college. The school offered help with college applications and they also offered counseling for students looking to improve their gpa or regents scores. Overall my high school experience here was engaged. There were activities and sports and other events to get students involved.', 'I graduated from FDA VI in 2014. There was outdated books, no technology or even trade classes. The teachers were ALL loving and caring. They respected their students. I work for John Adams High School as a Tech Intern and their teachers are nothing like Frederick Douglas Academy VI teachers.', "my experience at this school was the best of my entire life at any other school. first, they are known for the best sports in the district. the teachers actually care about my education there. the teachers often stay back after school hours to make sure I understood the topic of what we were learning at the time. even the principle helped me with a wide range of topics when all the teachers left. the diversity there is like none other. many different cultures and activities that bring all the cultures together. . this just made everyone understand and feel closer to a culture that wasn't even ours but we felt apart of it anyway. parent involvement is always there. the parents actually helped pay for most things like text books and new material. this school college readiness was like no other because no matter what our grades was they always told us to try. they even helped with most of our applications. this school is like no other. ITS GREAT", "Though I haven't seen too many incidents with bullying, I can say that I am a victim of bullying. I do feel that I am safe in the school. I don't think that there are any special security measures and I know not much about the safety services or the school nurse.  Though I do feel safe, the school isn't. Though I don't partake in that kind of activity, I hear that there's a lot of gang filiation taking place inside of the school. Not often, but it happens.", "The teachers are very professional and try to help the students as much as they can. The scheduling process is managable and easy to remember. The school doesn't offer much classes. Mainly the basics such as Math, Social Studies, Science, and Physical Education and a few unnecessary electives having to do with the basics. The work load isn't too much. Students can mainly study during their lunch period or if they get into school early.", "Everyone is very accepting of race/ethnicity, gender, and sexual orientation. Peer pressure isn't much of an issue, either. Not from what I've seen, at least.", "The teachers are always open to helping their students in every which way they can.  If a student doesn't understand what is being taught, they don't mind going over again.  They know what they're doing and keep up to date with grading. The teachers communicate professionally with their students, even when the students tend to get a bit rude.", "This school is so deprived, the students aren't even open to much.", 'It would be great if my school had a better variety of utensils.', 'Due to the switching of principals, rules change and people tend to forget about the rules that once applied. This results in the teachers and administrators not knowing where to go in the route of disciplinary action. Some are lenient to trouble makers, most just look the other way. This school is in need of stability.', 'As a student athlete it was not rare to see students attending games, win or lose. Basketball being the big thing in NYC was always the sport that got most attention, but there are a bunch of people who attended swim meets, volleyball games, football games, etc. The school could use an increase in school spirit but they do support their sport teams.', "There are your handful of teachers who are generally in love with the idea of teaching ,but due to the recent problems and the constant switching of teachers and or principals some of these values have seemed to diminish. But they're attempting to restore order.", 'The name of the game is breaking the status quo. There are a lot of things to do at this school but they are under the radar due to the social norm. You have your bunch of students who participate in clubs and sports teams.', "I wouldn't necessarily say my school prepared me for college ,but it gave me drive to get out of my current situation to go work for what I WANTED.", "Couldn't afford it and students would destroy it", 'My school could use more after school programs, more arts-cooking, etc programs, with lot of different kind of games', "There are just a little extracurricular activities in this school, there's nothing to do after school and you get bored everyday.", "There's no peer pressure, there's a little bullying, and there isn't much of racism."]

column1: The High School for Global Citizenship
column2: ["I've had the 4 best years of my life at this school. I love all the staff they all literally take you in and mold you into a great scholar and prep you for the real world. Only thing I would want to change about the school is the time schedule it was kind of long.", 'First day as a student, I thought it would be tough making friends and being close with my teacher. I was nervous because I was surrounded by new people and it was difficult fitting it. Each day I spent at that school, I learned how to express myself around others and get the opportunity to have a decent relationship with teachers and staffs.', 'I like how most of the teachers are very nice to the students and how diversed the school is . I think the school needs to bring more activities in the school like more extracurricular activities.', "The school is small and didn't have lockers until this year. There needs to be better communication with the parents regarding college and scholarships that are available.", 'My experience during my time in the High School for Global Citizenship was a very memorable one. Before entering High School as a student i was told it would teach me a lot about life and my future due to furthering my education. I must say i experienced just that, High School taught me about friendship, loyalty, focus and the ability to multitask.', "This school is really good at preparing students for the college application process. As a senior I had many courses related to college and career readiness, as well as, the chance to do numerous professional jobs throughout the city. This school is great for any hoping to go into the art field as they can link you with great performance programs that I've been able to take. Also the school has dance and muscial theatre programs.", '   My high school is great. It has really good teachers who invest time into making sure that students are not struggling to understand task and assignments. The school is kept fairly clean and the environment is inspirational however I would really like to see more staff getting involved with helping students especially seniors to get college ready. I would also like for students including myself to be able to gain access to lockers. Aside from the issues I have stated above my high school is a place for learning and self development. Students are motivated to pursue their goals and dreams.', 'The social scene at my school such as student involvement is great because my school have programs including Global Kids to engage with students on projects within their community.', 'The academics offered at this school is okay because we have some courses such a s trigonometry or chemistry that would make the class interesting.', "I think my school is safe since we have metal detectors and student ID's.", 'This school has school safety like most schools and it has actual police officers on sight for 24 hours. So at all tines there are police officers on the campus.', 'I have been some extra curricular activities such as Global kids, Cheerleading, double Dutch and a program named, Avid. These activities taught me to be a better vision of myself, be active and take care of the community that surrounds me.', 'My experience at this school is okay because I have been through a lot with people that wants to be in my buisness. I have some friends that supports me to do my best. I have teachers that I can depend on for more help in school.', 'The teachers at my school helps me to do well on class work, homework and exams. The teachers will provide packets for the students to use as a guide for exams such as regents. Most teachers would use a smart board to make the assignment looks clear on the board.', 'This school has after school clubs and organizations available for all students', 'This school is a really great school because of all of the different opportunities that we as students get introduced to. Such as college courses and and various programs that open new doors for us at a young age.', 'The teachers do a great job of teaching the students and making sure they learn.', 'This school is okay becuase it has some programs.', 'The food is okay not great.', 'People will get suspended for different actions.']

column6: ['We got many sports activities at this school.', 'they are a lot of many great teachers who cares alot', 'We have many programs thats good for the students.', 'The food service at this school is poor', 'The school safety is always on point and very aware of what is going on. Everyone feels safe at school', 'Most teachers will go out their way to give extra help to a student', 'The guidance counselor is very helpful and you make great connections with the staff', 'The dance team is shared with 2 schools which makes it difficult to get control', 'I felt somewhat ready to take on the changles that the real world had to offer me.', 'They just recently opened a new mac lab which is great', 'There is Global Kids, The National Honor Society, Hip-Hop Dance, Step Team, Student Government, Basketball, Track, Performing Arts, Swimming, Soccer, and Baseball.', 'The food is horrible. The food is healthy at all, pizza is served every day.', "It's not that diverse. A lot of Caribbean people are in this school. And being that they are Caribbean they are ignorant when it comes to gays therefore a lot of people are straight.", 'There is not much to choose from when it comes to classes. All of the classes are pretty generic and everyone has the same classes, there are barely any electives. The only electives are art and spanish. The workload is pretty managable and the scheduling process is easy being that no one chooses their own schedule really being that there is not a variety of classes.', "This school barely has school spirit. When it comes to girl basketball games, it's like no one comes.", 'A lot of good teacher end up quitting. The teachers that stay or end up being hired make learning hard to do because they do  not know what they are doing.', 'The principal is never involved, and the guidance counselor is almost never in her office. The school has a uniformed dress code but no one wears the uniform but the freshman.', 'The school is always dirty, no one I know has been bullied before but I have personally been bullied in this school. The security guards are very aggressive and impolite. ', "Honestly, I only went to this school because it was close to home. When I first came as a freshman most of my classmates were rude and not very friendly. The lunch is horrible, I only eat when I am really desperate for food. The school is getting more extracurricular activities but I didn't participate in nothing during 10th grade being that there was only Global Kids at the time. The principal does not interact with the students at all and she just stays in her office, I didn't even know who she was until the end of my freshman year. This school loses teachers every year which sucks because when the seniors need recommendations they don't have many people to turn to.", "The academics are very general and even though there is somewhat a variety, students do not pick there own classes. It's like pulling teeth to get a course changed for something else even if it meets the amount of credit requirements you need. Not a very fair system with a good variety of classes but unlike most schools in the area we got AP courses and the school has been getting better in academics"]

column2: ['This school is really good at preparing you for college. The diversity is really good too they make everyone feel heard. The clubs are great too there is one that is called student council they really care about what the kids wants and makes them feel heard.', 'The teachers are very nice and they keep me motivated, they keep me going , they believe in me and that’s something that pushes  me to go to school even though I don’t want to. My teachers kinda make me confident', "My experience at this school was generally interesting. It's not the best school but, its not the worst. I would like to see more academic challenges such as more AP classes.", 'This school is wonderful. My first day I was greeted with open arms. I was a new student from GA and at first I thought I would never fit in with anyone because of the culture difference. But everyone there was surprisingly more welcoming and open minded than I expected. Though there are some bad apples in the bunch just like with every other school, the pros out weight the cons.', 'Personally, I had an amazing experience in which I was able to network with the staff and professors. Not only was I able to enjoy the courses and the community around me, I felt comfortable being able to discuss and express myself with my teachers and the administration since they are very supportive and eager to see students excel.', 'What I liked about the Metropolitan Soundview High School was the college readiness and the sports teams. The teachers were good at getting one college ready and the sports teams were outstanding. On the other hand I disliked the level of professionalism of the rest of the faculty.', 'While Attending the school I never had a doubt about whether or not I should go to school that day. Teachers strive to make classes fun so student involvement rises. The Metropolitan school is a laid back school that will make sure students are ready for college.', "Its a decent school it focuses on college and career. Most teachers are very honest and humble. The students in this school are split among'st two groups either you are quiet and smart, or loud and social.", "What I like about this school is, its very diverse which is great. The school has many kind and helpful teachers that always gives a hand to a student when needed, what needs to be changed is the school food. Some days the food isn't good. That is a must change ", 'This school is a school i would stay and finish my education. All the teachers know me. Only thing i would say should change is the food.', 'Safety measures were extreme, everyday was needed to go in through metal detectors and code red and blues were never taken lightly. Food was constantly healthy.', 'Their pretty average, our school had the most clubs compared to anyone else in the building. People usually take the clubs serious which is great when it came to meetings and stuff but overall they were alright.', "This school is Definitly unique due to the fact it's the smallest school on the Monroe Campus. This school is the length on one hall way on the fourth floor and one hall way on the fifth floor, sharing  the floor with a other school. This school may be the smallest but is the most involved with school activities and intramural sports.", "The teachers and faculty at this school are extremely great. They constantly strive to push the children to reach their highest goal, that's why most students have made it to college. They never give up on any student, they try and do their best to get the best results for the students future. Constantly helping the students find ways to gain real-world experience, find ways to financially balance out our expenses for college. Their just great teachers over all and really are dedicated to their job.", 'PolicE officer are visibly prepared for any emergency', 'Do not have many extracurricular oportunities, but the have the necessarily', 'My school teachers are excellent,  even more than I expected.', "In this school I've had my ups and downs and learned from it. This school is engaged in my learning and activities outside of school.", 'Each and every teacher is devoted to their job.']

['Automotive High School is definitely an adventurous school allowing students to learn more on field trips and hands on work. Students work on cars while others participate in club activities like the Student Ambassador and National Honor Society. There are alot of help for college readiness like SAT prep.', 'I enjoyed being able to do many things at Automotive Highschool. From the India trip they took some students on followed by  numerous trips before and after. I found life long mentors and friends.', 'inside the school is generally clean. The only time there may be a mess somewhere is inside the café. The safety side to this school is good because all the security guards are cool with the kids and make sure that they get to lass on time.', 'The extracurricular opportunities at this school are great. The clubs here teach the students to be kind to others and offer a lot of fun things to do while they stay. Also, administration support is always there when needed.', 'This school is unique in many ways. Its just not the events that goes on around the school its the people who you engage with every day that makes you want to go back again.', 'teachers at this school are always there when students need help. sometimes, students at the school are struggling and ignore the teachers help. teachers help every student as long as they see that it is needed and is willing to do it even on their brakes.', 'A variety of diverse students attends my school', 'Great! The school is really a great school', 'I would recommend others to attend this school', 'The teachers are very helpful and kind to all students', 'there are always opportunities in the school.', 'They have good administrations by training to get drivers ed.', "They are good teachers but its that the kids just don't listen.", 'They put good competition with other teams.', "Some of the students don't really care about learning and just play around.", 'The teachers in the school listen to what the student has to say and understand if the student needs help in a certain class.', 'the staff and administration helped out a good portion', 'It was a Cool exprience to go to automotive but I think i could have had a better one if i attended elsewere']

column1: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports
column2: ['I like certain people that go to the school and certain teachers who teach here. To improve this school I feel as though they should add more interactive and comfortable clubs that students would be really interested in joining.', 'I like the classes, specifically the type of classes , and the opportunity they provide. This school does a great job on trying to keep you in track for your next grade & gives you the tools to do so.', 'As a senior at careers in sports, my experience has had its ups and down. The facility and teachers are amazing but the environment can take away from that because of its negative impact on the students. There is a constant safety risk, but once you get to the school you can take a break from the environment. The teachers are extremely involved with the students to make sure they get the best experience possible.', 'The campus is amazing, very well maintained. Students are ok, there are some problematic kids who are constantly looking for trouble, but for the most part teachers are amazing and also the staff.', 'I have only been in Careers In Sports High School for going on two months now however it has made a great impact on me. It was a big transition for me as a senior going into a new school for your last year of high school but the students there were very welcoming. Once they knew that I was a transfer who didn’t really know that many people they made sure to help with any work that I was having issues or just any issues period. In this school they have such a great bond with each other as well as great school spirit which is something I never experienced. The school I previously went to was on the same campus as the one I’m attending now but you can definitely see the difference in their environments.', "My experience at Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports was often a mixed feeling of aggravation and worry. The school was inconsistent in terms of helping students succeed, and did not put much effort into assuring that it's students were safe. As many bad points as the school had, the school had a lot of upside also. There was a large amount of diversity at the school, and the school offered a large amount of clubs and programs to keep students engaged and involved in school life. I enjoyed my first year at the high school, as it welcomes freshmen well. However throughout the next 3 years, the support lessens, and you are required to rely much more on yourself than your supporting teachers and staff members.", 'My experience was very good. The school has many programs available to assist you in your academics, athletics & other hobbies such as art, gardening, & other extracurricular activities. Overall, I enjoyed my overall experience as a student in Career in Sports.', "Honestly it's a nice school and the staff is friendly and their always finding new ways to help students learn or with social or sports issues.", 'The school is pretty okay. I don’t think it is good at getting student ready for college. Limited  resources and facilities. The teachers are great and look out for the students a lot.', 'I enjoy attending Careers in Sports because there is a lot of diversity.  I transferred her during my junior year and felt extremely welcomed by my peers and staff members. I played soccer , I wrestled a bit and I played rugby for the two years of attending. This school has opened my eyes to a new sport and even helped me get into my dream college.', "My experience at Urban Assembly for Careers in Sports was a very adventurous. Everyday at school there was always something different going on. This allowed me to attend school often and stay focused. Additionally there is always extra help, no matter with what you need help on. This was always helpful because if one didn't understand something from a class they can always get the answers.", 'The school is a clean campus and spacious especially in a crowded city like New York. There are some teachers who are very good and actually strive for the students to do their best especially the A.P. teachers. However, the school does not offer many electives and they are not really interesting.', 'This school is an okay school . Not much diversity , more spanish than blacks . Some teachers are okay . The science teachers are bad except one . Just gotta stay focus & study hard', 'It was a wonderful experience, met wonderful and helpful teachers. I was never under my work, I was always motivated by classmates and teachers. It was a great learning environment.', 'My favorite experiences were the trips and after-school clubs.', 'The teachers genuinely care about their students and implement effective and challenging teaching methods.', 'Most of the afterschool activities are very helpful and give students a wonderful understanding to hobbies that they would consider and also give students an opportunity to open up outside of a school environment and connects with teachers.', 'Honestly, being in a school with great teachers has opened my eyes to understanding the real world and the college environment in a different light.', 'Well this school is like 80% guys and, being a sports-oriented school, "bro" culture is very prevalent.', 'There is some curriculum/ classes that helps us understand part of contraceptive methods so we can stay safe from that.']
column4: ['I like certain people that go to the school and certain teachers who teach here. To improve this school I feel as though they should add more interactive and comfortable clubs that students would be really interested in joining.', 'I like the classes, specifically the type of classes , and the opportunity they provide. This school does a great job on trying to keep you in track for your next grade & gives you the tools to do so.', 'As a senior at careers in sports, my experience has had its ups and down. The facility and teachers are amazing but the environment can take away from that because of its negative impact on the students. There is a constant safety risk, but once you get to the school you can take a break from the environment. The teachers are extremely involved with the students to make sure they get the best experience possible.', 'The campus is amazing, very well maintained. Students are ok, there are some problematic kids who are constantly looking for trouble, but for the most part teachers are amazing and also the staff.', 'I have only been in Careers In Sports High School for going on two months now however it has made a great impact on me. It was a big transition for me as a senior going into a new school for your last year of high school but the students there were very welcoming. Once they knew that I was a transfer who didn’t really know that many people they made sure to help with any work that I was having issues or just any issues period. In this school they have such a great bond with each other as well as great school spirit which is something I never experienced. The school I previously went to was on the same campus as the one I’m attending now but you can definitely see the difference in their environments.', "My experience at Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports was often a mixed feeling of aggravation and worry. The school was inconsistent in terms of helping students succeed, and did not put much effort into assuring that it's students were safe. As many bad points as the school had, the school had a lot of upside also. There was a large amount of diversity at the school, and the school offered a large amount of clubs and programs to keep students engaged and involved in school life. I enjoyed my first year at the high school, as it welcomes freshmen well. However throughout the next 3 years, the support lessens, and you are required to rely much more on yourself than your supporting teachers and staff members.", 'My experience was very good. The school has many programs available to assist you in your academics, athletics & other hobbies such as art, gardening, & other extracurricular activities. Overall, I enjoyed my overall experience as a student in Career in Sports.', "Honestly it's a nice school and the staff is friendly and their always finding new ways to help students learn or with social or sports issues.", 'The school is pretty okay. I don’t think it is good at getting student ready for college. Limited  resources and facilities. The teachers are great and look out for the students a lot.', 'I enjoy attending Careers in Sports because there is a lot of diversity.  I transferred her during my junior year and felt extremely welcomed by my peers and staff members. I played soccer , I wrestled a bit and I played rugby for the two years of attending. This school has opened my eyes to a new sport and even helped me get into my dream college.', "My experience at Urban Assembly for Careers in Sports was a very adventurous. Everyday at school there was always something different going on. This allowed me to attend school often and stay focused. Additionally there is always extra help, no matter with what you need help on. This was always helpful because if one didn't understand something from a class they can always get the answers.", 'The school is a clean campus and spacious especially in a crowded city like New York. There are some teachers who are very good and actually strive for the students to do their best especially the A.P. teachers. However, the school does not offer many electives and they are not really interesting.', 'This school is an okay school . Not much diversity , more spanish than blacks . Some teachers are okay . The science teachers are bad except one . Just gotta stay focus & study hard', 'It was a wonderful experience, met wonderful and helpful teachers. I was never under my work, I was always motivated by classmates and teachers. It was a great learning environment.', 'My favorite experiences were the trips and after-school clubs.', 'The teachers genuinely care about their students and implement effective and challenging teaching methods.', 'Most of the afterschool activities are very helpful and give students a wonderful understanding to hobbies that they would consider and also give students an opportunity to open up outside of a school environment and connects with teachers.', 'Honestly, being in a school with great teachers has opened my eyes to understanding the real world and the college environment in a different light.', 'Well this school is like 80% guys and, being a sports-oriented school, "bro" culture is very prevalent.', 'There is some curriculum/ classes that helps us understand part of contraceptive methods so we can stay safe from that.']
column6: ['There is not a lot of students that are involved in a few things and peer pressure is not always found by students.', "There is a few extra curriculum at our school which is after school but not everyone wants to participate on it because some of these extra curriculum that is offered are not the one's most of the students are interested on.", 'All the teachers in this school is pretty good and always helps the student with anything that they need help with. They help the students during school or after school.', 'The school is a safe environment where nobody gets bullied at any time and the policies is pretty strict when it comes to like bullying and other safety environment as well.', 'The school has been a pleasant experience and if I could I would repeat the experience.', 'The teachers are very energetic and very resourceful.', 'There\'s a couple of clubs you can join. Off the tip of my tongue, the school offers video game, art, debate and newspaper clubs. There\'s a club called "Project Discovery" where you get to go camping in wilderness and urban environments. There\'s also Gay-Straight Alliance (GSA) if you\'re interested. The clubs/organizations I mentioned aren\'t overly popular since they usually average about 5-10 students. I\'m not sure if any of them are still active since funding them is somewhat of an issue and not that many people participate in them.', 'Again, I\'ll make this brief: most teachers have great relationships with the students, others... not so much. The teachers are divided into "departments"(i.e. Math, History) with universal grading policies. The teaching styles are all over the place (uh... yay diversity?) but as long as you pay attention, it shouldn\'t be much of an issue. Here\'s my life pro tip: try getting a teacher who teaches honors blocks. Not all teachers teach honors and I feel like those who do tend to be of better quality than those who don\'t.', 'This school is somewhat strict with its security policies. Cameras are everywhere and the security guards are well respected by the staff and students alike. Random security sweeps take place every few months... etc. This school is great when it comes to security but I can\'t say the same for New Explorers, the school directly next to this one, so be sure to avoid that side of the building. Also, (this applies to UASCS) watch your personal belongings(i.e phones) because I know a few people who had them stolen when not paying attention. \r Now on to health... where do we start? The school nurse is located in a really awkward place... the office is located on the other side of the building(where New Explorers is located) and it\'s a hassle getting there and setting up an appointment but it\'s totally worth it. The school also offers counseling, so don\'t be afraid to ask for help when you need it. If you\'re planning on staying safe for when you "get down", speak to Ms. Elliot. Nothing is worse or scarier than contracting an STI or becoming preggo/getting someone pregnant while still in high school. Take advantage of these resources!', "I'll make this brief. Typical Gen-Ed stuff... very few electives to choose from.. but then again this is a sports oriented school. Most of the teachers are pretty cool (there are a few crappy teachers; won't name any) and most classes have honors blocks. I was an honors student during my time here and the workload is tiny compared to my college workload... so I'd say this school didn't do a very good job (in that regard) in preparing me for college. 6/10 not sure if I'd do it again.", 'The school is currently adding sports related classes now that my class is graduating. The staff is hands on and very caring. I feel that there is a little bit to much of male altercations but the school aids and aps handle them very well.', 'My school is a great school, however, the name lacks interest. Students prefer to have more sport oriented classes to help learn how to coach, build teams etc. Student to teachers are very respectful and understanding. Teachers respect the athletic hours and trust they can get the work done.', "In this school theirs many sports and that's a characteristic i like, it gives students many opportunities to engage with other's. Also the teachers are very nice and help students who have struggles by staying after school.", "I've made some great friendships that I cherish", 'The students are not very involved or interested.', 'Great staff and fun programs, but very wild kids', "My overall school experience was ok. I was really disappointed that the school didn't have a lot of extracurricular dealing with careers in sports. The only thing they offer was actually playing sports not other careers.", 'I feel comfortable in the school overall, I just feel like there needs to be more girls activities.', 'A few things that makes this school unique is that it gives students the comprehensive of the value of having an education and helps all type of kids to learn better when help is needed at all time and the teachers there stays extra minutes after class or after school to go over things with their fellow students.  I would choose this school again because I gain a lot of experience here and the teachers had tough me a lot of things and has helped me a lot. The staffs and teachers always look out for their students and try to help them out at any point. The people here are great and they give a lot of different programs that can help us in the future and help us do better during our classes or something we can use in college.', "It's a pretty good school overall and definitely better than a lot of other schools in The Bronx. The staff is helpful and it seems like most of the staff and the students are serious. There are, of course, bad students, a lot of whom are able to easily manipulate some of the staff, but this issue is not as serious as it could be. My only real peeve about this school is that it's TOO sports oriented. I went into the school with dreams of being a baseball player and graduated wishing to major in Environmental Science. I feel like I would have been better prepared for life if I went to a school that put more emphasis on STEM fields, but it's too late now. \r Other than those few things, I'm glad that went to this school."]

column1: Bronx High School for Writing & Communication Arts
column2: ['BHSWCA has been a weird experience for me in a good. When I first came I really didn’t like it because it was perceived as one of the most dangerous schools in the US because of it being in evander campus. However I’ve seen the school change positively over the next 3 years. We’ve added more programs such as anime club, cooking club, and the acting program I’m in Epic theater. I’ve really enjoyed my time at evander for what it was and This being my last year it’s gonna be weird not going to 800 east Gun hill road.', 'there are only a few AP classes but they have amazing teachers who are always willing to take an extra step with you to help you succeed. Downside is that you have to share Evander campus with 5 other schools. they do not allow phones and security guards work metal detectors. Beautiful murals painted by students and their fashion show, called winterfest, is amazing. Lots of talented students performing and modeling to raise money for seniors to help pay off senior dues. This school is a proud school of diversity and everyone accepts the different cultures.', 'It was very flexible and the guidance cousalours are like friends. Not that bad overall. Very crowded tho.', 'Bronx high school for writing and communication is a great school when it comes to how the teachers teach and the academic excellence of the school. They have a set of rules which from my experience is effective for the school and the students aswell.  What i would like to see change in this school is how teachers manage to dismiss the students from their class. I believe they could handle it better. Thank you.', 'My experience with BHSWCA was one that taught me that people do have the ability to overcome the results of their past mistakes. this faculty has overlooked my errors and place of origin and not only educated me, but, taught me that there is a way to accomplish my dreams even with a not-so-perfect start.', "Throughout my duration in Bronx High School for Writing and Communication Arts, I've learned the importance of expressing yourself no matter what the topic is. It also opened many doors for me to go to college and making sure that I succeed in my future plans.", "The school overall is unorganized since various times there is even confusion and not much communication among the teachers. The students don't have many classes to really excel past the average high school student. The graduation rate is low and most of them aren't told to better. The senior year is very laid back and there isn't much to do for extra activities. Then college readiness is very slow and sloppy, most of the content and applications could have been pushed to an earlier date.", "This school that I'm in right now is not exactly what students might want to be in. Besides a bad academic system, the district that is in is not that good. more than 50% of the students are failing and i wonder why. I try my best to get 90 and above average in all my classes, but......", "As a Senior, I enjoyed my years of High School and can't believe how fast time went by. I remember as if it was just yesterday, when I was just a Freshman and really nervous in a big school with 6 schools inside, including Writing and Communication arts. As time past by, I was able to be part of something amazing  for example Epic Theater. Epic Theater is one out many after school activities that is offered to the entire school, and is really an amazing experience. By the end of the year after the performance we would wish our seniors success in college and in the future. When I graduate and go on to college, I will miss everyone in my school because they've been by my side helping me to succeed and help me to prepare for what college has in store for me. I appreciate them for everything they've done not only for me but for students with and without IEPs.", 'The core classes that we have are taught well. The few ap classes that we have are taught to the highest standard. It would be great to see a better variety.', 'There has never been a day where I felt unsafe at my school. However this is more due to the vibe that the students have rather than the security measures. The clinic is very helpful and can treat the students very well.', "I've known kids from various after school clubs in this school. The after school theater club of epic remix is a strong and happy family. our principal supports the various sports and clubs and occasionally visits. These communities are extremely positive.", "The extracurricular activities at my school are okay. I wish they offered more of a variety of different things that met the needs of other students. There's not much to choose from and that's makes it hard to want to participate in any of them.", "my experience from attending my school so far has been a rollercoaster ride. It has it's up's and it's down's but I don't think I could picture myself attending any other school. I've met a lot of new people and made friendships and bonds with a few students and bonds with teacher's also. I've grown a lot as a student and a person and have overcome so many things. If I had to do it all over again I would.", "I believe the teachers at my school are very effective in their teaching styles. Of course there are some teacher's that are better than others and every student has their favorite teacher and the teacher that they feel is just out to get them but that's normal. Every teacher at my school is different but they all come together in order to improve their lesson plans, how to incorporate different topics and lessons for student's to get a better understanding, and how to make their lesson's more interesting for student's to want to get more engaged in what's going in the classroom. Yes there are some aspects of some of my teacher's that could be improved and worked on but overall the teacher's are my school do an okay job on getting us on track for the next step in our life.", 'there are some but not a lot of people talk about them', 'its ok there are a few but not a lot of people talk about them', 'i wouldnt choose this school again if i had to. its very small and there are a lot of things that could be change', 'its OK here. there are sometimes were the teachers dont seem very interesting', 'BHSWCA is not a bad school. The students and staff are some of the kindest and most open people that i have ever met. The classes could be smaller and the availability of classes could be larger. We are so connected in one another that it feels good to go to our school. If we had more funding we would do a lot better.']
