column2: ['I am a junior(Class of 2021) at Hillside High School and I feel like they can do better. This school does not necessarily prepare us for college. This school provides work that is really what a middle schooler would do. They also do not prepare us for the Math SAT. Of course, they are improving each year but there is work that needs to be done. In conclusion, academically, students need more challenges.', "The school as a whole isn't a bad school. The teachers seem to care about the students and try to help them out. But at the same time some teachers just don't help you at all. The more newer generations that come make the school worse and I wish that could be changed for the better. Overall I wouldn't recommend the school, but I am just one person.", "Hillside High School can either be your favorite four years of school or your worst. The environment isn't the best but there's a lot of school spirit. If you decide to work hard, you will succeed. The thing I like the most is the staff. If you fail, it's honestly your fault. A large majority of the teachers will encourage you to come to tutoring to get extra help and will go out of their way to make sure you understand. It's all up to you.", 'I enjoyed how it was a small high school, so it felt more connected. However, I wish the academics were a bit better,', 'Schools has monthly brawls. Infested with rats and cockroaches. Students and teachers not supported by the board of education.', "After three years at Hillside High, I have learned a few things. I can count on my hand the number of teachers and staff that actually care about the student. The math department is one of the worst department ever to exist. The math teachers don't care about their student and they make it difficult to understand Math", 'I just graduated in 2018 and throughout my four years at Hillside High School, it was fun. I hade a great support system, my teachers, principal and guidance counselors pushed me to strive my best. I just wished there were more clubs and athletic teams added so that everyone could be involved in the school, but overall it was a good experience.', 'As a student attending HHS, I am greatly disappointed and disgusted by the level they have let the school drop. Starting off in an era of technology the wifi connection is constantly poor and student who have their own computers are not allowed to use a wifi affiliated with the school instead they must use their hotspots ( which would not be such a huge issue if their were enough computers for everyone). There is also no authority in the school anymore, students do not even comply with uniform policies and because of the lack luster security could leave and reenter school whenever they please. On top of that the school does nothing to prepare the student for college and the guidance department is of no help.', 'What  I liked about the school were the teachers.  However I disliked the students and their behavior.', 'Hillside High is a good high school. I feel safe at the school and the teachers are wonderful. The teachers care for their students. When I need help they make time for me after school or doing lunch. Hillside High school principal is amazing. My principle take her time to know all the students that goes to her school. All the students respect her.', "What I like about HillSide High school, is that it is very diverse you are able to interact with people and make friend as easy as 1,2,3. In all seriousness  Hillside High School has given me a lot of confidence for me as a sophomore that's a lot. Teachers in hillside make every thing possible for us the students to get the good grade that we deserve and for us to accomplish my goal. Changes that I would like to see is parents, being more involved to thier children who are lingering in the street and if the parent can't do such the school.  Should allow a program to help those who need the attention and focus in and out of school.", 'I really have a love-hate relationship with Hillside High School. I graduated a couple months ago and I still have mixed feelings about it. Something that really made me love the school and not want to leave was the volleyball team, African dance team, and poetry club. There were many other extracurricular activities, but these were the ones I was heavily involved in. Any program that we wanted to do the administration was always behind us. However, besides wanting to be educated those were the only things that really made me like the school. The food had its good days and the classes could have been better to prepare the students for college. In the end, I still had to give myself an extra push to do extra work and research because at a point in senior year the students are left on their own.', 'Hillside High school and the Hillside school district is terrible. They spent millions on a new field for the “State Champs” but neglect to renew online textbooks and other programs in the school. In the high school poor teacher attitudes and failing administration,  and most of all high violence rate', 'Coming to Hillside Highschool as a junior was definitely an extreme change for me. I wasn’t used to being around such a diverse group of people. Not to mention, that it’s bigger than any other school I’ve previously attended. Although the physical appearance of the building might give off an inadequate and negative first impression, we make up for it in our wide range of elective and academic courses — ranging from ROTC to Anatomy & Physiology to Literature & Film. Being apart of this community has really helped me become more social and open to trying new things.', 'Needs to focus on college readiness snd students majors. Not a bad school, just seems like the focus is on the wrong thing. Junior year students should be preparing for college and most likely knowing what they are going to do. The food is basic and needs help, administrators are annoying sometimes facility can use some work .Teachers need to work on themselves even though there are good ones. The sports teams can be better, coaching should be someone who is not a teacher .', 'I’ve experienced a little bit of everything during my career here and I must say, there is a lot to be done. The most important thing Hillside High School needs is a better college readiness circulum. HHS does not prep the students for real life situations and events. The classes available are not effective and the few electives we do have, are not fully completed courses. A lot of the classes offered at the school, are there for a title, there’s no structive learning or an actual learning process for the student. Every year it gets worst coming out of HHS being no where near prepared for college or life after high school. It’s scary what people can become without any information or guide to their next stop. One thing HHS does have though is support. Especially in the sports section of the school. People come out, donate, and try to get involved in any way they can. I believe the support is what keeps HHS going because without it, the school would be a total waste.', "It wasn't a bad high school experience. The teachers are definitely there to help. Despite the school's flip floppy policies (concerning uniform and hoodies) it's not a bad school to attend. The principal is a fun woman.", 'One thing I love about Hillside High School is the academic atmosphere that allows students to be challenged to accomplish more than their aspirations. The main thing that I would love to change bout my school is the school culture. Due to lack of school culture, I am tempted to go home instead of going to a football game.', 'Hillside had many opportunities and activities that kept my high school days very busy and filled. Of course, every experience has its flaws but I still enjoyed my time here and could not think of anywhere else where my education and personal life would be well taken care of. They cared more about the students instead of just enforcing rules and test scores. This also helped improve test scores in the long run  by keeping students physically and mentally stable.', "Hillside High School has a great education system and offers plenty of diverse classes. The teachers are very fond of their student's progress. Their is a great variety of students who participate in clubs and sports throughout the school year. The guidance department in our high school are very opportunistic to our ideas and opinions. We are in a fairly safe environment with the amount of security that is around the school."]
column4: ['I am a junior(Class of 2021) at Hillside High School and I feel like they can do better. This school does not necessarily prepare us for college. This school provides work that is really what a middle schooler would do. They also do not prepare us for the Math SAT. Of course, they are improving each year but there is work that needs to be done. In conclusion, academically, students need more challenges.', "The school as a whole isn't a bad school. The teachers seem to care about the students and try to help them out. But at the same time some teachers just don't help you at all. The more newer generations that come make the school worse and I wish that could be changed for the better. Overall I wouldn't recommend the school, but I am just one person.", "Hillside High School can either be your favorite four years of school or your worst. The environment isn't the best but there's a lot of school spirit. If you decide to work hard, you will succeed. The thing I like the most is the staff. If you fail, it's honestly your fault. A large majority of the teachers will encourage you to come to tutoring to get extra help and will go out of their way to make sure you understand. It's all up to you.", 'I enjoyed how it was a small high school, so it felt more connected. However, I wish the academics were a bit better,', 'Schools has monthly brawls. Infested with rats and cockroaches. Students and teachers not supported by the board of education.', "After three years at Hillside High, I have learned a few things. I can count on my hand the number of teachers and staff that actually care about the student. The math department is one of the worst department ever to exist. The math teachers don't care about their student and they make it difficult to understand Math", 'I just graduated in 2018 and throughout my four years at Hillside High School, it was fun. I hade a great support system, my teachers, principal and guidance counselors pushed me to strive my best. I just wished there were more clubs and athletic teams added so that everyone could be involved in the school, but overall it was a good experience.', 'As a student attending HHS, I am greatly disappointed and disgusted by the level they have let the school drop. Starting off in an era of technology the wifi connection is constantly poor and student who have their own computers are not allowed to use a wifi affiliated with the school instead they must use their hotspots ( which would not be such a huge issue if their were enough computers for everyone). There is also no authority in the school anymore, students do not even comply with uniform policies and because of the lack luster security could leave and reenter school whenever they please. On top of that the school does nothing to prepare the student for college and the guidance department is of no help.', 'What  I liked about the school were the teachers.  However I disliked the students and their behavior.', 'Hillside High is a good high school. I feel safe at the school and the teachers are wonderful. The teachers care for their students. When I need help they make time for me after school or doing lunch. Hillside High school principal is amazing. My principle take her time to know all the students that goes to her school. All the students respect her.', "What I like about HillSide High school, is that it is very diverse you are able to interact with people and make friend as easy as 1,2,3. In all seriousness  Hillside High School has given me a lot of confidence for me as a sophomore that's a lot. Teachers in hillside make every thing possible for us the students to get the good grade that we deserve and for us to accomplish my goal. Changes that I would like to see is parents, being more involved to thier children who are lingering in the street and if the parent can't do such the school.  Should allow a program to help those who need the attention and focus in and out of school.", 'I really have a love-hate relationship with Hillside High School. I graduated a couple months ago and I still have mixed feelings about it. Something that really made me love the school and not want to leave was the volleyball team, African dance team, and poetry club. There were many other extracurricular activities, but these were the ones I was heavily involved in. Any program that we wanted to do the administration was always behind us. However, besides wanting to be educated those were the only things that really made me like the school. The food had its good days and the classes could have been better to prepare the students for college. In the end, I still had to give myself an extra push to do extra work and research because at a point in senior year the students are left on their own.', 'Hillside High school and the Hillside school district is terrible. They spent millions on a new field for the “State Champs” but neglect to renew online textbooks and other programs in the school. The guidance department in our high school are very opportunistic to our ideas and opinions. We are in a fairly safe environment with the amount of security that is around the school."]
column6: ['This school is overall not a bad place. It is the people inside of the school and those who have not attended that really kill the morale of the school. The school has recently added some pretty decent programs to further the learning and understanding of students. In all my experience here has been pretty good.', 'it started out as something new and i spent more years in the highschool the corruption became more apparent and the board showed us that we are what mattered less as they worried so much about minute thing instead of more apparent problems in the school.', 'My high school experience is just being due to the fact that I am a freshman but so far I can say it is really interesting you get to join different clubs and meet new people you never thought you would meet before. You are allowed to explore your options and talents.', 'Hillside high school has many club activities to participate in. It is a great school but they lack in academics.', 'Hillside High School has been a interesting experience. The teachers are very good at their job and most of them provided me with a great education.Most of them have prepared me well for college. I have a lot of friends and have developed many great friendships. What I would want to change is the facilities of the building such as the bathroom, cafeteria, etc. They are very unsanitary and outdated', "Hillside High School wasn't very much alike compared to the surrounding high school in the towns near by. I was  lucky enough to have teacher that pushed me to the limit and made me go even further. Though the school has many patches that no one likes. Such as uniform, the school is very much a stickler for it. As well as the food which is to expensive for the type of quality we are being served.", 'Hillside High School is a good school. This is my senior year and my experience here has been nothing short of memorable. The teachers all genuinely care about the students and want us to succeed, save a few bad apples. Our principal, Christine Sidwa, is always engaging with the students and communicating with them. I am very satisfied with the education Ive received at this school. I enjoyed being challenged with AP classes and exams. Clubs are also a great part of this school. Students can make virtually any club they want which gives us a great sense of authority and freedom. As president of both Poetry Club and the Gay-Straight Alliance Club, I can confidently say that without certain club, kids would feel trapped, restricted, and hate school more than they already do, which brings me to my last point. School spirit. This school is seriously lacking and that is disappointing. No one goes to games or participates at events.', "The school wasn't bad. The teachers truly cared about the learning of students and a lot of them made it there mission to prepare students for college. One thing that wasn't good is the lack of motivation to learn from some students. The school needs to enforce staying in the class and make it harder to leave school. Then i feel like the school will be able to get better and grow.", 'The teachers at my school are extremely varying. There are teachers who go above and beyond, give extra help and stay after school to tutor students, but thereally are just as many teachers who immediately leave the school when it is over and do the bare minimum.', "The school itself is very unique in its teaching styles and how they conduct their classes but the only aspect that would change my mind about attending is the tuition and how after a while you're paying more than you thought you would.", 'Many of the teachers are very efficient at their jobs and they ensure that the student receive the knowledge they need to move on to the next level. There is not a teacher that looks for their student or students to fail.', "I love the school's enviornment", 'My teachers always engage with their students and also listen to their ideas as well.', "It's a fine a fine school to go to.", "We always do safety drills and other measures to make sure that when we are in a real situation that they are prepared and know what to do.  These drills also prepare the students as well mentally and physically so they know how to respond in a case where it can'lt only happen at school, but at home, the workplace, etc,.", 'The student-athletes do strive for the best when it comes to the extracurricular activites and other activities.  The administration support is excellent and they support their students in everything they do.  Most of these sports/ activites are fun and can also help you to be more open to new opportunities and friends as well.', "There is a lot of diversity in Hillside High School which makes it unique but is also challenging when a certain two groups clash together. My overall experience at this high school is great considering that I was involved in almost everything.  They have clubs and organizations that I thought I wouldn't be interested in but insted it turned out to be a lot of fun and that is the goal.  I don't know if I would want to go to this school again because of the environment there but for sure when it comes to the sports and activities, I am all in.", "The teachers are very relatable and do their best to help everyone.  Teachers also love going on a one-on-one basis if a student needs help or doesn't understand. Most teaching styles are hands on and the teachers correct you if you're wrong and give a reasonable explanation why your was isn't efficient. Most of the grading is consistent because they give a ruberic of what/ how they grade and their overall knowledge of the topic is excellent.  With the hardest questions, they are able to give a reasonable answer and if they don't know, they dedicate their time to look for the answer.", 'Security is basically a joke', 'Wish we had more funding for them.']

column2: ["The C.T.E. teachers are the heart of the school. I've learned so much about my trade and I'm sure others can say the same. They offer Architecture,Plumbing,Electrical,HVAC,and Plumbing. You can come out of this school certified and with a job in companies like MTA and ConEdison. Excellent internship opportunities.", 'Administration is gone down the drain. My voice (along with other students) is not heard and my needs are ignored', "My four years at this school were well received. I won't forget what I was taught and the gift that they gave me. The gift to be different. I am leaving this school with knowledge that others would die for. I will never forget my friends and teachers for I wouldn't have been able to survive without them.", 'This school prepared you to both enter the workforce and go into higher education. As the valedictorian, this school offered so much that helped shaped my future. For example, I got into a internship my third year of high school. Currently, I am still with the same company and have a bright future with this company after graduation.', 'I’m a freshman at the school my experience here at B.D.C.A is pretty good so far and I have a long way to go. Teacher are nice understand and respectful people even when they get disrespected they keep the composure and understand that we are kid and still try their best to teach us they way to life. School has a lot of opportunities such as scholarship program and a lot more.  Academically my school can do way better but for the kiss was doing good is going to make it for my school has won the skills challenge two years in a row and we are trying to make three this year  Safety is not a very big issue stuff happen all you have to do is watch your back and friends is easy to come by pat some one back and they pat yours. Me as a student I should be doing better and their is no excuses for what I did on Munich behalf but I’m ky school they are helping me fix that and get me ready for the real world', "Bronx Design & Construction Academy is a very good school for somebody to attend if they are wanting to go into the field of construction. They focus a lot on the CTE Trades such as Carpentry, Electrical, Plumbing, HVAC &  Architecture but they also focus on your main academics such as math, English and etc. I've attend this school going on 4 years now and this is my last year and I'm proud to say it's been nothing but joy. Most teachers and staff make sure you understand what's going on in the classrooms; if you need help they will tell you come after school or when you have lunch and they will sit down and help you out. The school is also very strict on attendance and with us students getting our education. What I mean by this is that if your absent the office will call your parents. Also we can't have our phones in school the deans collect our phones in the morning and when school is over you get your phone back.", 'I like the fact that this High School gets you ready for college & the real world. This High School is about construction & gets you ready for a good career.', 'All teacher at Bronx Design and Construction academy have their own teaching style. The work load depending on if the teacher thought it was need. However, you was sure to get an assignment at least one a day.', 'The school was just basic, in my opinion', 'I gave this rating because I feel like if the school had more funding we would have been and to do more then what was done when I attended. We had so many great ideas but could not complete them all due to lack of funds.', "I never would really interact with any other parent that I didn't know. However when I came to my friends and I's parents it was clear to see that they cared for our education.", 'The teachers at the Bronx Design and Construction Academy are very dedicated to the work that they do. Not only do they adjust lessons to fit the class needs but they all so make themselves available in and outside off the classroom.', 'I feel safe and feel protected', 'Gives time for students to catch up with work and as well as get torturing.', 'The relationships that are built are unforgettable and make positive changes on your personality.', 'All teachers have different  backgrounds and styles of teaching']

["Something that I liked about High School for Excellence and Innovation it's the fact that they make the school feel like if it was your second house because almost everybody knows each other. Something I'll like to see change, it's that I'll like them to see them challenge more the students, thus we can be more prepare for college.", 'High School for Excellence and Innovation has its school nurse office. If a student has not received their required vaccines to enroll in school, HSEI gives the opportunity to students to get vaccinated at their same school building. Also, students are able to get their physical check-ups, eye exams and tests for sexual transmitted diseases. Bullying is not permitted and the prevention for it is taken very seriously.  School Safety Guards are present in the school building to ensure organization and safety among the school community. I feel secure in my school because I know the measurements that they implement to keep it a safe place to be in.', 'High School for Excellence and Innovations presents many opportunities to its students to engage in social works, knowledge expansion and school community. This school offers tutoring to prepare for the Regents, exams required by the New York State to be able to graduate. Public Color was a sponsor in our school as an after-school program to paint the school and improve school appearance. Also, the Neighborhood Developing Area is presented, as an internship program for students who seek to be involved in community service and benefit from work skills development. This school also encourages their athletic students the to be part of the Softball Team and Baseball Team and represent the name of our school team in sport competitions: HSEI Gators.', 'This school provides so much support for the students', 'The teachers are this school are very helpful and know how to supporr and encourage students.', "Renaissance Charter school of innovation is a really unique school. It's unique for one because it's a charter school with days off that are different from student in public schools. Also Innovation has enrichment week which students can take advantage of and go to places out of the country.", 'I absolutely loved my time here. Everyone is super friendly and helpful', 'because quality review did not went too well  2 years ago \r', 'same old food 3x a week that is bad little bit of food to students', 'high school for excellence and innovation is always very good at teachers and the way they work hard for us students also the elective class is also fantastic and also they are regents prep classes.', 'because when  they practice for a sports games sometimes they win in second place fun options are thanksgiving party is fun,Christmas party is also fun filled day is also very well and organized, Halloween party nice,', 'some times they are strict other times they just let thing slide a lot', "because sometimes some of the staff know what is going on other times they don't.technology is always available for the students guidance counselor is always there to assist students with what they need in terms of academics and career everyday.college prep resources are available from our  adviser regents prep is always available for students who fail certain regents in every subject from math,science,us history,global history,ela the parent involvement is good", "because sometimes there be kids that they don't want to participate because they don't have their equipment like shorts,sweatpants,sneakers and etc...the school spirit is high and sometimes it is low.fitness programs is also good", 'ok but not all that good', "there is some peer pressure that goes on in hsei but student that are mature and know how to control themselves think before they get themselves involved in anything.students faces through challenges all the tine in high school for excellence and innovation some of them gets accomplished very good there be others that don't get accomplish quit well", "i like the way that they teach but i don't like the classroom management some are very good communicating with the kids they are knowledge of the lesson very well"]

['It was a good school. Teachers that cares for the student, classes are easy to understand and school environment is fun to be around.', "Its an okay school. Very small, feels more like you're in a a middle school building. The teachers are great.", 'It is a small school so there is not many opportunities clubs and organizations', 'My experience was okay most of the teachers are great my favorite  experience was when we took a physics class and went to six flags they connected learning with fun', 'Most of the teachers are very helpful and care about the students and also help with stuff other than classroom situations', 'The school offers little to no extracurricular opportunities.', "My experience at this school was interesting. I didn't hate it, but I haven't enjoyed it either. The school is probably one of the smallest high schools in Brooklyn. If I had to do it all over again, I don't think I would go to that school again. I feel like it held me back more than it pushed me forward.", 'The teachers at this school all have unique teaching styles that I believe all work in teaching students the lessons appropriately as well as getting certain points across.', 'The work was never challenging', "I believe that Arts Media Prep is a good school and the teachers their try more than their best to help the students. Arts Media prep is a very small school but everyone know each other and overall the experience at Arts Media Prep introduces you how the world is. Knowing that things aren't just given to you they have the most hands on teachers who help you reach your Goal.", 'My last day of school was actually sad and it shocked me. Realizing I was moving on to a new chapter in life maybe me a little sad but also happy. My best experiences from attending this school was meeting some of the best people ever: the people that are now my friends and the teachers who are like another mother or father. When it came to my school work, all of my teachers stayed "on top" of me about completing assignments, which showed me they genuinely cared and still care.', 'I never liked school lunch. The fruits are good, the only thing I ever ate from the school.', "I don't honestly know much about the discipline in the school because I have never been suspended in the school. I know for lateness, you will get detention after school on Wednesdays.", 'The fan support the boys basketball team receives is awesome.', "The communication I've reached from the teachers were outstanding.", 'The afterschool clubs were/are filled with fun.', "In this school one thing I can say is that no matter where you're from, and whatever your background, you'll always receive respect and make friends. Even if your African you'd make a Puerto Rican friend or a Caucasian friend. We all respect each other, but then you have those bullies that are very minor and little that tries to bash the way they might dress, or talk or even how they see them praising their worshipper based on movies and etc.", "The new principal Deborah Glauner is VERY strict and she believes in having everything go her way and not hear others opinions. The old principal Robert Hall may not have done a lot of things but he compromised with the students when it came down to getting things done in the school, for the school, and for the students. He made sure that he spoke to everyone about their grades one on one and worked with them towards making them better. She doesn't do any of these things.", 'This school used to offer after school programs for in and outside of school. Now they offer roughly about 5 different programs inside school for after school "clubs". I am currently attending a after school program I\'ve been attending for the past two years now called JumpstART which is a program of the Joan Mitchell foundation. And am now attending one of the 5 clubs in school after school called drama club, which is terrific by the way because of the teacher and the participants in it.', 'There is nothing to do but sports']

Very small, feels more like you're in a a middle school building. The teachers are great.", 'It is a small school so there is not many opportunities clubs and organizations', 'My experience was okay most of the teachers are great my favorite  experience was when we took a physics class and went to six flags they connected learning with fun', 'Most of the teachers are very helpful and care about the students and also help with stuff other than classroom situations', 'The school offers little to no extracurricular opportunities.', "My experience at this school was interesting. I didn't hate it, but I haven't enjoyed it either. The school is probably one of the smallest high schools in Brooklyn. If I had to do it all over again, I don't think I would go to that school again. I feel like it held me back more than it pushed me forward.", 'The teachers at this school all have unique teaching styles that I believe all work in teaching students the lessons appropriately as well as getting certain points across.', 'The work was never challenging', "I believe that Arts Media Prep is a good school and the teachers their try more than their best to help the students. Arts Media prep is a very small school but everyone know each other and overall the experience at Arts Media Prep introduces you how the world is. Knowing that things aren't just given to you they have the most hands on teachers who help you reach your Goal.", 'My last day of school was actually sad and it shocked me. Realizing I was moving on to a new chapter in life maybe me a little sad but also happy. My best experiences from attending this school was meeting some of the best people ever: the people that are now my friends and the teachers who are like another mother or father. When it came to my school work, all of my teachers stayed "on top" of me about completing assignments, which showed me they genuinely cared and still care.', 'I never liked school lunch. The fruits are good, the only thing I ever ate from the school.', "I don't honestly know much about the discipline in the school because I have never been suspended in the school. I know for lateness, you will get detention after school on Wednesdays.", 'The fan support the boys basketball team receives is awesome.', "The communication I've reached from the teachers were outstanding.", 'The afterschool clubs were/are filled with fun.', "In this school one thing I can say is that no matter where you're from, and whatever your background, you'll always receive respect and make friends. Even if your African you'd make a Puerto Rican friend or a Caucasian friend. We all respect each other, but then you have those bullies that are very minor and little that tries to bash the way they might dress, or talk or even how they see them praising their worshipper based on movies and etc.", "The new principal Deborah Glauner is VERY strict and she believes in having everything go her way and not hear others opinions. The old principal Robert Hall may not have done a lot of things but he compromised with the students when it came down to getting things done in the school, for the school, and for the students. He made sure that he spoke to everyone about their grades one on one and worked with them towards making them better. She doesn't do any of these things.", 'This school used to offer after school programs for in and outside of school. Now they offer roughly about 5 different programs inside school for after school "clubs". I am currently attending a after school program I\'ve been attending for the past two years now called JumpstART which is a program of the Joan Mitchell foundation. And am now attending one of the 5 clubs in school after school called drama club, which is terrific by the way because of the teacher and the participants in it.', 'There is nothing to do but sports']
column6: ["The teachers here are very knowledgeable on the subjects that that teacher and even others that they don't. They communicate effectively with students and us teaching styles that work for them. Some teachers approach this the wrong way but most teachers know what they're doing. Grading consistency depends on the teacher but some policies such as late work are too lenient. They are occasionally available outside of class and show interest in student success", 'School spirit is non-existent except for those with friends or family who play sports. Those who do play sports and their supporters seem to be happy with them. A fitness center is not available but there is a shared gym for gym periods.', "This school does not have its own nurse. It shares a nurse with a middle school on the first floor of the building. The nurse usually provides students with band-aids and ice which is useless in most situations. Security guards are present on campus but are pretty useless. Due to the surrounding area, the school wouldn't be considered safe but I do not feel threatened by things in the school such as other students.", "The policies that students are required follow on basis are usually attendance and dress code since bullying isn't a huge problem here. Lateness is treated with detention but students don't have a single problem with detention and don't mind having it. Dress code is frequently disregarded but the crackdown on dress code has gone down severely. Administration is helpful academic wise and personally due to their close involvement with students.", 'The benefit of the size of the school is how close-knit most people are. Of course there will be people who do not favor you but there is a place for everyone here. The school is not very diverse but is very accepting of those of different origins and  sexual orientation.', 'Honestly, I should\'ve transferred from this school. This school is not for those who expect to get the most out of high school and prepare to go to notable universities but rather for those who need to pass. However, I do not feel as much regret as you would think because the experience has been pretty from school trips to amusement parks, school events, meeting great friends and teachers. Although this school has not fulfilled its name of "Arts and Media", the experience isn\'t so bad if you do the things you need to do and more.\r Personally, I wouldn\'t pick this school due to how limited it is. A lack of extracurriculars, AP classes and being gifted with four flights of stairs is a huge draw back for someone such as myself and I would not pick this school again.', 'The building is shared with another school so this school is a four floor walkup. This school is equipped with Macbooks, iMacs, cameras and iPads for student usage and are  up-to-date as well. Guidance counselors seem to change but they are helpful nonetheless. Tutoring is available after school but is mostly for regents prep. SAT Prep here was awful and was not helpful at all.', "Activity Periods, which were the periods we'd use for extracurriculars and clubs, were cut from our schedules in the 2013 school year. This school no longer offers many clubs but I know that Community Service and Model UN are still around. Extracurricular opportunities are now really limited and unavailable unless pushed for by students. The school also offers some sports like Basketball or Soccer or Cheerleading. I am unsure of the quality of the sports but the many clubs are now unavailable.", 'Handles the students well and uses good judgement. Administration does not tolerate misbehavior and quickly cracks down on whoever breaks the rules so that the school environment is kept in order. ', 'Small space but enough for students to enjoy.', 'Everyone is like family and its easy to get help.', 'The rules are very strict on dressing. ', 'The teachers are very nice. They explain their work fully so that all students will understand.', "The school behavior is pleasant, thank god we don't have bullying.", 'We have \rOtis of extracurricular activities. Us students join much clubs as possible. These clubs include the book club, model UN, cheerleading and the committee. ', 'My school sports are fun and entertaining. Most students participate. We make sure it is fun. We make competitions. We have cheerleading, basketball, volleyball, tennis, hockey, etc. ', 'The academics that are offered are quit simple. There are honors available and advanced regents of students choices. ', 'My school is great. The teachers , deans and principal are friendly and welcoming. Bathe help with our problems and ensure that we are safe and happy in our school. My friends are funny but are motivators. They push me in to getting my work done and staying away from problems.', "My school is very small and welcoming. My school doesn't have violence or any of that sort. we communicate with each other, every one is nice to each other.  We obey all rules. ", 'The teachers at Arts And Media Prep Academy are very friendly. Many of them are young and most students can relate to them. Their teaching styles are great, they communicate very well and their grading system is ok.']

column2: ['Ferris High School is filled with a community of faculty members who care about their students, the relationships and bonds we build with the people who we rely on for guidance stepping into the mysteries of the future and the bigger world was an experience I can never take for granted. Education can be self-taught, but knowledge and guidance, steers children to take a much stronger path. Thank you to the faculty for reminding your children how valuable we can are, to our community and the larger world.', "Even though this school has a vast amount of diversity, there are so many errors that make my time spent here such a waste of time.  First of all, this school has unprofessional staff that always reminds students to do things right at the last moment, for example, the lack of reminding community service hours beforehand. Secondly, cheating is soo bad in this school that even the students in the top ranks of the graduating class have done it multiple times, and even myself.   Another reason is that there is a lack of challenge for the students, and when they get that really challenging teacher or course they don't try, and just whine like children.  Also, it's too easy to get an A or 90% average from particular teachers that mostly sit all day on their desks and just give a long packet to the student.  Lastly, this isn't the school for pursuing a college education, because only a really small fraction can help you in that.", 'I loved my experience in Ferris high school. It was a really good three years and I am so sad that is gonna be my last year at the school. I really like all of my teachers, and how they helped me through out the years to become who I am today. I am so great full that I am one of the students at Ferris high school. I would like to see change at the guidance councilors and how they could help the students more with their applications for the collages. I love everyone in my school. It was really happy 4 years. James J Ferris High School it is my pleasure to be part of the school. Thank you so much for everything you providing to us as students.', 'My four years at this high school shaped who I am as a person in college. After graduating with a high gpa, I realized they do not prepare you well because all I learned was that if I did my homework and studied prior to a class, I would get an A in that class. But it is nothing like that in college, you have to try your hardest and sometimes even that is not enough. The curriculum taught at this high school should be changed and improved for the younger generations.', 'It was a good school to attend,the teachers take their time to teach and sport was a good activity to be active.The one thing that may need to be change is the level of security for the safety of teachers and students.', "average school, not the best but not the worst either. It's okay. There are bilingual programs for students whose first language is not English and that is very helpful.", 'I like Ferris High School for its diversity and the college preparation program that help ESL students to overcome their language.', "First of all, I didn't even want to go to this school in the first place. My time in this school was not terrible but it was definitely not great either. Fights would occur often. Food was bad. Ninth graders couldn't go out for lunch. Most staffs were not that friendly. The teachers were mediocre. Dirty restrooms. Not a very diverse school either.", "More options for AP Classes and better communication between counselors and students. Mandatory meetings would be a pain but helpful since many kids don't know they're missing Community service hours or sometimes credits until their senior year when graduation talk begins which is usually too late for the latter. Wish we were more informed about scholarship opportunities; everyone just needs to be more involved, both students and faculty.", 'The Honors and A.P. Classes actually push students to constantly use critical thinking and interpret a new way of thinking. There are teachers who develop close professional bonds with students that help them succeed as an individual.', "James J. Ferris High School is a beautiful school  with nice teachers. The  students are really helpful and friendly, and actually show an interest in learning the things that are taught.There are very few things and like to see change, but I would be pleased if the school menu offered a little more options per day. Also, helping new students integrate easier is something I'd like them to do, because when I transferred, I did my best of course, but I did have a couple of difficulties adapting.", 'After attending James J Ferris High School for four years i can say it was a great experience. It was very diverse and offered a vast amount of opportunities. My guidance counselor was the best and always there for each and every student. I received an amazing education and much preparation for college.', 'James J. Ferris highschool is very diverse. The teachers take an interest in each student and wants them to achieve greatness.', 'James J. ferris high school is not an easy word to be said. School of the bulldogs, school of success, school of culture, many language is spoken in the school.', "Are you kidding me right now? How can anyone in their right mind enjoy their time here? They basically ruined me. They complain about apathy when they're the ones causing it! Now I'm too upset to say anything else.", 'My High School experience as Ferris high school was better than what I could have ever imagined. I have made new friends from all walks of life and would not replace them for anything. My teachers challenge me because they know I can do better. That has helped me progress not only academically but also as a person overall. There are many opportunities for students to get involved whether it be in clubs, sports or during school activities. I play volleyball and basketball for my school which as thought me that there is more to life then just academics.   ', "This school is safe, is one of the best schools in jersey. There is no problem's berry 1 present. Teachers are so good to sudents, teachers have a lot of experience and a lot of respect to students. I love this school because of the good way teachers treat me.", 'My overal experiences at ferris have been ecstatic but I have seen my shares my struggles and obstacles. I strongly believe that I can make a difference in my community but I have financial struggles and I believe that the key to success is through education. So please help me out by giving me this money to use for college tuition.', "Teachers try to have clubs but students didn't really care for it. Most students liked sports more. The sport teams always had free stuff and had a good leeway for things. Coaches would make sure students pass class somehow.", 'If I could start all over again I would go to a school that actually teaches. Our school barely had funding. There were no SAT reviews that was of quality. The school cared mostly for students to pass the easy HSPA exams because that was the only hope students could pass The school should have stronger discipline. This high school did not prepare me for college, It was so easy to get  an A in every class. I sometimes wonder if I went to a better high school would I be better in college. Though to be fair, there were some teachers who encouraged us to live a better life and make it with even the littlest we can get in life. This helped me to strive no matter what environment I am in.']

Though to be fair, there were some teachers who encouraged us to live a better life and make it with even the littlest we can get in life. This helped me to strive no matter what environment I am in.']
column6: ["Only a few teachers maybe like 6 teachers I ever had in this high school would care to teach for students. The school environment were bad filled with delinquents. A lot of African American or Hispanic students gang or clique (not all) pick on the smart students mostly from Asian or Middle Eastern background. They were always disruptive in class and made teachers start to not to care about teaching. Some teachers had favorites and failed students on purpose. The guidance counselors were very biased on who should graduate or not. The GPA system rarely updated. A student can graduate as number 1 senior year but they would not be valedictorian because the system only counts from freshmen to junior year. I had to try my best to survive in this school to not easily offend people and go home right away. It was a dangerous environment. Teachers weren't as helpful. This is why I sometimes feel we should eliminate the tenure system. After the tenure, teachers don't care.", 'Everything is manageable in this school.', "There's a bit of peer pressure and non-accepting.", 'The sports aspect is great, not really much clubs.', 'The teachers are great, but the students can be off', "Teachers know how to relate what they're teaching to the real world. If you need help, they would go out of their way to help you, if you say something. They ask questions and are always interested in students opinions as well.", 'The great experience at Ferris high school include getting students prepared for State testing. The school held weekend classes to expand students knowledge so they can score high on the HSPA.', 'The teachers at this school vary. None are perfect but some are qualified teachers in a sense, they know how to teach and genuinely care about the students. Some lack some of these qualities however, I feel like they can grow fro the experience as a teacher to become better.', 'I have yet to experience anything memorable and I am already a senior. In my freshman year, my first open house that I brought my parents to was the last. I saw no parents the last time I went to an Open House. My parents stopped caring about my grades because I know they were disappointed in me because of it.', "I've had bad teachers in the past. Come on, not all of the teachers here a great. Lucky for them the bad ones I had are already gone. The school just started to care more about the freshman and sophomore kids lately. Just, stop it.", 'Not all parent are willing to get involved but some do.', 'Bullying is a issue that the school covers quickly, which is enforce an anti bully policy.', 'there are a lot of sports to play most popular was basketball, volleyball and football.', 'overall this school is great its a variety of  clubs, organizations and teachers that care. before graduating i had the best experience including the clubs, the courses i was taking and the loving teachers that actually care about you. even though the prinicipal did not really care much nor helped.', 'Attending james J Ferris was a terrific experience even though i struggled at first , i was able to adapt quickly. The teachers are there for you whenever needed.', "It's a great school with good programs and great teachers", "Although I have my days where I feel as though I don't want to be at this school. I have gained plenty of unforgettable opportunities here that I would not take back but would redo them over again, I met many people whom I grown very close too. This school has opened plenty doors and help students achieve the goals they have in order to get on with their future careers.", 'The school is very strict based upon the rules that were made to be followed. But because the school is pushing for a perfect school not many of the students follow. And we may find ourselves getting in trouble for little to impossible things that should not be looked upon as wrong.', "Many students enjoy playing the large variety of sports that are available in the school. The team's work very good alongside each other. But our school spirit is low only because some of our sports teams suck so bad that people don't find it worth it to attend the games.", "The teachers in Ferris are actively engage with the students. When they are available they use their time to help students out with things they are struggling with. Some teachers teach in a way were we actively understand what is going on as well as having fun in the classroom. Whereas other's just stand in front and teach for 10 minutes and then are quiet for the rest of the class period. Just as students there are a wide variety of teachers that student are comfortable enough to hang around during free periods. Being able to confide in teachers but also talk to them on a friendship level in what students need. We come to school for a mentor but also a friend. The grading on the other hand may not be as friendly as the communication level. But it's not as rough as if they are just giving us the work and grading it based on how perfect we have to write."]
